original: gal te tho ba dang char dag la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po dag yod pas gang yang rung bas nges par 'jig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tho ba dang char dag la sogs pa 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po dag yod pas gang yang rung bas nges par 'jig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that many causes of destruction exist for a hammer, rain, etc., and that something is definitely destroyed by any one of them, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po de dag kyang 'jig par byed pa la rang rang gi rkyen nye ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po de dag kyang 'jig par byed pa la rang rang gi rkyen nye ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that many causes of destruction exist, then because they are dependent on their own conditions to perform the action of destruction,

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: they are dependent on other causes.

original: 'jig par byed par nges pa med de gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig par byed par nges pa med de gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not definite in performing the action of destruction, like dye on cloth.

original: 'jig pa rgyus gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyus gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdestruction is maintained by a cause‚Äù means that it is dependent on other causes.

original: de 'bras bur brjod pa ni 'jig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'bras bur brjod pa ni 'jig pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is said to be the effect‚Äù means that it is destruction itself.

original: ma nges pa ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is indefinite because it is dependent on other causes.

original: yang rgyus gnas pa ni gtan tshigs kyis gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang rgyus gnas pa ni gtan tshigs kyis gzhag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúmaintained by a cause‚Äù is established by reasoning.

original: rtags kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtags kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence?

original: 'bras bur brjod pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur brjod pa ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is said to be the effect‚Äù means that it is produced.

original: rtags de ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: rtags de ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: That evidence is indefinite.

original: 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because destruction depends on another cause.

original: / de lta bas na 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas smra ba'i //
analyzed: / de lta bas na 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas smra ba'i //
translated: Therefore, for those who maintain that destruction has a cause,

original: rgyu dang rtags dang de dag nges pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: rgyu dang rtags dang de dag nges pa ma yin nyid //
translated: The cause, the sign, and their ascertainment are not tenable.

original: dngos po 'di rang yod pa tsam las gzhan pa'i rgyu la 'jig pa mi ltos na dngos po de la 'jig pa de 'byung bar nges te /
analyzed: dngos po 'di rang yod pa tsam las gzhan pa'i rgyu la 'jig pa mi ltos na dngos po de la 'jig pa de 'byung bar nges te /
translated: If this thing does not depend on another cause for its destruction, apart from its own mere existence, then that destruction of that thing would definitely occur,

original: rang yod pa tsam gyi rgyus 'jig pa de'i rgyu tshang ba'i @217b phyir ro //
analyzed: rang yod pa tsam gyi rgyus 'jig pa de'i rgyu tshang ba'i @217b phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of that destruction is complete, the cause of its own mere existence.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig de yod gzhan ltos med //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig de yod gzhan ltos med //
translated: That which exists without depending on another

original: de dag de yod la nges yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag de yod la nges yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Is ascertained to exist in that.

original: dngos po nus pa la sogs pa ni sa bon la sogs pa rdzas tshogs pa rnams rgyu gzhan du gyur pa la ltos pa de bzhin du gang la yang 'jig pa ltos pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po nus pa la sogs pa ni sa bon la sogs pa rdzas tshogs pa rnams rgyu gzhan du gyur pa la ltos pa de bzhin du gang la yang 'jig pa ltos pa med do //
translated: Things such as potency are collections of substances such as seeds that depend on other causes. In the same way, destruction does not depend on anything.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: In that, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the collection of seeds and so on.

original: mtha'i tshogs pa ni ma tshang ba yang med pa la bar chad kyang byar med de rang skyed par grub zin pa'i phyir bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mtha'i tshogs pa ni ma tshang ba yang med pa la bar chad kyang byar med de rang skyed par grub zin pa'i phyir bar chad bya bar mi nus so //
translated: And the final assembly is not incomplete, and it is not possible to obstruct it, because it is already established as generating itself, it is not possible to obstruct it.

original: de yang mtha'i tshogs pa ni nges par 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i skabs su smras pa dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mtha'i tshogs pa ni nges par 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i skabs su smras pa dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: And the final assembly is definitely endowed with a result, as was stated in the context of the syllogism of nonobservation.

original: gal te ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mtha'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mtha'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThat which is called ‚Äòwithout reliance‚Äô is the final assembly,‚Äù

original: de ni nges par 'bras bu skyed par smras pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni nges par 'bras bu skyed par smras pa'i phyir /
translated: then you are saying that it definitely generates a result.

original: nas kyi sa bon tshogs pa mthar thug pa yang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa ma yin nam ste s'a lu'i myu gu'i rkyen sa bon dang chu la sogs pa rnams nus pa mthar thug pa nye ba'i phyir ltos pa med pa dang / gags nus pa med pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon tshogs pa mthar thug pa yang s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa ma yin nam ste s'a lu'i myu gu'i rkyen sa bon dang chu la sogs pa rnams nus pa mthar thug pa nye ba'i phyir ltos pa med pa dang / gags nus pa med pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But is the final assembly of barley seeds not the producer of a rice sprout? Because the conditions of a rice sprout, such as the seed and water, are close, they have reached their full potential, and therefore they are without reliance, and because they are without the capacity to obstruct.

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Its nature is the nature of generating a rice sprout.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon no //
translated: the seed of rice.

original: de la ltos te s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa yin na de ni ma tshang ba de'i phyir ltos pas mi ltos pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de la ltos te s'a lu'i myu gu skyed pa yin na de ni ma tshang ba de'i phyir ltos pas mi ltos pa nyid med do //
translated: If it is the producer of the rice sprout in dependence on that, then it is incomplete, and therefore, because of dependence, there is no independence.

original: gal te sa bon dang chu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mthar thug pa yin na yang de'i rang bzhin ltos pa de lta na'o //
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang chu la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mthar thug pa yin na yang de'i rang bzhin ltos pa de lta na'o //
translated: If the collection of seed, water, etc. is final, then the nature of that is dependent.

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: That very nature is impermanent.

original: de byas pa dang yod pa la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de byas pa dang yod pa la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case for the existent.

original: byas pa de dag kyang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang bzhin gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: byas pa de dag kyang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang bzhin gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir la /
translated: Those that are produced also have another nature that is dependent on destruction.

original: byas pa dang yod pa de yang yod pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa dang yod pa de yang yod pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin no //
translated: And that existence that is produced is not the existent that is subject to destruction.

original: de'i phyir byas pa nyid ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nges pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir byas pa nyid ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nges pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because production itself is dependent, impermanence is not ascertained.

original: rgyu'i nus pa nges pa can te rgyu nus pa mi 'dra bas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa nges pa can te rgyu nus pa mi 'dra bas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The power of the cause is definite. It is produced by the cause that is not similar in power.

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te rgyu'i nus pa ji lta bar ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te rgyu'i nus pa ji lta bar ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the intrinsic identity of the cause, because it is the unmixed identity of the cause‚Äôs power.

original: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par nges pa'i don gyi mchan nyid tha dad pa nyid ni rgyu med pa can du mi rigs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tha dad par nges pa'i don gyi mchan nyid tha dad pa nyid ni rgyu med pa can du mi rigs te /
translated: The intrinsic identity of the object of a definite meaning that is definitely different by intrinsic reality is not tenable without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa la ni gang la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa la ni gang la yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because without a cause, it would not depend on anything.

original: rgyu'i yul dang dus dang rdzas nges pa la ltos pa mi rigs pa'i phyir la /üîΩdngos po @218a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i yul dang dus dang rdzas nges pa la ltos pa mi rigs pa'i phyir la / dngos po @218a * //
translated: It is not tenable that it depends on the cause‚Äôs definite object, time, and substance,

original: rnams ni ltos pa nyid du tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams ni ltos pa nyid du tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things are established by valid cognition as dependent.

original: de'i phyir nas dang s'a lu'i sa bon dag gi nus pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag ni rang gi rgyu nus pa tha dad pa dag las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nas dang s'a lu'i sa bon dag gi nus pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag ni rang gi rgyu nus pa tha dad pa dag las byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intrinsic identity of the seed and rice seed, which are different by the identity of their power, arises from their own causes, which are different in power.

original: de bzhin 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang yod pa 'di la ni yang ngo//
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang yod pa 'di la ni yang ngo//
translated: ‚ÄúJust so here‚Äù means that this is also the case for the produced and the existent.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu 'dis na ni byas pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can du skye la gzhan las ni rtag par ro zhes nges pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu 'dis na ni byas pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can du skye la gzhan las ni rtag par ro zhes nges pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: Because of this cause, that which is produced arises with the characteristic of destruction, but from another cause it is permanent.

original: rgyu'i dbye bar smra bar byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye bar smra bar byos shig pa'o //
translated: You should state the reason for this certainty, i.e., the reason for the division of causes.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sde ba dag na re skye ba can de skyes pa rnams 'jag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sde ba dag na re skye ba can de skyes pa rnams 'jag pa yin gyi /
translated: Members of our own Buddhist school and other schools say: That which has arising is produced and then destroyed.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams dang ; sa dang chu la sogs pa rtags pa'i rdzas rnams ni skye ba med pa'i phyir 'jig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams dang ; sa dang chu la sogs pa rtags pa'i rdzas rnams ni skye ba med pa'i phyir 'jig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But unconditioned phenomena and substances that are destroyed, such as earth, water, and so on, are not destroyed because they do not arise.

original: skye ba 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye ba 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Arising is not the cause of destruction.

original: skye ba nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising itself has the nature of destruction.

original: gal te de nyid kyi phyir skye ba can 'jig ma skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi phyir skye ba can 'jig ma skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because of that, that which has arising is destroyed, but that which is not arisen is not,

original: 'o na ni 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig go zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig go zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that it is destroyed because it is destroyed.

original: rtags ma grub pa'am don med do //
analyzed: rtags ma grub pa'am don med do //
translated: The reason is not established or it is meaningless.

original: gal te rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is destroyed because it has a nature,

original: rang bzhin nges pa zhes bya ba yang de ltar nges pa skyed pa'i rgyu las yin gyi rgyu med par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges pa zhes bya ba yang de ltar nges pa skyed pa'i rgyu las yin gyi rgyu med par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: then the so-called definite nature is also produced from a cause that generates a definite nature, but it is not tenable that it is without a cause.

original: de lta bas na skye ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir des 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nges par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir des 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nges par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since arising is not the cause of destruction, it cannot establish the definite nature of the effect.

original: tshogs pa mtha' dag ma mthong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag gis so //
analyzed: tshogs pa mtha' dag ma mthong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag gis so //
translated: Because the totality of the collection is not seen, that is, by those who are not omniscient.

original: mthong na rtags ni don med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: mthong na rtags ni don med do zhes ston to //
translated: If it were seen, the reason would be pointless.

original: gal te don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa dngos po med pa yin pa de lta na gzugs med par lhag ma med par 'jug pa'i mtha'i skad cig ma dang rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa med pas /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa dngos po med pa yin pa de lta na gzugs med par lhag ma med par 'jug pa'i mtha'i skad cig ma dang rang gi 'bras bu bskyed pa med pas /
translated: If the absence of a thing is empty of the capacity to perform a function, then the final moment of the meditative development of the form realm, which is without remainder, and which does not generate its own effect,

original: dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: would be reduced to the absurd consequence of being a non-thing.

original: sems can gyi grangs nyid du skad cig ma gzhan nye bar mi len bya ba ni srid par nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir srid pa tha ma zhes bya ba sta /
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs nyid du skad cig ma gzhan nye bar mi len bya ba ni srid par nyid mtshams mi sbyor ba'i phyir srid pa tha ma zhes bya ba sta /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey do not take up another moment of life equal to the number of sentient beings‚Äù means that they do not link up with another existence because they are in their last existence.

original: byang chub chen por sems bskyed pas tshul gzhan gyis gnas par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por sems bskyed pas tshul gzhan gyis gnas par 'dod pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúbodhisattvas‚Äù because they have generated the mind of great enlightenment and they are called ‚Äúabiding in another way‚Äù because they abide in a different way.

original: shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rje btsun thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rje btsun thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: They are ‚Äúomniscient lords‚Äù because they pervade all objects of knowledge.

original: de'i ye shes la nus pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes la nus pa yod pa ste /
translated: They have ‚Äúpower‚Äù in their gnosis.

original: de'i smon nas shes ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i smon nas shes ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the object of their knowledge through prayer.

original: @218b khams gzhan te 'dod pa'am gzugs na'o //
analyzed: @218b khams gzhan te 'dod pa'am gzugs na'o //
translated: They are ‚Äúin another realm‚Äù in the desire or form realms.

original: de dag ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag gi sems la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag gi sems la yang ngo //
translated: They are ‚Äúin the minds of others‚Äù who are not omniscient.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pas gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i mtha'i sems la ched du ma gtang na nus pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pas gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i mtha'i sems la ched du ma gtang na nus pa med do zhe na /
translated: If the omniscient one does not focus on the mind at the end of existence in the formless realm, he does not have power.

original: gdul ba'i rgyud dam dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi chos gcig ma shes na yang ngo //
analyzed: gdul ba'i rgyud dam dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi chos gcig ma shes na yang ngo //
translated: They are ‚Äúin the minds of others‚Äù who do not know one phenomenon of the continuum of the one to be trained or the state of an existent.

original: gang dag bya ba byed pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni tha ma'i sems de yang srid pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i bya ba mi byed kyang /
analyzed: gang dag bya ba byed pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni tha ma'i sems de yang srid pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i bya ba mi byed kyang /
translated: Because it performs the function of producing.üîΩThe final mind does not perform the function of linking with the next existence,

original: sems kyi rgyun gzhan gyis gnas pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gzhan gyis gnas pa'i bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: but it performs the function of maintaining the continuum of mind,

original: byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as generating the mind of great enlightenment.

original: yang na sngar bshad pa dag mi byed kyang rkyen ma tshang bas yin gyi nus pa med pas ni ma yin te rkyen tshang na byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sngar bshad pa dag mi byed kyang rkyen ma tshang bas yin gyi nus pa med pas ni ma yin te rkyen tshang na byed pa nyid do //
translated: Or, even though it does not perform the functions previously explained, it does not lack the ability to do so, because the conditions are incomplete, but when the conditions are complete, it does perform them.

original: sngon nas byed na sngon sdod pa ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas phyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngon nas byed na sngon sdod pa ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin pas phyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it performed them previously, it would not perform them later, because it would be by nature something that does not perform them.

original: gal te ltos pa dang bcas so zhe na bshad zin te /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa dang bcas so zhe na bshad zin te /
translated: If you say it is dependent, that has been explained.

original: rig byed rtag pa ltos pas rtag pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni phan par nus la /
analyzed: rig byed rtag pa ltos pas rtag pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni phan par nus la /
translated: The permanent Vedas are permanent by nature, because they are dependent.

original: rang las gzhan na ni de ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rang las gzhan na ni de ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: If they were different from themselves, what would they be?

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIts nature‚Äù means the nature of the agent.

original: de'i rang bzhin rtag pa de yod bzhin du 'bras bu'i cig car byas nas phyis mi byed pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rtag pa de yod bzhin du 'bras bu'i cig car byas nas phyis mi byed pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is illogical for an existent to act once and then not act again later,

original: phyis yang byed pa na ni cig car byed par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩyang na skye ba can ni byas pa yin pas byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces bya bar phung po dang khams dang skye mched tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis yang byed pa na ni cig car byed par mi 'gyur ro // yang na skye ba can ni byas pa yin pas byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces bya bar phung po dang khams dang skye mched tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: if it acts again later, it will not act once.üîΩOr, since that which is produced is produced, all that is produced is impermanent.

original: tshogs pa mtha' dag mthong ba la ltos so zhes bya ba'i skyon med de /
analyzed: tshogs pa mtha' dag mthong ba la ltos so zhes bya ba'i skyon med de /
translated: Since only the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are to be established, there is no fault in relying on seeing the entire collection.

original: mjug thogs su rigs pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mjug thogs su rigs pa 'byung bas so //
translated: Because the reasoning arises immediately after.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i de'i mtshan nyid la ni sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir rab tu ma grub la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i de'i mtshan nyid la ni sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir rab tu ma grub la /
translated: Since there is no valid means of knowledge to establish its characteristics, such as the aggregates, it is not well established.

original: de lta bu la yang gang byas pa de zhes rjes su 'gro ba brjod par mi dmigs te byas pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu la yang gang byas pa de zhes rjes su 'gro ba brjod par mi dmigs te byas pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, it is not possible to say that what is done is that which is done, because what is done is contradictory.

original: byas pa zhes bya ba yang phung bo la sogs pa nyid do /
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba yang phung bo la sogs pa nyid do /
translated: What is called ‚Äúdone‚Äù is the aggregates, etc.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: In the Abhidharma it is said:

original: 'dus byas kyi chos gang dag ce na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos gang dag ce na zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are conditioned phenomena?‚Äù

original: byas pa'i chos gang dag ce na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i chos gang dag ce na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It should say, ‚ÄúWhat are done phenomena?‚Äù

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa las ltos nas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'o //üîΩyul yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes @219a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa las ltos nas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'o // yul yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes @219a * //
translated: That which is dependent is consciousness, which is produced in dependence on its own object, light, and attention.

original: pa rnam par chad pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: pa rnam par chad pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The object is the same, that is, it is divided by consciousness, etc.

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Happiness, etc. is the aggregate of feeling.

original: rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nye bar mtshon pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: The representation of a sign is discrimination.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni 'du byed do //
translated: Attachment, etc. is volitional action.

original: yul la nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul la nye bar dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of an object is consciousness.

original: bsgrub pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be accomplished‚Äù means to be produced.

original: 'gag pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo cease‚Äù means to be destroyed.

original: so sor rig pa ni rang rig pas so //
analyzed: so sor rig pa ni rang rig pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be cognized‚Äù means to be cognized by a cognition that is self-cognizant.

original: rang bzhin des goms par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin des goms par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be familiarized with‚Äù means to be familiarized with by the nature of impermanence.

original: gal te chos kyi khams dang skye mched dag na 'dus ma byas dag yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi khams dang skye mched dag na 'dus ma byas dag yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the elements of mental objects and the sense-sphere of mental objects exist, then do not unconditioned things exist in the elements of mental objects and the sense-sphere of mental objects?

original: phung po gsum tsam ste /
analyzed: phung po gsum tsam ste /
translated: They are only three aggregates.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed tsam ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed tsam ste /
translated: They are only the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formative forces.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po med ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po med ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that there is no other entity apart from these.

original: rtag pa la dngos por mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs kyi rdzas su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa la dngos por mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs kyi rdzas su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that a permanent thing is an entity, and because non-informative form does not exist as a substance of form.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the former masters.

original: ji ltar byas pa bshad pa 'dis ni yod pa yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phung po la sogs pa kho na'o zhes bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa bshad pa 'dis ni yod pa yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phung po la sogs pa kho na'o zhes bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this explanation of how it is, one should understand that only the aggregates, etc., which have the nature of impermanence, exist.

original: bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bram ze thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Brahmins say, Everything is everything, meaning the twelve sense-spheres.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa chad pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other reason is the effect, such as the cessation and transformation of consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i bye brag gzhan zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i yul dang dbang po dang blo dag go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bye brag gzhan zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i yul dang dbang po dang blo dag go //
translated: The other distinction is the imperceptible object, sense-faculty, and cognition.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid yin na ni yul dang dus dang rdzas la rag las pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid yin na ni yul dang dus dang rdzas la rag las pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were independent, then because it would depend on place, time, and substance,

original: gang du ltos nas de'i dus la sogs par 'jig pa 'gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir rgyu de med par rang bzhin gyis rtag tu 'jig pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gang du ltos nas de'i dus la sogs par 'jig pa 'gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir rgyu de med par rang bzhin gyis rtag tu 'jig pa nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: wherever it depends, its destruction at that time, etc. would be contradicted, because it would be causeless. Thus, it proves that in the absence of that cause, it would be essentially destroyed at all times.

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The nature of destruction is the characteristic of destruction.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of things.

original: de'i dngos po'i chos yin na rgyu med pa nyid mi rung ba'i rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes thal bar 'gyur bar rgol ba'o //üîΩyod pa 'byung ba ste yod pa grub pa na yod pa de tsam las gzhan la mi ltos par 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i chos yin na rgyu med pa nyid mi rung ba'i rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes thal bar 'gyur bar rgol ba'o // yod pa 'byung ba ste yod pa grub pa na yod pa de tsam las gzhan la mi ltos par 'jig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were a real entity, it would be causeless, because it is unacceptable that it be without a cause.üîΩIf it were to arise when it exists, that is, when it is established, then it would be destroyed without depending on another cause, that is, without depending on another cause for its destruction.

original: yod pa de dag dang 'dra bar yod pa 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa de nyid 'byung ba rgyu med pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa de dag dang 'dra bar yod pa 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid las 'jig pa de nyid 'byung ba rgyu med pa can ma yin no //
translated: Destruction would arise from the very cause that establishes existence, and it would not be causeless.

original: 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba ni rgyu las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba ni rgyu las skye ba'o //
translated: Arising from something means arising from a cause.

original: grangs can dag la ni med @219b de ;
analyzed: grangs can dag la ni med @219b de ;
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas do not have this.

original: gsal ba tsam du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba tsam du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they assert that it is merely manifest.

original: gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste bum pa'am snam bu'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste bum pa'am snam bu'i'o //
translated: Whose means the entity, that is, the pot or cloth.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan nam thag bas so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan nam thag bas so //
translated: How means by the potter or thread.

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni yul lam dus so //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni yul lam dus so //
translated: Where means in a place or time.

original: de ltar na rgyu med pa'i phyir bum pa yang rdza mkhan gyi yul dang dus la mi ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu med pa'i phyir bum pa yang rdza mkhan gyi yul dang dus la mi ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, because it would have no cause, a pot would not depend on the place and time of the potter.

original: de la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have no cause.

original: de'i phyir des rtsom par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir des rtsom par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, it would not be produced by him.

original: snam bu la yang thag ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: snam bu la yang thag ba ji bzhin no //
translated: And it would be the same for cloth and a stick.

original: gal te de dag de las skye ba ni ma yin gyi nye bar zhi ba las gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag de las skye ba ni ma yin gyi nye bar zhi ba las gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not that they arise from that, but that they become manifest from the pacification of that,

original: 'di ltar zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIn that case, how could it be pacified?‚Äù

original: cung zad nye bar zhi ba ni ma skyes pa'am zhig pa na rgyu'i rang bzhin gyur nas yang rang bzhin ngo bo mi gsal bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad nye bar zhi ba ni ma skyes pa'am zhig pa na rgyu'i rang bzhin gyur nas yang rang bzhin ngo bo mi gsal bar gnas pa'o //
translated: A little pacification is not arising or being destroyed. The nature of the cause changes and again the nature of the entity remains unmanifest.

original: ma yin pa ni nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa ni nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Not not being pacified is not pacified.

original: rang gi ngo bo gsal bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gsal bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Its own nature arises as manifest.

original: yul dang dus dang rdzas cung zad la 'brel ba ste ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rdzas cung zad la 'brel ba ste ltos pa'o //
translated: It is a little related to or dependent on a place, time, and substance.

original: ma 'brel ba ni mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni mi ltos pa'o //
translated: Not related is not dependent.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis smos pa las gzhan pa'i phung po mi srid pas de gnyis las ma 'brel pa mi srid pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis smos pa las gzhan pa'i phung po mi srid pas de gnyis las ma 'brel pa mi srid pa nyid ni /
translated: Since a third alternative other than the two alternatives of conceptual differentiation is impossible, the non-connection of the two is impossible.

original: 'brel pa nyid du 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid du 'khrul pa med do //
translated: There is no error in the non-connection of the two.

original: de'i phyir yod pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa gang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says: ‚Äúwhat exists?‚Äù

original: yod pa ni mngon par byung ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni mngon par byung ba'o //
translated: That which exists is that which has come into being.

original: de rgyu dang 'brel pa nyid ma yin na ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang de'i yul dang dus kho na la bum pa nges pa 'di ni med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu dang 'brel pa nyid ma yin na ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa dang de'i yul dang dus kho na la bum pa nges pa 'di ni med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not connected with a cause, then the definite existence of a pot in the mere assemblage of a potter, etc. and in the mere place and time of a pot would be impossible.

original: de bzhin du thag pa la sogs pa'i chogs pa dang / de'i yul dang dus las snam bu nges pa 'di yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thag pa la sogs pa'i chogs pa dang / de'i yul dang dus las snam bu nges pa 'di yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the definite existence of a cloth in the mere assemblage of a thread, etc. and in the mere place and time of a cloth would be impossible.

original: de ltar mngon par gsal ba'i ltos pa'i de nyid rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yin ba'i phyir ltos pa'i yang dngos po 'di gang na yang rgyu med pa can med do //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par gsal ba'i ltos pa'i de nyid rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yin ba'i phyir ltos pa'i yang dngos po 'di gang na yang rgyu med pa can med do //
translated: Thus, since the reality of dependence is like this, i.e. along with its cause, there is no entity anywhere that is without a cause.

original: mi ltos pa'i dngos po yang med de ltos pa med pa la 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ltos pa'i dngos po yang med de ltos pa med pa la 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no entity that is not dependent, because that which is not dependent is not established.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las byung ba nyid na de nyid las 'jig pa yang 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang ldan pa dag mi rtag pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las byung ba nyid na de nyid las 'jig pa yang 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba dang ldan pa dag mi rtag pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since that which arises from a cause ceases right then, it is established that that which arises is impermanent.

original: skyes pa de nyid yod pa dang byas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skyes pa de nyid yod pa dang byas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which has arisen is called ‚Äúexistent‚Äù and ‚Äúproduced.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid 'jig pas khyab bsgrub pa'i rigs pa gzhan yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan pa nyid gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa mi rtag pas khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid 'jig pas khyab bsgrub pa'i rigs pa gzhan yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan pa nyid gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa mi rtag pas khyab pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no other so-called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù that is a different entity, existence is pervaded by impermanence.

original: 'on ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba la @220a * //üîΩsogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin la zhes bya ba la @220a * // sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe entity itself is cessation.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po de nyid skad cig ma nyid yin nam dngos bor rtogs ba nyid skad cig mar rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po de nyid skad cig ma nyid yin nam dngos bor rtogs ba nyid skad cig mar rtogs she na /
translated: If the entity itself is momentary, is it understood as an entity or is it understood as momentary?

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIts nature is that.‚Äù

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gyo mor gyur ba'i dbang gis de 'dra ba 'khrul ba'i rgyu med par de'i dbang gis so//
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni gyo mor gyur ba'i dbang gis de 'dra ba 'khrul ba'i rgyu med par de'i dbang gis so//
translated: ‚ÄúDue to that‚Äù means that due to the state of being a shard, that is, the state of being a pot, is seen without a cause of error.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni gyo mo nges pa na de bum pa'i skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba las dus phyis so //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni gyo mo nges pa na de bum pa'i skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba las dus phyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means that when the shard is ascertained, later than seeing the final moment of the pot.

original: dus der bum pa'i skad cig ma rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dus der bum pa'i skad cig ma rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: At that time, the moment of the pot is posited.

original: de skad cig mar grub na bar dang thog ma'i gnas skabs kyang skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de skad cig mar grub na bar dang thog ma'i gnas skabs kyang skad cig ma nyid kyis khyab par 'grub ste /
translated: If it is established that it is momentary, then the state of being in the middle and the state of being at the beginning are also established as necessarily being momentary.

original: sngar dug mthong yang dug mi shes pa la skyes bur rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas /
analyzed: sngar dug mthong yang dug mi shes pa la skyes bur rnam par 'gyur ba mthong nas /
translated: Even though one saw poison earlier, one does not know that it is poison. Later, when one sees that the person has changed,

original: dug sngar mthong ba la 'jug pa nyid du tha snyad 'jug pa ltar yod pa de log na de las gzhan ci la yang 'jig pa ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa de 'jig pas khyab par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dug sngar mthong ba la 'jug pa nyid du tha snyad 'jug pa ltar yod pa de log na de las gzhan ci la yang 'jig pa ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa de 'jig pas khyab par bya ba yin te /
translated: one infers that the poison was seen earlier. Just as one applies the term ‚Äúpoison‚Äù to that, if that existence is refuted, then it would be impossible for anything else to be destroyed without depending on that. Therefore existence is pervaded by destruction.

original: yod pa nyid rgyu mtshang ba na 'jig pa yang rgyu mtshang bas yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid rgyu mtshang ba na 'jig pa yang rgyu mtshang bas yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since existence itself is the cause, destruction also exists because of the cause.

original: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it does not depend on anything other than that.

original: de ni rgyus nus pa yang min zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med par dgag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyus nus pa yang min zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med par dgag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: That is not the power of the cause. This is from the perspective of a nonimplicative negation of destruction.

original: 'jig pa skad cig tu gnas pa'i don la ni rgyu gzhan don med pa nyid du sngar bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig pa skad cig tu gnas pa'i don la ni rgyu gzhan don med pa nyid du sngar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of momentary endurance was previously explained as being meaningless with respect to another cause.

original: ji ltar nus pa ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa ma yin zhe na ;
translated: How is it not the power?

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two considerations here.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po nyid byed dam /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po nyid byed dam /
translated: Does the cause of destruction make it an entity?

original: de las tha dad ba zhig byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las tha dad ba zhig byed ces bya'o //
translated: Or does it make it different from that?

original: de la dngos po nyid ni mi byed de dngos po grub zin na rgyus grub pa de yang byar med pa'i phyir mi byed do //
analyzed: de la dngos po nyid ni mi byed de dngos po grub zin na rgyus grub pa de yang byar med pa'i phyir mi byed do //
translated: It does not make it an entity, because if the entity is already established, the cause does not make it, because it is already established.

original: de las tha dad pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa yang mi byed de /
translated: It also does not make it different from that.

original: bya ba dngos po las gzhan yin na yang dngos po de ci'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dngos po las gzhan yin na yang dngos po de ci'i yang ma yin te /
translated: If the action is different from the entity, then that entity is nothing at all.

original: dngos po ni mi 'jig pas de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni mi 'jig pas de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things do not perish, they remain as they are.

original: de dang de ma yin pas gzhan pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pas gzhan pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Nor is it possible that they are different in the sense of being other than that.

original: gzhan mi ltos pa de'i phyir 'di 'jig pa 'di rang bzhin ma yin te /üîΩrang gi 'byung gnas rgyu nyid las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan mi ltos pa de'i phyir 'di 'jig pa 'di rang bzhin ma yin te / rang gi 'byung gnas rgyu nyid las 'byung ba'am /
translated: Because they are not dependent on another, therefore, this destruction is not their nature.üîΩIt arises from its own source, which is its cause.

original: yang rang gi rang bzhin te rang gi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang rang gi rang bzhin te rang gi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Or, it is its own nature, its own essence.

original: dngos por brjod pa ni dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: dngos por brjod pa ni dngos po tsam mo //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthing‚Äù refers to mere things.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'jig pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'jig pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by destruction.

original: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa las gzhan du ste lkog tu gyur pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa las gzhan du ste lkog tu gyur pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in other cases‚Äù means in cases other than those that are manifest, that is, in cases that are hidden.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni mi ltos pa'i dngos @220b po'i rang bzhin yin pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni mi ltos pa'i dngos @220b po'i rang bzhin yin pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy nature‚Äù means by the mere nature of things that are not dependent.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi rtag par ro //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi rtag par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWould occur‚Äù means would be impermanent.

original: 'jig pa de'i mi ltos pa nyid ces bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa de'i mi ltos pa nyid ces bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That destruction is not dependent on anything else is its nature.

original: bum ba mthar gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bum ba mthar gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seen that some things, such as a pot, come to an end.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i dngos po las gzhan pa'i 'jig pa yang mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin de nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i dngos po las gzhan pa'i 'jig pa yang mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin de nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: So too, the disintegration of a thing that is different from what is seen does not depend on another cause, because its nature is not different.

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas zhes bya ba'i tshad mas rang dang 'brel pa grub pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pas zhes bya ba'i tshad mas rang dang 'brel pa grub pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang ste /
translated: Just as existence does not depend on another cause, and is established by the valid knowledge that is related to it, so too, other natural reasons are established by the valid knowledge that is related to them.

original: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi tshad mas so zhes bya ba dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid can yin pa'i phyir byas pa zhes bya ba yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi tshad ma ji lta bas !so //
analyzed: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi tshad mas so zhes bya ba dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid can yin pa'i phyir byas pa zhes bya ba yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi tshad ma ji lta bas !so //
translated: For example, ‚Äúbecause it is a shaba tree‚Äù is established by direct perception and non-observation, and ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù is also established by direct perception and non-observation, because it has a nature that is different due to the specific conditions.üîΩThe nature of the reason is direct perception itself.

original: de nyid mngon sum rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig ba de nyid dngos su gtan tshigs kyi rang gi ngo bo yin te ;
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig ba de nyid dngos su gtan tshigs kyi rang gi ngo bo yin te ;
translated: The nature of the reason is direct perception itself.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: yod pa'am byas pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'jig pa dngos po'i chos su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'am byas pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir 'jig pa dngos po'i chos su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of a thing that exists or is produced, destruction cannot be a property of a thing.

original: gal te 'jig pa dngos po med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa dngos po med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If destruction is a nonentity,

original: med pa la ni 'jig pa nyid mi srid la rgyus bya bar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: med pa la ni 'jig pa nyid mi srid la rgyus bya bar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
translated: it is impossible for a nonentity to be destroyed, and it is not possible for a cause to function.

original: chos gzhan gtan tshigs yin na de dang ji ltar de'i chos yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos gzhan gtan tshigs yin na de dang ji ltar de'i chos yin zhe na /
translated: If another property is the reason, how can it be the property of that?

original: bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul las brtsad pa ste 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes brjod de rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul las brtsad pa ste 'dzin pa'i phyir chos zhes brjod de rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: An action is called a property because it is the cause of the apprehension of a thing, since it is the cause of the apprehension of its own characteristic.

original: des ni gzhan la mi rigs so snyam pa'o //üîΩgrags pa'i tshul gyis de la brten pa la yang chos nyid du brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des ni gzhan la mi rigs so snyam pa'o // grags pa'i tshul gyis de la brten pa la yang chos nyid du brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The opponent thinks that it is not possible for another property to be the reason.üîΩBecause it is said that that which is based on it is called its property, in accordance with common usage.

original: de la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is based on it.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyu shug dang rdza ma dag dus mnyam pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa med par rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'dod pa'i phyir du ba me la brten par bshad na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyu shug dang rdza ma dag dus mnyam pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa med par rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'dod pa'i phyir du ba me la brten par bshad na /
translated: Others assert that since the cause and the clay pot are simultaneous, there is no produced and producer, but they assert that there is a relationship of support and supported.üîΩ

original: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Others ask, ‚ÄúIf smoke is said to be supported on fire because they assert that the support and supported exist simultaneously, like a myrobalan fruit and a pot, then how can they be cause and effect?‚Äù

original: slob dpon de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúFor that very reason.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa yin no //
translated: Because they are cause and effect, they are support and supported.

original: gzhan du phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa med pa na rten dang brten pa nyid du mi 'grub po //üîΩde ltar yang rgyu shug gi mi ltung ba'i rang bzhin ni bum bas byas pa nyid yin te gzhan du @221a * //
analyzed: gzhan du phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa med pa na rten dang brten pa nyid du mi 'grub po // de ltar yang rgyu shug gi mi ltung ba'i rang bzhin ni bum bas byas pa nyid yin te gzhan du @221a * //
translated: If there is no benefit to be done and no benefit, support and supported are not established.

original: na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the nature of the myrobalan fruit not falling is produced by the pot, because it is not tenable otherwise.

original: du ba de'i rgyu me yang phyogs de la brten pa'i phyir phyogs ni brgyud pas du ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: du ba de'i rgyu me yang phyogs de la brten pa'i phyir phyogs ni brgyud pas du ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: The fire that is the cause of that smoke is also the cause of the smoke indirectly, because it supports that place.

original: thams cad go bar bya ba ni mi gsal ba dang rtsa'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa du bas go bar ro //üîΩthams cad go bar byed pa na skya bo nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa me'i go par byed par ro //
analyzed: thams cad go bar bya ba ni mi gsal ba dang rtsa'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa du bas go bar ro // thams cad go bar byed pa na skya bo nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs pa me'i go par byed par ro //
translated: All are understood: the unclear, the smoky, etc. are understood by the smoke.üîΩWhen all are understood, the paleness, the substance, etc. are understood by the fire.

original: gsal ba dang rtsa'i zhes bya ba de med kyang mi tsam mi gsal ba dad /
analyzed: gsal ba dang rtsa'i zhes bya ba de med kyang mi tsam mi gsal ba dad /
translated: The unclear, the smoky, etc. are not understood by the paleness, the substance, etc.

original: shing gi las kyang 'byung ba'i du ba de dag ni gsal ba la sogs pa de dag skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir go bar mi byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: shing gi las kyang 'byung ba'i du ba de dag ni gsal ba la sogs pa de dag skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir go bar mi byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: The smoke that arises from the wood, although it exists, is not understood by the paleness, the substance, etc. because the arising of those, the paleness, etc. is not certain.

original: yang skya bo dang / rdzas la sogs pa de dag kyang me de las skye ba nges pa med de /
analyzed: yang skya bo dang / rdzas la sogs pa de dag kyang me de las skye ba nges pa med de /
translated: Moreover, the paleness, the substance, etc. are not certain to arise from that fire.

original: rtsig pa dang chu la sogs pa las kyang yin pa de dag go bar mi byed pa yang 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsig pa dang chu la sogs pa las kyang yin pa de dag go bar mi byed pa yang 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: They are also from the wall, the water, etc. Therefore, they are not understood.

original: rgyu la rang bzhin sreg pa nyid de bud shing 'gyur bas du ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba /
analyzed: rgyu la rang bzhin sreg pa nyid de bud shing 'gyur bas du ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba /
translated: The cause has the nature of burning, and the nature of the transformation of fuel is the nature of the generation of smoke.

original: mig 'chi mar byed pa dang / lkog mar gnod pa dang nag por byed pa dang / gyen du 'thul ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin de ni 'bras bu yin la de dag go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: mig 'chi mar byed pa dang / lkog mar gnod pa dang nag por byed pa dang / gyen du 'thul ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin de ni 'bras bu yin la de dag go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The nature of the eye, the nature of the harm to the throat, the nature of the blackness, and the nature of the upward rising are the effect, and the reason that makes them understood is the cause.

original: 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained as the effect.

original: skya bo tsam ni nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skya bo tsam ni nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mere paleness is not ascertained.

original: rgyu 'bras bu'i chos sreg pa dang bud shing 'gyur ba dang / du ba byed pa dang / mig 'phyid par byed pa dang / snam par byed pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi chos zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bor te de dag dang tha dad du mi 'jug pa rnams yin gyi so sor srid pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras bu'i chos sreg pa dang bud shing 'gyur ba dang / du ba byed pa dang / mig 'phyid par byed pa dang / snam par byed pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu de nyid kyi chos zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bor te de dag dang tha dad du mi 'jug pa rnams yin gyi so sor srid pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause and effect dharmas of burning, the transformation of fuel, the production of smoke, the opening of the eye, the harm to the throat, and so on, are the dharmas of that cause and effect. They are the intrinsic nature, not distinct from them, not existing separately.

original: me dang du ba'i rang bzhin cha med pa la me'i gsal ba'i cha skyed par byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: me dang du ba'i rang bzhin cha med pa la me'i gsal ba'i cha skyed par byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The nature of fire and smoke is partless, and the aspect of clarity of fire does not generate it.

original: du ba'i rdzas nyid bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: du ba'i rdzas nyid bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The substance of smoke is not generated.

original: cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: If it is generated by parts, it follows that it would be generated and a generator.

original: des bskyed par bya ba ni rtsa'i mes bskyed par bya ba'i du ba'i bye brag gzung na go bar bya ba nyid du 'dod ba'i phyir dang / rtags du bas khyad par du byas pa'i spyi ste du ba'i rdzas dang du ba'i skya bo zhes so //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba ni rtsa'i mes bskyed par bya ba'i du ba'i bye brag gzung na go bar bya ba nyid du 'dod ba'i phyir dang / rtags du bas khyad par du byas pa'i spyi ste du ba'i rdzas dang du ba'i skya bo zhes so //
translated: If one observes the particular smoke generated by the fire of a straw fire, it is asserted that it is the object of understanding, and the universal characterized by smoke is the substance of smoke and the pallor of smoke.

original: de dag kyang go bar byed par 'dod pa'i phyir thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang go bar byed par 'dod pa'i phyir thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Since those are also asserted to be the object of understanding, all are generated and a generator.

original: gang dag brgya byin spyi bo las du ba 'byung bar mthong nas gal te du bas me la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba 'di zhes dri bar byed do /
analyzed: gang dag brgya byin spyi bo las du ba 'byung bar mthong nas gal te du bas me la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba 'di zhes dri bar byed do /
translated: Those who see smoke arising from the head of ≈öakra ask, ‚ÄúIf smoke is not mistaken regarding fire, what is this?‚Äù

original: me de las du ba 'khrul te me med par yang yod na du ba 'di rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur phyir mi 'khrul lo //
analyzed: me de las du ba 'khrul te me med par yang yod na du ba 'di rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur phyir mi 'khrul lo //
translated: Smoke is confused with fire, but if it existed without fire, it would be beyond having a cause.

original: me dang du ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dag mi dmigs pa las @221b shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa dag yod na snang du rung ba zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa snang du rung ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: me dang du ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dag mi dmigs pa las @221b shes ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa dag yod na snang du rung ba zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa snang du rung ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The non-apprehension of fire and smoke with such characteristics teaches the non-apprehension of the mere appearance of cause and effect.

original: gang dag dmigs na zhes bya bas ni me dang bud shing gang dag dmigs pa ste mngon sum gcig go //
analyzed: gang dag dmigs na zhes bya bas ni me dang bud shing gang dag dmigs pa ste mngon sum gcig go //
translated: The phrase when they are apprehended refers to the apprehension of fire and fuel, which is a single direct perception.

original: gang dag dmigs la zhes bya ba ni du ba ste mngon sum gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag dmigs la zhes bya ba ni du ba ste mngon sum gnyis pa'o //
translated: The phrase when they are apprehended refers to smoke, which is a second direct perception.

original: de las gcig med na zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing ste mi dmigs pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de las gcig med na zhes bya ba ni me dang bud shing ste mi dmigs pa gnyis so //
translated: The phrase if one of them does not exist refers to fire and fuel, which is a second non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni du ba ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni du ba ste /
translated: The phrase non-apprehension refers to smoke.

original: mi dmigs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: It is a third non-apprehension.

original: de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can dag ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin la de yang du ba la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can dag ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin la de yang du ba la yod pa'o //
translated: Such concomitance and nonconcomitance are the nature of the effect, and that exists in smoke.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni lan gcig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa ni lan gcig kyang ma yin te /
translated: That which is not an effect is not even once the cause,

original: nas kyi sa bon dang s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon dang s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: like a barley seed and a rice sprout.

original: rgyu las gzhan du ste rgyu med par ro //
analyzed: rgyu las gzhan du ste rgyu med par ro //
translated: From another cause, that is, without a cause.

original: me gang gi 'bras bu du ba gang me med par brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na ni me de du ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: me gang gi 'bras bu du ba gang me med par brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na ni me de du ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: If smoke, the effect of fire, were to arise from the head of Indra without fire, then that fire would not be the cause of that smoke.

original: me med par 'byung ba myu gu'i rgyu me ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me med par 'byung ba myu gu'i rgyu me ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Like fire is not the cause of the arising of a sprout without fire.

original: du ba yang me las gzhan gyi me med par brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na de med par 'byung ba ni de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba yang me las gzhan gyi me med par brgya byin gyi spyi bo las 'byung na de med par 'byung ba ni de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: And if smoke were to arise from the head of Indra without fire, that is, from another than fire, then that which arises without it would not be its effect, that is, would not be called its effect,

original: me med par 'byung bas nas kyi sa bon dang myu gu ni me'i 'bras bu ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me med par 'byung bas nas kyi sa bon dang myu gu ni me'i 'bras bu ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like a rice seed and a sprout, which arise without fire, are not the effect of fire.

original: de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo de la yang rgyu ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo de la yang rgyu ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is similar to that, that is, it is similar to the fact that Indra‚Äôs head is not the cause of smoke.

original: de med kyang me las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang me las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because smoke arises even when it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar brgya byin gyi spyi bo gang med par 'byung ba du ba de'i rgyu ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar brgya byin gyi spyi bo gang med par 'byung ba du ba de'i rgyu ni brgya byin gyi spyi bo ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since smoke arises even when Indra‚Äôs head does not exist, Indra‚Äôs head is not the cause of that smoke.

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo med par 'byung bas nas kyi myu gu brgya byin gyis spyi bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo med par 'byung bas nas kyi myu gu brgya byin gyis spyi bo ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Because smoke arises even when Indra‚Äôs head does not exist, just like a barley sprout.

original: du ba de yang brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba de yang brgya byin gyi spyi bo'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: And that smoke is not the effect of Indra‚Äôs head.

original: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: de med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
translated: Because it arises even when it does not exist, just like a barley sprout.

original: zhes 'khrul pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'khrul pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the error is similar.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i tshogs pa rigs gnyis pa can ni rgyu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i tshogs pa rigs gnyis pa can ni rgyu med pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, a collection of causes that has two types of causes is causeless.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'khrul pa las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'khrul pa las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúalso‚Äù is that there is another reason besides the error of concomitance and reversal.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that reason?

original: gal te me de'am gzhan brgya byin gyi spyi bo de du bskyed pa rang bzhin ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te me de'am gzhan brgya byin gyi spyi bo de du bskyed pa rang bzhin ma yin na ni /
translated: If fire or ≈öiva‚Äôs head were not the nature of smoke,

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ji ltar du bar 'byung /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ji ltar du bar 'byung /
translated: how could smoke arise from that which is not its nature?

original: rang bzhin gyis du ba skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir de las 'byung bar 'dod pa'i du ba rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis du ba skyed par mi byed pa'i phyir de las 'byung bar 'dod pa'i du ba rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it does not produce smoke by its nature, the smoke that is asserted to arise from it would be causeless.

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Everything would arise from everything.

original: zhes bya ba ltos pa med pa la yul dang dus mi nges par rung ngo zhes rang bzhin @222a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltos pa med pa la yul dang dus mi nges par rung ngo zhes rang bzhin @222a * //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable to assert that there is no dependence, and that the object and time are indefinite.

original: gyi gtan tshigs kyi skabs su skyon brjod zin to //
analyzed: gyi gtan tshigs kyi skabs su skyon brjod zin to //
translated: This fault has already been stated in the context of the argument from nature.

original: gal te nus pa dang 'brel mod de tsam gyis rgyu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang 'brel mod de tsam gyis rgyu dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is related to the potential, it does not follow that it is a cause.

original: nus pa'i dngos po de yang rgyu'i dngos po las gzhan ci zhig yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nus pa'i dngos po de yang rgyu'i dngos po las gzhan ci zhig yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is that entity that has the capacity?

original: gal te ltos pa rgyu yin yang yul dang / dus kho na la 'jug nus par je ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa rgyu yin yang yul dang / dus kho na la 'jug nus par je ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object and time are the basis of the capacity, how can they be the basis of the capacity?

original: des na yul dang dus gcig gtang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des na yul dang dus gcig gtang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object and time are not the basis of the capacity.‚Äù

original: yang na brgya byin gyi spyi bo las byung ba de du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na brgya byin gyi spyi bo las byung ba de du ba ma yin te /
translated: Or, that which arises from ≈öakra‚Äôs head is not smoke,

original: du ba sgyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba sgyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because it arises from a nature that is not a producer of smoke.

original: s'a lu las byung ba'i myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: s'a lu las byung ba'i myu gu bzhin no //
translated: It is like a sprout that arises from rice.

original: du ba da'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
analyzed: du ba da'i rang bzhin yin na ni /
translated: If it is the nature of smoke,

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo de nyid bud shing dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo de nyid bud shing dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: then ≈öakra‚Äôs head itself would possess fuel,

original: du ba dngos su skyed par byed pa yin ba'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba dngos su skyed par byed pa yin ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is the direct producer of smoke.

original: tshang bang gi me bzhin no //
analyzed: tshang bang gi me bzhin no //
translated: It is like the fire in a stove.

original: gal te brgya byin spyi bo'i me zhes bya ba du bskyed par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal te brgya byin spyi bo'i me zhes bya ba du bskyed par byed pa'i don to //
translated: If you say that the so-called fire of ≈öakra‚Äôs head is the object of the capacity, it is not tenable that it is the object of the capacity.

original: de me'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed par byed ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de me'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba ni du ba bskyed par byed ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
translated: If it is said that it is the nature of fire, it is not the nature that produces smoke.

original: nus pa'i bye brag ldan zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i bye brag des grags kyi de med na ni me nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i bye brag ldan zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i bye brag des grags kyi de med na ni me nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said to possess a particular capacity, and by that particular capacity it is known. Without that, it would not be fire.

original: de lta na me med par yang du ba de du ba'i rgyu min /
analyzed: de lta na me med par yang du ba de du ba'i rgyu min /
translated: In that case, even without fire, that smoke would not be the cause of smoke.

original: brgya byin spyi bo las byung na du ba'i nus pa med par 'byung ba'i rgyu med 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya byin spyi bo las byung na du ba'i nus pa med par 'byung ba'i rgyu med 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arose from the head of Indra, it would arise without the capacity of smoke, and there would be no cause.

original: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu gcig pa bkag pa dang gzhan dag dang ni ji ltar na lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu gcig pa bkag pa dang gzhan dag dang ni ji ltar na lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri bar byed do //
translated: The refutation of a single effect from different causes, and the question How is it a co-operator with others? and so on, is asked.

original: gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: One and so on is stated.

original: skyed par byed pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Nothing at all is a producer, this is to be applied.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gcig pus skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But it is not the case that there is even the slightest nature that is produced by that nature alone.

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed pa ni de lta bu'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skyed par byed pa ni de lta bu'o zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, it shows that the nature of things is to be produced in that way.

original: de yang ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar shes she na /
translated: And how is that known?

original: tshad mas tshogs pa kho na rtsom par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas tshogs pa kho na rtsom par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that the mere assembly of conditions is the producer.

original: rgyun ni rang nyid kyi tshogs pa snga ma tsam las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyun ni rang nyid kyi tshogs pa snga ma tsam las 'byung ste /
translated: A continuum arises from the mere prior assembly of itself.

original: gzugs can rnams ni ci rigs par gzugs dang / reg bya la tshogs pa dang / shes par ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshogs pa dang kha cig dbang po dang lus kyi rten dag yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni ci rigs par gzugs dang / reg bya la tshogs pa dang / shes par ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshogs pa dang kha cig dbang po dang lus kyi rten dag yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ngo //
translated: Material things arise from the mere existence of the assembly of form and tactility, as is appropriate, and some arise from the mere existence of the assembly of the primary elements and the faculties and the body.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa ste 'grub pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa ste 'grub pa'i'o //
translated: It is the state of abiding as the entity of the effect.

original: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam grangs ma yin par te /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba yang rnam grangs ma yin par te /
translated: Because it is that very producer in the state of the assembly, the term ‚Äúcooperating‚Äù is not a synonym.

original: rim gyis ma yin bar dus gcig tu skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis ma yin bar dus gcig tu skyed pa yin no //
translated: but not gradually, but rather all at once.

original: @222b autpala'i sa bon las byung ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba las byung ba dag la sha lu ka zhes brjod par zad de cung zad 'dra ba'i phyir sgra mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: @222b autpala'i sa bon las byung ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba las byung ba dag la sha lu ka zhes brjod par zad de cung zad 'dra ba'i phyir sgra mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The word ≈õƒÅluka is used to designate that which comes from a lotus seed and that which comes from cow dung, because of a certain resemblance; the word is the same, but the meaning is different.

original: yang na de ma thag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba du ba las byung ba'i du ba me 'gags pa'i gnas skabs can gyis brgyud pa'i rgyu med bag ba ma yin gyi me nye ba ste /üîΩme la dngos su brten pa'i gnas skabs can gyis med pag pa'am /
analyzed: yang na de ma thag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba du ba las byung ba'i du ba me 'gags pa'i gnas skabs can gyis brgyud pa'i rgyu med bag ba ma yin gyi me nye ba ste / me la dngos su brten pa'i gnas skabs can gyis med pag pa'am /
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúimmediate‚Äù signifies that the smoke which arises from the fire, and which is the cause of the inferential knowledge of the fire, is not separated from the fire by another cause.üîΩThe smoke is the cause of the inferential knowledge of the fire, because it is the cause of the knowledge of the fire, and because it is not in contact with the fire.

original: yang na chu shing rgyas pa rang gi rgyu mchod pa sdong bu nyid dpag gi sdong bu de'i rgyu sa bon bye brag ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chu shing rgyas pa rang gi rgyu mchod pa sdong bu nyid dpag gi sdong bu de'i rgyu sa bon bye brag ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, the trunk of the plantain tree is the cause of the knowledge of its seed, because it is the cause of the knowledge of the seed, and because it is not in contact with the seed.

original: rgyas par ni sdong bu las byung ba ste sa bon las ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni sdong bu las byung ba ste sa bon las ni phra ba'o //
translated: The seed is the cause of the knowledge of the trunk, because it is the cause of the knowledge of the trunk, and because it is in contact with the trunk.

original: don tha dad pa las khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor nye bar sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dus tha dad pa 'dod na'o //
analyzed: don tha dad pa las khas blangs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor nye bar sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dus tha dad pa 'dod na'o //
translated: From the point of view of the meaning, from the point of view of the acceptance means from the point of view of the application of the term to each individual thing, and from the point of view of origination and destruction means from the point of view of the acceptance of the difference in time.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig ces brjod pa'o //
translated: The word thus means as one.

original: de'i phyir dmag dang nags kyi sgra bzhin du ming gcig pa nyid kyi don tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmag dang nags kyi sgra bzhin du ming gcig pa nyid kyi don tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the word army and the word forest, the one word refers to different things.
