original: de ni grangs can dag ni sna tshogs yon tan gyi rang bzhin gcig tu smra ba yang bsal ba yin no //üîΩrgyu don gzhan ma yin pa nyid dpes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu med par smra ba'i ltar na'o //
analyzed: de ni grangs can dag ni sna tshogs yon tan gyi rang bzhin gcig tu smra ba yang bsal ba yin no // rgyu don gzhan ma yin pa nyid dpes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu med par smra ba'i ltar na'o //
translated: This also refutes the Samkhyas' assertion that the one nature of the various qualities is the cause.

original: dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa ma grub ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa ni zhig pa'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa ma grub ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa ni zhig pa'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The example of the non-difference of the cause in the case of the assertion of causeless destruction is as follows: If one asserts that destruction is causeless, then at the time of the thing, impermanence would not be established.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhen zhes bya ba ni sgrub ba dang / ma grub pa 'ga' ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhen zhes bya ba ni sgrub ba dang / ma grub pa 'ga' ba nyid du'o //
translated: The word not means that it is not established as something that is established or not established.

original: mang du brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mang du brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan yang 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan cung zad yod pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis has been said many times‚Äù refers to the earlier statement, ‚ÄúThere is no other destruction.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na dngos po'i 'jig pa zhes drug pas tha dad par ston pa dang / dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba chos can du ston pa'i bye brag ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na dngos po'i 'jig pa zhes drug pas tha dad par ston pa dang / dngos po 'jig pa zhes bya ba chos can du ston pa'i bye brag ji lta zhe na /
translated: If things themselves are destruction, then why does the genitive case in ‚Äúdestruction of things‚Äù indicate a difference, and why is ‚Äúdestruction of things‚Äù indicated as the subject?

original: chos dang chos can nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so//
translated: He says ‚Äúby the nature of the thing and the subject,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na dngos po mthong ba nyid na 'jig pa na yang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid 'jig pa yin na dngos po mthong ba nyid na 'jig pa na yang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If things themselves are destruction, then when a thing is seen, its destruction would also be seen.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de mthong du zin kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de mthong du zin kyang zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though its nature is seen,‚Äù

original: rnam par gzhog par mi nus te zhes bya bar nges par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhog par mi nus te zhes bya bar nges par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äúit cannot be established‚Äù means ‚Äúit cannot be ascertained.‚Äù

original: gal te de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: yod pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause the existence of the object is perceived.‚Äù

original: kha cig yod pa dmigs ba ste bar du stong pa'i skad cig ma ma mthong bas dngos po mi 'dra ba rnams la yang thams cad du snga ma de yod par the tshom za bas bslus pa'am /
analyzed: kha cig yod pa dmigs ba ste bar du stong pa'i skad cig ma ma mthong bas dngos po mi 'dra ba rnams la yang thams cad du snga ma de yod par the tshom za bas bslus pa'am /
translated: Some are deceived by the observation of existence, because they do not see the momentary cessation of the interval, and so they doubt that all things, which are different from one another, exist in the same way as before.

original: yang na kha cig ni 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas so //
analyzed: yang na kha cig ni 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas so //
translated: Or, some are deceived by the occurrence of other things that are similar.

original: gal te mtha'i skad cig ma mthong @223a * //
analyzed: gal te mtha'i skad cig ma mthong @223a * //
translated: If one says that one ascertains the impermanence of things by observing the final moment,

original: bas nges zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bum ba la sogs pa gyo mo la sogs pas te rjes su 'gro ba can gyis 'jig pa mthong na'o //
analyzed: bas nges zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / bum ba la sogs pa gyo mo la sogs pas te rjes su 'gro ba can gyis 'jig pa mthong na'o //
translated: then one would ascertain the impermanence of things like a lamp, etc., which do not have a subsequent continuity, and of things like a pot, etc., which have a subsequent continuity, by observing their destruction.

original: go bzhin yod pa dmigs pa dang 'dra bas bslus pa rnams kyis 'jig pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go bzhin yod pa dmigs pa dang 'dra bas bslus pa rnams kyis 'jig pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who are deceived by the observation of existence, as if it were similar, would ascertain the impermanence of things.

original: bum pa 'di phyis mi dmigs pa na bum pa'i mtha'i skad cig mthong ba de skad cig ma nyid du nges te /
analyzed: bum pa 'di phyis mi dmigs pa na bum pa'i mtha'i skad cig mthong ba de skad cig ma nyid du nges te /
translated: When one does not observe a pot later, one ascertains the final moment of the pot as momentary,

original: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the basis for error has been removed.

original: gal te mtha'i skad cig nges kyang dbus dang dang po'i gnas skabs dag ni yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtha'i skad cig nges kyang dbus dang dang po'i gnas skabs dag ni yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the final moment is definitely so, but the middle and initial states are not so,

original: 'di la mi mkhas par nams kyis nges pa ma yin pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: 'di la mi mkhas par nams kyis nges pa ma yin pa kho na'o ;
translated: then you are not skilled in this, and you are not definitely so.

original: ; mkhas pas ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: ; mkhas pas ni nges pa ste /
translated: But the wise are definitely so.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mtha'i skad cig ma la 'jig pa'i rgyu sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas mi rung ba'i phyir rgyu la mi ltos so //
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig ma la 'jig pa'i rgyu sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas mi rung ba'i phyir rgyu la mi ltos so //
translated: The final moment is not dependent on a cause, because it is not tenable that the cause of destruction is as explained by the reasoning previously stated.

original: de ltar na ni rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ni rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'grub ste /
translated: If that is so, then it is established that it exists permanently,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gzhan la mi ltos ba nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gzhan la mi ltos ba nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of destruction is not dependent on another, and there is no difference.

original: gal te dngos po med pa las yang 'jig pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa las yang 'jig pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it follows that destruction exists from a non-thing,

original: mi ltos zhes bya ba dngos po yod pa las rgyu yod pa las rgyu gzhan la mi ltos so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ltos zhes bya ba dngos po yod pa las rgyu yod pa las rgyu gzhan la mi ltos so zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: then you should understand that ‚Äúnot dependent‚Äù means that it is not dependent on another cause, that is, it exists from an existent thing.

original: cung zad mi ltos so zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad mi ltos so zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it is not dependent in the slightest.

original: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa tsam la ltos pa'i phyir dngos po tsam ltos pa'i phyir dngos po tsam gyis 'jig pa yod par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yod pa tsam la ltos pa'i phyir dngos po tsam ltos pa'i phyir dngos po tsam gyis 'jig pa yod par 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, because it depends on the mere existence of a thing, because it is related to the mere thing, the mere thing‚Äôs destruction is established,

original: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not depend on anything else.

original: dngos po de nyid mi rtag par gnas pa las gzhan du yin na ni'o //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid mi rtag par gnas pa las gzhan du yin na ni'o //
translated: If that thing were to be impermanent in a way that is different from its existence,

original: dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang ldan par ro //
translated: then it would not be related to that thing, that is, it would not be related to the impermanent thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nye bar sbyor ba med pas so zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba med pas so zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there would be no connection, that is, because the thing itself is not impermanent.

original: mi rtag pas dngos la ci yang mi sbyor te /
analyzed: mi rtag pas dngos la ci yang mi sbyor te /
translated: Impermanence does not connect with the thing at all,

original: mi nus pas so //
analyzed: mi nus pas so //
translated: because it is not able to.

original: nye bar sbyor ba yod na ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du byed na'o //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba yod na ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du byed na'o //
translated: If there were a connection, that is, if impermanence were to make the thing have the nature of impermanence,

original: gzhan tsi zhig dgos te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan tsi zhig dgos te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: what else would be necessary? The thing itself would be impermanent.

original: 'dis ni bdag gi 'brel pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag gi 'brel pa bsnyad do //
translated: This explains the connection with the self.

original: mi rtag pa de ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur gyi mtshan nyid ni yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa de ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur gyi mtshan nyid ni yin no //
translated: That impermanence is a cause, but it is not a characteristic.

original: chos gzhan de yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos gzhan de yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o //
translated: That other phenomenon is suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
analyzed: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
translated: It is not a cause because it arises later.

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs par bshad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid rigs par bshad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: This very explanation is reasonable.

original: gang kha cig ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu smra ba yod de /
analyzed: gang kha cig ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu smra ba yod de /
translated: However, there are some who propound that the future is a cause.

original: de ni rtsod pa @223b tsam gyis rgyal bar 'dod pa yin gyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid tshad mas spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtsod pa @223b tsam gyis rgyal bar 'dod pa yin gyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid tshad mas spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They assert that they are victorious through mere debate, but they do not engage with the reality of things through valid knowledge.

original: ma 'ongs par ni rang nyid ma skyes pas med pa ma yin nam yod na ni ma 'ongs par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par ni rang nyid ma skyes pas med pa ma yin nam yod na ni ma 'ongs par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the future does not exist because it has not arisen by itself, how could it be future if it exists?

original: rgyu ni nus pa yin la nus pa yang dngos po yod pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni nus pa yin la nus pa yang dngos po yod pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: A cause is a potentiality, and potentiality is only of an existent thing.

original: de lta bas na rnam grangs med pa nyid /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam grangs med pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, it is not a different category.

original: zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: This is just babbling.

original: bla brdol lta bu 'di mkhas pa rnams kyis dpyad par mi 'os so //
analyzed: bla brdol lta bu 'di mkhas pa rnams kyis dpyad par mi 'os so //
translated: The wise should not analyze this.

original: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yang de nyid do zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid dngos po yod pa tsam las gzhan mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yang de nyid do zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid dngos po yod pa tsam las gzhan mi ltos pa'o //
translated: and that which is related to that is also that itself. Impermanence does not depend on anything other than the mere existence of a thing.

original: nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyis byung ba'i 'jig pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyis byung ba'i 'jig pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not deteriorate. The later arising of destruction is not the nature of the thing itself, because the thing does not deteriorate.

original: sngar smos pa'i thal ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po la nye bar sbyor ba yod na ni mi rtag pa gzhan ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: sngar smos pa'i thal ba ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po la nye bar sbyor ba yod na ni mi rtag pa gzhan ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba'i'o //
translated: The previously mentioned absurd consequence is that if the thing were connected with impermanence, what other impermanence would be needed for the thing?

original: gal te mi dmigs pas dgag pa bsgrub pa ma yin nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba yang mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pas dgag pa bsgrub pa ma yin nam mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba yang mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that non-apprehension does not prove negation, because the non-perception of the counter-correlate is also non-apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa thams cad go bar byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa thams cad go bar byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that not all non-apprehension is a proof.

original: 'brel ba 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Some relation must be accepted.

original: de lta na ni 'brel pa'i yul log na de la rag las pa'i rtags kyang ldog pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'brel pa'i yul log na de la rag las pa'i rtags kyang ldog pa nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, then when the related object is absent, the reason, which is dependent on that, would certainly be absent.

original: de lta ma yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas bsgrub par bya ba log kyang gtan tshigs ldog par nges pa med de rtags rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas bsgrub par bya ba log kyang gtan tshigs ldog par nges pa med de rtags rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because it would be a discordant case, even when the probandum is absent, the reason would not be ascertained to be absent, because the reason would not be dependent.

original: rag las na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rag las na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were dependent, then it would be the case that when the probandum is absent, the reason is absent.

original: de lta ma yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba med par yang rtags yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni bsgrub par bya ba med par yang rtags yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be doubt that the reason exists even when the probandum is absent, the probandum would not be understood.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa yod na go bar byed pa yin pa rgyu de yis so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa yod na go bar byed pa yin pa rgyu de yis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by that cause, namely, by the existence of the relation.

original: yang na de yis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal sngas so //
analyzed: yang na de yis zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal sngas so //
translated: Or, ‚Äúby that‚Äù refers to the statement of the master DignƒÅga.

original: rab tu grags pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don ston pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don ston pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWell known‚Äù means teaching the definitive meaning.

original: nges pa nyid kyang 'brel bas 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kyang 'brel bas 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The certainty also comes from the relation, not otherwise.

original: chos mi mthun pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid brjod pa'o //üîΩgal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba bshad pa yin yang /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa brjod pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid brjod pa'o // gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba bshad pa yin yang /
translated: The statement of the dissimilar is the statement of the absence in the dissimilar class.üîΩIf the absence in the dissimilar class is explained as the non-observation of the reason,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba de med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de ma smos kyang @224a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba de med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de ma smos kyang @224a * //
translated: even if the absence in the dissimilar class is not stated by the word ‚Äúabsence,‚Äù

original: rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: it is understood.

original: du ba ni sa phyogs me dang nye ba me dang bral ba dag la ma mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba ni sa phyogs me dang nye ba me dang bral ba dag la ma mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because smoke is seen in places where fire is present and not seen in places where fire is absent.

original: gal te ma mthong ba'i la brul pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba'i la brul pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the absence is stated in order to eliminate doubt about the non-observation,

original: gtan tshigs yang dag pa dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong pa srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa brjod pas ldog bar 'gyur ba sngon mthong ba'i 'khrul pa ni med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yang dag pa dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong pa srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa brjod pas ldog bar 'gyur ba sngon mthong ba'i 'khrul pa ni med do //
translated: since it is impossible to observe a correct reason in the dissimilar class, there is no prior error that is eliminated by stating the absence.

original: gal te ma mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba'i 'khrul pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is an error of non-observation,

original: the tshom ni brjod bas mi ldog ces 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: the tshom ni brjod bas mi ldog ces 'og nas ston to //
translated: Doubt is not refuted by verbal expression, as will be shown below.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma rtogs te brjed nas sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ma rtogs te brjed nas sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not understand the seen as it goes by, and, forgetting it, it is not a branch of practice.

original: mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin la de ni ma brjod kyang bdag la mthong ba med do zhes rang gis go bar nus so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin la de ni ma brjod kyang bdag la mthong ba med do zhes rang gis go bar nus so //
translated: The seen is not seen, and, even though it is not mentioned, one can understand for oneself that there is no seeing.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba yod de de gsal ba'i phyir brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba yod de de gsal ba'i phyir brjod do zhe na /
translated: If one says that there is a path of seeing that is adverse, and that it is expressed because it is clear,

original: mthong ba med pa de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: then that non-seeing is harmed by seeing.

original: ma mthong ba nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If non-seeing did not exist, it would not be harmed.

original: de lta na ni brjod pas ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni brjod pas ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would not be refuted by verbal expression,

original: tshig tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be mere words.

original: gnod pa de med na ni ma mthong ba rang gi ngang gis grub pa kho na yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa de med na ni ma mthong ba rang gi ngang gis grub pa kho na yin pa'o //
translated: If that harm did not exist, non-seeing would be established by its very nature.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs med par go bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs med par go bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If one says that the reason is understood because of the non-observation of the establishment of the adverse,

original: gcig mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gcig mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause one is not observed‚Äù is stated.üîΩ

original: 'brel pa khas mi len na bum pa log pas snam bu log par ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa khas mi len na bum pa log pas snam bu log par ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause one is not observed‚Äù means that if one does not accept a relation, it follows, absurdly, that the negation of a pot is the negation of a cloth.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa des rtags de med par sgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba med pa des rtags de med par sgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of the probandum does not establish the nonexistence of the reason,

original: 'on kyang gtan tshigs gang la dmigs pa de nyid dgag par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtan tshigs gang la dmigs pa de nyid dgag par byed do zhe na /
translated: but rather that it is the very observation of the reason that is being refuted,

original: snang ba mthong ba de med do zhes bya ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: snang ba mthong ba de med do zhes bya ba ni rigs te /
translated: then it would be correct to say that the seeing of light is nonexistent,

original: snang ba de med pa yis te mi snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gtan tshigs med pa ni mi dmigs bas med par grub par mi rigs te 'brel ba khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba tsam dang yod bar 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba de med pa yis te mi snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gtan tshigs med pa ni mi dmigs bas med par grub par mi rigs te 'brel ba khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / ma mthong ba tsam dang yod bar 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nonexistence of that light, that is, the nonexistence of the reason, which is the opposite of the nature of light, cannot be established by nonobservation, because you do not accept a relation, and because mere nonseeing is not contradictory with existence.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam la snang du rung ba ma dmigs pas med pas sgrub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba tsam la snang du rung ba ma dmigs pas med pas sgrub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the existence of the reason is established by the nonobservation of the mere seeing of the opposite,

original: de ltar na khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar na khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, the pervasion is not established.

original: de ni yul dang dus thams cad du nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yul dang dus thams cad du nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a nature that is ascertained in all objects and times.

original: gal te 'dod rgyal gyi bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du khyab bar grub po zhe na /üîΩbya rog dang ta la'i tshul du de ltar srid kyang rtags dang rtags can de dag 'brel pa med na 'dod rgyal gyi yul dang / dus @224b rdzas gar yang khyad par ldog pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dod rgyal gyi bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du khyab bar grub po zhe na / bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du de ltar srid kyang rtags dang rtags can de dag 'brel pa med na 'dod rgyal gyi yul dang / dus @224b rdzas gar yang khyad par ldog pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you say that it is established by the method of a crow or a palm tree,

original: rag ma las pa'i phyir rta dang ba lang bzhin no //
analyzed: rag ma las pa'i phyir rta dang ba lang bzhin no //
translated: it is possible that it is so by the method of a crow or a palm tree, but if there is no connection between the reason and the property to be established, then the exclusion of the property cannot be established in any object or time by the method of a crow or a palm tree, because it is not dependent on it, like a horse or a cow.

original: gal te smra ba po'i ngag phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa la tshad ma yin pa'i phyir des med do //
analyzed: gal te smra ba po'i ngag phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa la tshad ma yin pa'i phyir des med do //
translated: If you say that the words of the speaker are a valid means of knowledge with regard to the property of the subject and so on, and therefore, it is nonexistent.

original: des brjod pas ldog pa rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: des brjod pas ldog pa rtogs so zhe na /
translated: And if you say that the exclusion is understood by its expression,

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid brjod pas rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid brjod pas rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: then because the probandum itself is understood by its expression,

original: gtan tshigs mi dgos par ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi dgos par ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that the reason is not necessary.

original: ldog pa 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon du ma gyur pa thams cad la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs yod mi srid do zhes khyab par 'dod bas so //
analyzed: ldog pa 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs mngon du ma gyur pa thams cad la yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs yod mi srid do zhes khyab par 'dod bas so //
translated: The phrase because of the desire to reverse means that, since the probandum is nonexistent in all instances of the manifestation of the counter-evidence, the evidence is impossible.

original: rig pa nyid 'brel ba nyid du dgongs te gzhan du gtan tshigs rag ma las na bsgrub par bya ba log par nges pa med do //
analyzed: rig pa nyid 'brel ba nyid du dgongs te gzhan du gtan tshigs rag ma las na bsgrub par bya ba log par nges pa med do //
translated: The word only is intended to convey the relation of the evidence to the probandum, for if the evidence were not dependent on the probandum, the probandum could not be ascertained.

original: rta la rag ma las ba'i ba lang bzhin no //
analyzed: rta la rag ma las ba'i ba lang bzhin no //
translated: It would be like a cow that is not dependent on a horse.

original: tshig gis kyang zhes bya ba la mthong ba tsam gyis log pa ma nges na de nyid brjod pa'i tshig gis kyang mi nges so zhes bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: tshig gis kyang zhes bya ba la mthong ba tsam gyis log pa ma nges na de nyid brjod pa'i tshig gis kyang mi nges so zhes bsdu ba ste /
translated: The phrase nor by words means that if the probandum is not ascertained by mere perception, it is not ascertained by words that express it.

original: tshig gis kyang ma mthong ba tsam zhig brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gis kyang ma mthong ba tsam zhig brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For words express only what is not seen.

original: cung zad brjod zin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa rnams so //
analyzed: cung zad brjod zin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase although this has been said refers to the preceding verses.

original: zos pa las gzhan zhes bya ba ni zos pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: zos pa las gzhan zhes bya ba ni zos pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The phrase other than what has been eaten means that what has been eaten is the similar instance.

original: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //üîΩde'i tshe gcig las skyes ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs sam /
analyzed: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // de'i tshe gcig las skyes ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs sam /
translated: The other is the counter-position.

original: gzugs khyad par med pa zhes bya ba dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba med de zos pa las gzhan gtan tshigs dang ldan pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs khyad par med pa zhes bya ba dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs lam mthong ba med de zos pa las gzhan gtan tshigs dang ldan pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, there is no perception of the counter-position by the reason called ‚Äúarisen from one‚Äù or by the reason called ‚Äúundifferentiated form,‚Äù because all that possesses the reason other than what is eaten is taken as the position.üîΩSome say...

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbang phyug sde'i'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbang phyug sde'i'o //
translated: The master Vasubandhu says:

original: phyogs su byed pa'i yul la med //
analyzed: phyogs su byed pa'i yul la med //
translated: There is no object of the position.

original: ces bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not directly perceived.

original: gal te da ltar mngon sum ba yang phyogs mngon sum du zhugs pas gnod par dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar mngon sum ba yang phyogs mngon sum du zhugs pas gnod par dogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that even if it is directly perceived, it is suspected to be contradicted by the position being directly engaged,

original: gzhan la gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa las gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa las gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: then it is said that it is also not established for the other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'brel ba khas mi len na mngon sum gyis gnod pa med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'brel ba khas mi len na mngon sum gyis gnod pa med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because without accepting a connection, there is no certainty without contradiction by direct perception.

original: gzhan yang tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin gyi tshad ma ma zhugs par yang gnod na ni gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin gyi tshad ma ma zhugs par yang gnod na ni gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med de /
translated: Moreover, if something were to be invalidated even when a valid cognition does not engage it, then all reasons would be unreliable,

original: tshad ma zhugs pa gnod pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma zhugs pa gnod pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between a valid cognition that engages and invalidates and one that does not engage and invalidates.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa ni grub pa kho na zhes bya ba smos te nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa ni grub pa kho na zhes bya ba smos te nges pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe exclusion is established, i.e., ascertained, only.‚Äù

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni go bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni go bar byed ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished‚Äù means ‚Äúunderstood.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa kho na sgrub pa'o//
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa kho na sgrub pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a nature‚Äù means ‚Äúestablished only.‚Äù

original: @225a * // nges pa zhes bya ba ni rag las pa la'o //
analyzed: @225a * // nges pa zhes bya ba ni rag las pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAscertained‚Äù means ‚Äúdependent.‚Äù

original: ltos so zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa kho nas ldog pa nges par sgrub nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltos so zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa kho nas ldog pa nges par sgrub nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúRelates‚Äù means ‚Äúonly in connection with it‚Äù is the exclusion ascertained. The meaning is: ‚ÄúIt is able to establish it.‚Äù

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na lhag pa dang ldan pa'i 'khrul ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na lhag pa dang ldan pa'i 'khrul ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If, according to you, there is a superimposition, what kind of error is it?

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy way of non-apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub bar byed pa gzhan no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub bar byed pa gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn any way‚Äù means by other proofs.

original: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shi ba'i lus la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shi ba'i lus la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúsuch things as pots‚Äù include dead bodies, etc.

original: mthong ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù means directly perceived.

original: ma mthong ba ni de ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni de ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnseen‚Äù means not that.

original: de rnams kyis bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the absence of self is pervaded by the absence of life, etc.,

original: gson po'i lus la khyab par byed ba srog la sogs pa med pa log ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la khyab par byed ba srog la sogs pa med pa log ba'i phyir /
translated: the absence of life, etc., which pervades the living body, is negated.

original: khyab par bya ba bdag med pa yang ldog pas na bdag dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba bdag med pa yang ldog pas na bdag dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the pervaded, the absence of self, is also negated, it follows that the existence of self is understood.

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pa can yin zhe na /
translated: If, according to you, the absence of life, etc., is not negated,

original: bdag ltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la med pa nyid du ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir de la srog la sogs pa med pa yang bdag med pas med do zhes pa mi 'grub
analyzed: bdag ltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la med pa nyid du ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir de la srog la sogs pa med pa yang bdag med pas med do zhes pa mi 'grub
translated: Since the non-observation of the unfitting does not establish the non-existence of a self in such things as a pot, then since it does not establish the selflessness of such things as a pot, it does not establish that life-force, etc. do not exist in such things as a pot.

original: pa'i phyir bdag log pa thams cad du srog la sogs pa ldog go zhes bdag log pa la srog la sogs pa ldog pas khyab par ldog ba med do //
analyzed: pa'i phyir bdag log pa thams cad du srog la sogs pa ldog go zhes bdag log pa la srog la sogs pa ldog pas khyab par ldog ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that the cessation of a self is invariably concomitant with the cessation of life-force, etc.

original: de ltar khyab par byed pa ma grub na khyab bar bya ba ldog pa yang mi 'grub pas bdag rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar khyab par byed pa ma grub na khyab bar bya ba ldog pa yang mi 'grub pas bdag rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If the pervasion is not established in that way, then the object of the pervasion is not established, and so it is not established that a self is the creator.

original: da ni ji ltar na bdag 'grub ste de yang med par sangs rgyas pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na bdag 'grub ste de yang med par sangs rgyas pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, how is a self established? Since the Buddhist accepts that it does not exist,

original: gal te khas len pa de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas len pa de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: if you say that the acceptance of it is not a valid cognition,

original: gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i bdag med pa khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sangs rgyas pa'i bdag med pa khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: then the acceptance of the Buddhist‚Äôs selflessness is not a valid cognition.

original: gson po'i lus la bdag med pa khas blangs pa ni kho bo cag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag med pa khas blangs pa ni kho bo cag dang mi mthun pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body of a living being is not a valid example because we do not accept that it is without self,

original: gal te khas blangs pa kho na bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa rnam bar phye nas te mthun par khas blangs nas bum pa bdag med pa nyid du mi mthun par khas blangs pas gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa kho na bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa rnam bar phye nas te mthun par khas blangs nas bum pa bdag med pa nyid du mi mthun par khas blangs pas gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par ro //
translated: then you should not accept that a pot is without self, because you do not accept that it has a self.

original: ma grub spyar ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub spyar ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application of the unestablished reason is: ‚ÄúThe subject, sound, is not a product, because it exists, like nonexistence or like both.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, the application of the unestablished reason to the similar class should be stated as appropriate.

original: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa la sogs pa yang ci rigs par brjod bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med @225b pa dang ; gnyi ga dang zhes bya ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa la sogs pa yang ci rigs par brjod bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med @225b pa dang ; gnyi ga dang zhes bya ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga zhes bya'o //
translated: The application of the unestablished reason to the similar class is: ‚ÄúThe subject, sound, is not a product, because it exists in what is similar to it, like a pot, and because it does not exist in what is dissimilar to it, like space.‚Äù

original: de brjod bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de brjod bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: That is not to be stated.

original: ldog ba mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na /
analyzed: ldog ba mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na /
translated: But if it is merely the non-observation of the opposite that is the reason,

original: the tshom za ba nyid ldog pa nyid de /
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid ldog pa nyid de /
translated: then there is only the elimination of doubt.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs dmigs na the tshom de med par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa med na the tshom du gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs dmigs na the tshom de med par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa med na the tshom du gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: If the reason is observed in the discordant side, then that doubt is eliminated. But if it is not observed, then the doubt remains.

original: the tshom za ba nyid 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa sbyar bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa smos pa dgos pa med do //
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa sbyar bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa smos pa dgos pa med do //
translated: Since it is the doubt itself that is accepted as the reason, it is pointless to add the qualification ‚Äúnon-established‚Äù and say ‚Äúnon-observation of the opposite.‚Äù

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog go zhes byas na mthong ba tsam dang yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog go zhes byas na mthong ba tsam dang yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the reason is the non-observation of the opposite, then since there is no contradiction between mere observation and existence, the doubt that the reason exists in the discordant side is not eliminated.

original: brjod pa gang gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa gang gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa ste /
translated: What is it that is ascertained in both?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par brjod pa yang rgol dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la med par nges pa kho na zhes gsungs pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par brjod pa yang rgol dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la med par nges pa kho na zhes gsungs pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: It is the statement of the non-existence of the reason in the discordant side that is ascertained in both the proponent and the opponent.

original: stsogs pas ni sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: stsogs pas ni sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the establishment and refutation.

original: ci rigs par gsungs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci rigs par gsungs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is it that is said to be appropriate?

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi ma grub pa skyon med pa yang srid pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩldog pa nges pa gsungs pa de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgongs te /
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi ma grub pa skyon med pa yang srid pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // ldog pa nges pa gsungs pa de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgongs te /
translated: It is taught that in the case of an example that is not similar, it is possible that the reason is not established.üîΩThe statement about the certainty of the exclusion is made with the thought that, even though there is non-observation, there is no exclusion because of doubt.

original: the tshom za ba de dag dgag pa med par nges par bshad pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa des na mnyam par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom za ba de dag dgag pa med par nges par bshad pa yin no // gzhan yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa des na mnyam par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The statement about the certainty of the exclusion is made with the thought that, even though there is non-observation, there is no exclusion because of doubt.

original: gal te ldog pa yin du zad mod de /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa yin du zad mod de /
translated: Moreover, if the exclusion were to occur merely through non-observation, then the statement ‚Äúthe equality of the two‚Äù would not be correct.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: Even if there is exclusion, why would it be a reason that eliminates?

original: rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text states, ‚ÄúBecause the exclusion is nothing other than the exclusion of those.‚Äù

original: de dag las ldog pa ni de dag gcod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag las ldog pa ni de dag gcod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The exclusion of those is the very elimination of those.

original: don gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a different object.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba kho na la nges pa na de med pa las ldog pa yin la de nyid rang yod na bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul na bsgrub par bya ba med pa gcod par mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba kho na la nges pa na de med pa las ldog pa yin la de nyid rang yod na bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul na bsgrub par bya ba med pa gcod par mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is ascertainment of the probandum, it is the negation of the absence of that. If that is nonerroneous with regard to the existence of the probandum, then it is nonerroneous with regard to the elimination of the absence of the probandum.

original: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag ba gnyi ga gcod pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag ba gnyi ga gcod pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is not the case that what is to be heard is the negation of both permanent and impermanent, why is that?

original: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes gsungs te /üîΩma mthong ba tsam gyis rtag pa dang mi brtag pa gang las kyang @226a * //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes gsungs te / ma mthong ba tsam gyis rtag pa dang mi brtag pa gang las kyang @226a * //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is not a negation.‚Äù

original: ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir gcod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir gcod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a negation because it is not ascertained that the mere nonseeing of something is a negation of both permanent and impermanent.

original: gal te ldog pa ma nges pa ma yin gyi gnyi ga rnam par gcod par tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ldog pa ma nges pa ma yin gyi gnyi ga rnam par gcod par tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not the case that the negation is not ascertained, then it is because the negation of both is undermined by another valid cognition.

original: tshad ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gang zhe na /
translated: What is the valid cognition?

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can dag ni gcig rnam par bcad pas /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can dag ni gcig rnam par bcad pas /
translated: Those that have mutually exclusive natures, when one is eliminated,

original: gzhan cig shos bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan cig shos bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: The other is established.

original: de ma bsgrubs na cig shos rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma bsgrubs na cig shos rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the other is not established, the first is not eliminated.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid rnam par bcad na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, when permanence is eliminated, impermanence is established.

original: gnyi ga gcod na ni mi rtag pa de nyid dgag par yang 'gyur bas na bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni mi rtag pa cig la 'gal ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga gcod na ni mi rtag pa de nyid dgag par yang 'gyur bas na bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni mi rtag pa cig la 'gal ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But if both are eliminated, then impermanence itself is refuted. Thus, establishment and refutation are contradictory in regard to impermanence.

original: de lta na da ni ma mthong ba ldog pa bsgrub pa'i tshad ma ma yin te tshang ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na da ni ma mthong ba ldog pa bsgrub pa'i tshad ma ma yin te tshang ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, now non-apprehension is not a valid means of cognition that establishes an elimination, because it is undermined by another valid cognition.

original: ji ltar mnyan par bya ba de bzhin du ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa'i bsgrub ba du ba la sogs pa gzhan dag la gnod pa srid do //
analyzed: ji ltar mnyan par bya ba de bzhin du ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa'i bsgrub ba du ba la sogs pa gzhan dag la gnod pa srid do //
translated: Just as it is to be heard, so it is possible that the mere non-apprehension of smoke and so on undermines other things that are to be seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba smos te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa cig la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas de'i mtshan nyid thams cad la yid brtanüîΩdu mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba smos te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa cig la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas de'i mtshan nyid thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ste /
translated: Why? Because it is possible that a fault could occur in regard to something that possesses the characteristic of being reversed by mere non-perception. Therefore, the characteristic of that is refuted. Thus, all of its characteristics are not reliable.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would doubt that it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang zhes zer ba ni rgyang pan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang zhes zer ba ni rgyang pan pa'o //
translated: If one says that it is also in regard to the object of inference, that is a sophistry.

original: 'gal ba mthong bas zhes bya ba ni cig las skyes pas zhes bya ba la mngon sum gyis dang / sgra yin pa'i phyir rtag tu ste sgra'i nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba la byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba mthong bas zhes bya ba ni cig las skyes pas zhes bya ba la mngon sum gyis dang / sgra yin pa'i phyir rtag tu ste sgra'i nyid lta bu'o zhes bya ba la byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas 'gal ba mthong bas so //
translated: Seeing a contradiction is seeing a contradiction by direct perception in arisen from one and by inference in because it is sound, it is permanent, like sound itself.

original: ji skad bshad pa ni med na mi 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i rtags gsum la'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa ni med na mi 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i rtags gsum la'o //
translated: As explained is in regard to the three reasons that possess the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'o //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is impossible‚Äù means that it is undermined by another valid cognition.

original: gal te rtags gsum la 'gal ba mi srid na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bshad pa mi brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rtags gsum la 'gal ba mi srid na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bshad pa mi brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is impossible for the three reasons to be contradictory, then it would be pointless for DignƒÅga, the master, to explain nonerroneous contradiction,

original: rtags gsum gal 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtags gsum gal 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be impossible for the three reasons to be contradictory.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba kho na la yod par gsungs so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can ni rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba kho na la yod par gsungs so snyam pa'o //
translated: He thought that nonerroneous contradiction exists only in relation to the object of affirmation.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la slob dpon gyis ma brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum la mi srid par 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la slob dpon gyis ma brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum la mi srid par 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the master did not mention inference in the three reasons, it is only asserted that it is impossible in the three reasons.

original: 'o na slob dpon gyis gang la @226b gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon gyis gang la @226b gsungs she na /
translated: Well then, what did the master say?

original: 'di'i yul ni le'u gsum pa las bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni le'u gsum pa las bstan par bya'o //
translated: Its object will be explained in chapter 3.üîΩIf it is merely seen, it is not cold,

original: gal te yang mthong ba tsam gyis sa la sogs pa ma mthong ba dag las grang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te yang mthong ba tsam gyis sa la sogs pa ma mthong ba dag las grang ba yang ma yin /
translated: and it is not hot.

original: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'gog par byed na yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba slob dpon gyis gang bshad pa 'brel pa la mi ltos par ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'gog par byed na yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba slob dpon gyis gang bshad pa 'brel pa la mi ltos par ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains that it is illogical to refute something that is not seen without relying on a reason.

original: mthong ba ni sa la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir dgag pa 'di rigs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba ni sa la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir dgag pa 'di rigs pa nyid yin na /
translated: But since it is possible to see earth and so on even when they are not directly perceived, this refutation is logical.

original: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: mi dmigs pas med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te des na dgag par rigs ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te des na dgag par rigs ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause nonobservation establishes nonexistence.‚Äù Therefore it is logical to refute something that is not seen.

original: snang ba yod na snang du rung ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba yod na snang du rung ba'o //
translated: If light exists, it is suitable to see it.

original: de'i yul ni snang ba'i yul te /
analyzed: de'i yul ni snang ba'i yul te /
translated: Its object is the object of light.

original: rtogs pa po mngon sum du gyur pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po mngon sum du gyur pa'i chos can no //
translated: The subject is the one who perceives it directly.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it?

original: bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas te /
analyzed: bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika asserts that earth and so on are generally perceptible.

original: 'di ltar dro ba'i reg pa ni me'i yon tan no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar dro ba'i reg pa ni me'i yon tan no ;
translated: Thus heat is a quality of fire.

original: ; grang ba ni chu'i'o //
analyzed: ; grang ba ni chu'i'o //
translated: Cold is that of water.

original: grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa ni rlung gi'o //
analyzed: grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa ni rlung gi'o //
translated: Neither hot nor cold is that of wind.

original: de ltar nas dang chu dang me snang ba dang / mi snang pa thams cad la reg pa btang snyoms pa med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: de ltar nas dang chu dang me snang ba dang / mi snang pa thams cad la reg pa btang snyoms pa med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgag pa smras so //
translated: Thus, since the absence of equanimity is not perceived in all that is hot, cold, or neither hot nor cold, whether it is manifest or not manifest, the refutation is stated.

original: gal te ji ltar na ma dmigs pas dgag pa 'di rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na ma dmigs pas dgag pa 'di rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is this refutation not reasonable because of non-perception?‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThat also is not so.‚Äù

original: de yod kyang zhes bya ba ni sa nyid de yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yod kyang zhes bya ba ni sa nyid de yod kyang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Even though it exists‚Äù means even though earth exists.

original: reg pa tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa tha dad pa ste /
translated: There is a difference in contact.

original: 'jam pa dang / yang ba nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa mthong ba yod de sa'i srab nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgrang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang / yang ba nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa mthong ba yod de sa'i srab nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir / grang ba yang ma yin /
translated: The difference in smoothness, lightness, and so on is seen, because earth is not the same in thinness.

original: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'di yangs la sogs pa'i bye brag 'gal zhig la srid par dog par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'di yangs la sogs pa'i bye brag 'gal zhig la srid par dog par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Neither hot nor cold contact is possible in space, because the difference of hot, cold, and so on is not possible in space.

original: yul de ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te zhes bya ba ni skyu ru ra bska ba mthong gi mngar bar ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yul de ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te zhes bya ba ni skyu ru ra bska ba mthong gi mngar bar ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The sour taste is seen, but the sweet taste is not seen.

original: de ltar mngar la sgyur ba ma mthong ba tsam gyis skyu ru ra mthong ba tsam skyu ru ra bska ba kho nar 'grub par mi 'gyur te ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar mngar la sgyur ba ma mthong ba tsam gyis skyu ru ra mthong ba tsam skyu ru ra bska ba kho nar 'grub par mi 'gyur te ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Just because the sweet taste is not seen, the sour taste is not established as sour just by seeing the myrobalan fruit. Why is that?

original: rgyu dag la khyad par srid na de'i 'bras bu yon tan dag la khyad par srid pa dag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dag la khyad par srid na de'i 'bras bu yon tan dag la khyad par srid pa dag gi phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is a possibility of a difference in the causes, there is a possibility of a difference in the effects, the qualities.

original: 'dir yang skyu ru ra dang bska ba nyid dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang skyu ru ra dang bska ba nyid dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Here too, because there is no connection between the myrobalan fruit and sourness,

original: bska ba med kyang skyu ru ra nyid mi ldog go snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: bska ba med kyang skyu ru ra nyid mi ldog go snyam du dgongs so //
translated: even without sourness, the myrobalan fruit itself is not excluded.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'grub pa'i 'brel par rig byed @227a * //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu'i khyad par 'grub pa'i 'brel par rig byed @227a * //
translated: Here, in order to refute the connection of the difference of the effect being established from the cause,

original: dgag pa bzhed nas /
analyzed: dgag pa bzhed nas /
translated: he says,

original: rgyu la khyad par med na ni //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu la khyad par med na ni //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
translated: If there is no difference in the cause,üîΩthen there is no difference in the effect.

original: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du spyod pas bshad la de la ni rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du spyod pas bshad la de la ni rgyu la khyad par med pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa nyid du rjes su dpag go //
translated: The Vedas are explained to be uncreated by a person, but they are inferred to be created by a person because there is no difference in their cause.

original: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par med ce na /
translated: How is there no difference?

original: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because there is no difference in the words.

original: / zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩskyes bus byas pa'i tshig dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smos te / skyes bus byas pa'i tshig dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: de'i phyir skyes bus byas par yang grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bus byas par yang grub bo //
translated: Therefore, they are also established as created by a person.

original: gal te de nyid ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid ji ltar shes she na /
translated: If so, how is that known?

original: thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because all are seen to be created by persons.

original: sgra gsal ba dang ; mi gsal ba dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dag dang dug zhi ba la sogs pa dang / don brjod pa dang / go dka' ba la sogs pa thams cad skyes bus byed par mthong ste /
analyzed: sgra gsal ba dang ; mi gsal ba dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dag dang dug zhi ba la sogs pa dang / don brjod pa dang / go dka' ba la sogs pa thams cad skyes bus byed par mthong ste /
translated: Because all‚Äîclear and unclear sounds, long and short sounds, pacification of poison, etc., expressions of meaning, difficult to understand, etc.‚Äîare seen to be created by persons.

original: rig byed kyi sgra la yod pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad skyes bus byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed kyi sgra la yod pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad skyes bus byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature that exists in the words of the Vedas is all created by a person.

original: de ltar na de na skyes bus byas pa dag dang / rang bzhin khyad par med pas rgyu la khyad med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang skyes bus byas par khyad par med pa nyid dpag ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de na skyes bus byas pa dag dang / rang bzhin khyad par med pas rgyu la khyad med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang skyes bus byas par khyad par med pa nyid dpag ste /
translated: Thus, since it is established that there is no difference in the cause, because there is no difference between what is created by a person and nature, it is inferred that the effect is also not different in being created by a person.

original: khyad par rgyu med pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rgyu med pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a difference has no cause.

original: de ltar grub na skyes bus byas pa dang / khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid med de /
analyzed: de ltar grub na skyes bus byas pa dang / khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid med de /
translated: If that is established, then because it is not different from what is created by a person, it does not have a nature that is not created by a person.

original: skyes bus byas pa'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the nature of what is created by a person.

original: yang na skyes bus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na skyes bus byas pa yin te /
translated: Or it is created by a person,

original: skyes bu dang rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu dang rang bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not different from a person and nature. This is the meaning.

original: yang na rgyu la khyad par yod na 'bras bu'i khyad par dpag pa'i phyir skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa dgag pa dpyod pa pa smra bas yang dag par bzhed nas /
analyzed: yang na rgyu la khyad par yod na 'bras bu'i khyad par dpag pa'i phyir skyes bu thams cad mkhyen pa dgag pa dpyod pa pa smra bas yang dag par bzhed nas /
translated: Or else, in order to infer the difference of effect when there is a difference of cause, the Dialecticist, who is a thorough-going advocate of the theory of causality,

original: gang gis na tshig la sogs pa cung zad ces bya ba smos te /üîΩ'dis na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyis ma 'brel ba dang / rtags su 'dod pa smra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gis na tshig la sogs pa cung zad ces bya ba smos te / 'dis na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyis ma 'brel ba dang / rtags su 'dod pa smra ba'i phyir //
translated: says, ‚Äúby what, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: He refutes the theory that there is no natural connection between cause and effect, and the theory that the effect is a mere logical mark.

original: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa yon tan thams cad la goms par byas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu chen po khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa yon tan thams cad la goms par byas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu chen po khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the difference is seen in all the qualities‚Äù means that the difference of small, medium, great, and very great is seen in all the qualities such as learning, art, etc., because of the cause of practice, etc.

original: de'i phyir lus dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i @227b rtags ni skyu ru ra yin pa'i phyir bska ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ltar 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i @227b rtags ni skyu ru ra yin pa'i phyir bska ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ltar 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚Äúbecause of being associated with the body,‚Äù in the statement, ‚Äúhe is associated with desire because of being associated with the body,‚Äù is mistaken, just like the reason, ‚Äúbecause of being a myrobalan fruit,‚Äù in the statement, ‚Äúit is only astringent.‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In other cases‚Äù means in the case of one who is free from desire, etc.

original: de dag la yang lung phyin ci log pa goms pa'i legs par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyus khyad par de lta bu srid do //
analyzed: de dag la yang lung phyin ci log pa goms pa'i legs par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyus khyad par de lta bu srid do //
translated: In those cases, such a distinction is possible because of the special effect of the practice of the erroneous scriptures.

original: 'dod chags dang bral pa sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa srid par bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral pa sogs pa la sgrub par byed pa srid par bstan nas /
translated: Having shown that the proof of one who is free from desire, etc. is possible,

original: 'gog par byed pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog par byed pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that there is no refutation,

original: mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúin the case of an inference of impossibility.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi srid par ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi srid par ro //
translated: ‚Äú In the case of an inference of impossibility‚Äù means in the case of the impossibility of one who is free from desire, etc.

original: ci'i phyir gnod ba can med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnod ba can med ce na /
translated: Why is there no refutation?

original: 'dod chags bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause one who is free from desire is not seen,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te 'bras bu la 'dod chags dpog pa de nyid gnod pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu la 'dod chags dpog pa de nyid gnod pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the very fact that the result of passion is inferred is the reason for the nonexistence of passion,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúThe result of passion, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dod chags kho nas bskyed pa'i tshig kyang srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kho nas bskyed pa'i tshig kyang srid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is possible that the words are produced by passion alone,

original: srid kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúIt is possible, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i tshig srid kyang tshig gi bye brag ni rtogs par dka' ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig srid kyang tshig gi bye brag ni rtogs par dka' ste /
translated: Even though such words are possible, it is difficult to understand the distinction of words.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags dang bral ba yang chags pa ltar smra ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags dang bral ba yang chags pa ltar smra ste /
translated: Because of the power of necessity, one who is free from passion speaks as if he were passionate,

original: dgra po dang slu ba na'o //
analyzed: dgra po dang slu ba na'o //
translated: when he is deceiving an enemy.

original: de las bzlog pa yang smra ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yang smra ste /
translated: He also speaks in the opposite way,üîΩwhen he is deceiving a friend.

original: de'i phyir bye brag blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir rtags mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir rtags mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the distinction cannot be seen, the reason is not established.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir spong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir spong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that passion is abandoned because one who is free from passion is not seen,

original: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba smos te ma mthong ba tsam dag ni'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba smos te ma mthong ba tsam dag ni'o //
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúSuch, etc.‚Äù

original: spang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to abandon mere non-seeing.

original: ma mthong ba dang yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dang yod par mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because not seeing does not contradict existence.

original: gal te rig byed kyi tshig dag la yang khyad par yod mod kyi blta bar mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi tshig dag la yang khyad par yod mod kyi blta bar mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that although there is a difference in the words of the Vedas, it cannot be seen,

original: tshig rnams ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshig rnams ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe words . . .

original: dug sel ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dug sel ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the differences of the words, such as the word for ‚Äòpoison‚Äô and the word for ‚Äòantidote,‚Äô can be seen.

original: gal te de ltar bltar mi rung ba'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bltar mi rung ba'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a difference that cannot be seen,

original: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven if there is a difference that cannot be seen . . .

original: rigs mi mthun pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúDissimilar‚Äù means not made by a person, and so on.

original: khyad par bltar mi rung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par bltar mi rung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the difference not seen,

original: 'di ltar dug sel ba la sogs pa snang ba de dag ni gzhan skyes bu'i sgra rnams la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dug sel ba la sogs pa snang ba de dag ni gzhan skyes bu'i sgra rnams la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words that appear, such as the word for ‚Äòpoison‚Äô and the word for ‚Äòantidote,‚Äô can be used by other people.

original: gal te khyad par mngon sum yin yang 'khrul pa'i phyir mi nges te skad cig ma bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par mngon sum yin yang 'khrul pa'i phyir mi nges te skad cig ma bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that although the difference is directly perceived, it is not ascertained because of error, like the case of the momentary,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúEven if there is error . . .

original: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i yang /üîΩ@228a * // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i yang / @228a * // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And there is no reason for error.

original: bye brag bltar rung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //
analyzed: bye brag bltar rung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means not only that the difference is not visible.

original: ci'i phyir 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan med ce na /
translated: Why is there no reason for error?

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because there is no sublation.

original: skad cig mam yin pa nyid du 'khrul ba la ni rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed ba'i phyir 'khrul bar 'grub po //
analyzed: skad cig mam yin pa nyid du 'khrul ba la ni rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed ba'i phyir 'khrul bar 'grub po //
translated: In the case of the error that sound is not momentary, inference is the sublater, and so the error is established.

original: sgra rnams mtshungs pa nyid du 'dzin pa la ni gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul ba nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: sgra rnams mtshungs pa nyid du 'dzin pa la ni gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul ba nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: But in the case of the apprehension of the sameness of sounds, there is no sublater, and so the error is not established.

original: gal te skyes bu dag 'dra bar 'dzin pa la yang gnod par byed pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu dag 'dra bar 'dzin pa la yang gnod par byed pa med do zhe na /
translated: But in the case of the apprehension of the sameness of persons, there is no sublater.

original: skyes bu dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, Persons are not the same, etc.

original: gal te khyad par tshig la gzhan yin pa'i sgra rtags kyang de mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par tshig la gzhan yin pa'i sgra rtags kyang de mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason, ‚Äúbecause the words are different,‚Äù is not established,

original: tshig gi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistinctions of words‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa rnams kyang skyes bus ma byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'ga' yang skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa rnams kyang skyes bus ma byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'ga' yang skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction, even those produced by a person would become not produced by a person, and it would follow that nothing is produced by a person.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa med pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa med pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa med pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa med pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because there is no reversal merely by seeing that which is unrelated, therefore the phrase ‚Äúmerely that connection‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: kha cig slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa'i tshig 'brel ba ston pa dang / de rnams shes byed ces lung tsam du smra zhing 'brel ba ston pa'i tshig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs pa smra ba yod de /
analyzed: kha cig slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa'i tshig 'brel ba ston pa dang / de rnams shes byed ces lung tsam du smra zhing 'brel ba ston pa'i tshig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs pa smra ba yod de /
