translated: Some say that the master DignƒÅga‚Äôs explanation of the words ‚Äúrevealing a connection‚Äù and ‚Äúthose are the means of knowledge‚Äù is merely scriptural citation, and there is an argument that the words ‚Äúrevealing a connection‚Äù are the reason and the words ‚Äúthe state of cause and effect‚Äù and so on are the thesis.

original: de ni sgra'i bstan bcos kyi dri ba 'dir smra ba yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sgra'i bstan bcos kyi dri ba 'dir smra ba yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: That is a statement in the treatise on grammar here, but it is not the meaning.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i don 'di rnams ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i tshig gi don rnams kyang 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i rigs par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i don 'di rnams ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i tshig gi don rnams kyang 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i rigs par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these topics taught in the treatise of reasoning is the nature of the reason and so on. Therefore the meaning of the words of master Dignaga should be taught as reasoning that establishes the connection.

original: de lta ma yin na rigs par 'dod pa dag kyang lung nyid du nus so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rigs par 'dod pa dag kyang lung nyid du nus so //
translated: Otherwise, even those who assert reasoning would be able to make it scripture.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni gsum kho na ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni gsum kho na ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the three reasons for negation is that of master Dignaga.

original: ma rtogs pa ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Noncomprehension is the nonobservation of effect and so on.

original: rtogs pa ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'o //üîΩtshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'o // tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las /
translated: Comprehension is the observation of the opposite of the nature and so on.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter, the chapter on inference for oneself, in the treatise Discerning the Meaning through Reasoning.

original: // / gal te rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: // / gal te rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If inference is the nature of consciousness,

original: ji ltar sgra rjes su dpag par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra rjes su dpag par brjod ce na /
translated: how is sound said to be inferred?

original: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu @228b btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu @228b btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the effect is designated from the cause.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni rgyu dang bcas par 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni rgyu dang bcas par 'brel ba'o //
translated: The cause of designation is the connection with the cause.

original: dgos pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bskyed par nus pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bskyed par nus pa bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The purpose is the ability to generate inferential knowledge for the sake of understanding the specific.

original: ma grub pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang ba la sogs pa ni mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: ma grub pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang ba la sogs pa ni mi nus pa yin la /
translated: Non-establishment, incomplete concomitance, etc. are not able to do that.

original: dam bca' ba dang por brjod pas yang mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: dam bca' ba dang por brjod pas yang mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Also, stating the thesis first is not able to do that.

original: nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ni nus pa'i tshig las lhag ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ni nus pa'i tshig las lhag ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Since the application and conclusion are remnants of able statements, they are not proofs. Thus it is taught.

original: de lta bas na ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba brjod pa'i sbyor ba'i ngag ni tshad ma'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba brjod pa'i sbyor ba'i ngag ni tshad ma'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that a statement of application free from faults such as non-establishment is a valid means of knowledge.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas dngos po la mthong ba ma yin pa lung las mthong ba ni dper na grangs can pa kha cig na re /üîΩgzhan phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas par rtogs par bya ba'i ched yin pa'i phyir grangs can rgol ba rang gi rtags ma mthong yang ste /
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas dngos po la mthong ba ma yin pa lung las mthong ba ni dper na grangs can pa kha cig na re / gzhan phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas par rtogs par bya ba'i ched yin pa'i phyir grangs can rgol ba rang gi rtags ma mthong yang ste /
translated: Both the proponent and opponent do not see things in the scriptures, for example, some SƒÅ·πÉkhya say:üîΩEven though the proponent SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not see the reason in himself,

original: rang la ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang la ma grub kyang sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: he proves it for the sake of the opponent, the Buddhist, in order to make him understand.

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;üîΩ/ ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin na de grangs can bdag nyid la ma grub ste /
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ; / ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin na de grangs can bdag nyid la ma grub ste /
translated: For example, in the statement ‚Äúpleasure and so on,‚Äù

original: dngos po yod pa nyid gsal ba la skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid gsal ba la skye bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on refers to arising from what has not occurred. That is not established for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya himself because he asserts that the manifestation of an existent thing is arising.

original: yod pa gtan nas med par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa yin na grangs can de ni yod pa mi mthong ba las mi rtag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa gtan nas med par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa yin na grangs can de ni yod pa mi mthong ba las mi rtag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And nonexistence that becomes nonexistent is impermanence, but the SƒÅ·πÉkhya asserts that impermanence is seeing existence.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni don gyis don rtogs par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni don gyis don rtogs par byed pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of inference‚Äù means that which is understood through the meaning of a word.

original: de ltar dngos po go bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po go bar byed pas na /
translated: Thus, since it is understood through a thing,

original: lung ni tshig yin pa'i phyir ngag tshad ma nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ni tshig yin pa'i phyir ngag tshad ma nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: scripture is not a valid means of knowledge because it is words.

original: gal te ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask why it is not a valid means of knowledge,

original: gang tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya brtags 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya brtags 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if it were a valid means of knowledge, it would not be called inference,

original: ngag gi dam bcas pa sgrub par 'dod pa'i don grub na'o //
analyzed: ngag gi dam bcas pa sgrub par 'dod pa'i don grub na'o //
translated: because the purpose of a statement is to establish a thesis.

original: gal te ngag khyad par can zhes bya ba 'dir smras pa'i skye ba can nam mi rtag pa'i lung ngo //
analyzed: gal te ngag khyad par can zhes bya ba 'dir smras pa'i skye ba can nam mi rtag pa'i lung ngo //
translated: If you say that ‚Äúspecial speech‚Äù is the scripture that states that things are produced or are impermanent,

original: 'di ni lung gi tshad ma ba'i skabs le'u gnyis par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni lung gi tshad ma ba'i skabs le'u gnyis par ro //
translated: this is the chapter on the validity of scripture.

original: gal te lung 'di la sngar dpyad pas mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung 'di la sngar dpyad pas mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this scripture is not undermined by the previous analysis,üîΩthen also in this case,

original: gzhan yang 'di la zhes bya ba ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa lung 'di la'o ;
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la zhes bya ba ni skye ba can nam mi rtag pa lung 'di la'o ;
translated: with regard to this scripture that states that things are produced or are impermanent,

original: / mi slu ba'i tshad ma'i khyad par gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / mi slu ba'i tshad ma'i khyad par gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa ni cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference in the non-deceptive valid cognition of others.

original: ngag nyid don dang ma 'brel ba nyid du 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag nyid don dang ma 'brel ba nyid du 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because speech itself is connected with the meaning.

original: mi slu na ni zhes bya ba don dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu na ni zhes bya ba don dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: If it is non-deceptive, it is connected with the meaning.

original: des grub pa ni zhes bya ba dngos po dang 'brel ba des so //
analyzed: des grub pa ni zhes bya ba dngos po dang 'brel ba des so //
translated: By that, it is established, connected with the thing.

original: grub pa des ni gzhan sangs @229a * //
analyzed: grub pa des ni gzhan sangs @229a * //
translated: By that establishment, the other,

original: rgyas pa 'ba' zhig grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyas pa 'ba' zhig grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: only the established is not established.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa ni khyod nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa ni khyod nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which comes by the power of the thing is established for you yourself.üîΩIt is not that one engages after accepting,

original: khas blangs nas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pas don 'grub par byas nas don gdod dpyod pa'i brtag ba 'jug pa ni ma yin te dpyad pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs nas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pas don 'grub par byas nas don gdod dpyod pa'i brtag ba 'jug pa ni ma yin te dpyad pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one does not engage in analysis for the sake of establishing the meaning by accepting the other's position, because analysis would be pointless.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Then what?

original: brtag par rtsom pa na ni khas blangs par 'os sam mi 'os zhes dpyod pa pa khas len pa'i rgyu sems pas rgyu brtags nas gdod khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag par rtsom pa na ni khas blangs par 'os sam mi 'os zhes dpyod pa pa khas len pa'i rgyu sems pas rgyu brtags nas gdod khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one begins to investigate, one analyzes whether or not it is suitable to accept it, and one accepts it only after having investigated the cause of the acceptance.

original: sangs rgyas pa de'i lung dang gnod pa sems pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang pha rol sangs rgyas pa la skye ba can dang mi rtag pa smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de'i lung dang gnod pa sems pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang pha rol sangs rgyas pa la skye ba can dang mi rtag pa smras pa /
translated: The Buddhist, in order to prove that the scriptures of the Buddhist are not undermined, and in order to prove that the opponent, the Buddhist, is not a proponent of arising and impermanence,

original: gnod pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa de'i lung 'di tshad ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnod pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa de'i lung 'di tshad ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: says that the scriptures of the Buddhist are valid cognitions because they are not undermined.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa des grub pa'i skye ba can dang / mi rtag pa ni dngos por grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub ba de las ji ltar bsgrub par bya bar sems pa med pa 'grub /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa des grub pa'i skye ba can dang / mi rtag pa ni dngos por grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub ba de las ji ltar bsgrub par bya bar sems pa med pa 'grub /
translated: But since arising and impermanence are not established as things by a nonvalid cognition, the reason is not established. How could one prove that the Buddhist has no belief in the establishment of the object?

original: gal te gtan tshigs nge skye ba can la sogs pa'i lung dang ldan pa sangs rgyas pa de la grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs nge skye ba can la sogs pa'i lung dang ldan pa sangs rgyas pa de la grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is established for the Buddhist, who has scriptures such as ‚Äúarising,‚Äù

original: don gyis don dpyod pa'i skabs na gang gi lung gang yin te /
analyzed: don gyis don dpyod pa'i skabs na gang gi lung gang yin te /
translated: In the context of the analysis of reality, what is the scripture of what?

original: lung ni gang gi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung ni gang gi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that scripture does not prove anything for anyone.

original: gal te khas blangs pa'i'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa'i'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the scripture of those who accept it,

original: lung de skye ba can gyi tshad mas gnod na khas mi len pa'i phyir ji ltar lung yin /
analyzed: lung de skye ba can gyi tshad mas gnod na khas mi len pa'i phyir ji ltar lung yin /
translated: then how can it be scripture if it is not accepted because it is undermined by valid cognition?

original: gal te tshad mas gnod kyang bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir lung yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas gnod kyang bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir lung yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is scripture because it is accepted by oneself even though it is undermined by valid cognition,

original: nges khas blangs pa tsam gyis rang gi lung zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs te /
analyzed: nges khas blangs pa tsam gyis rang gi lung zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs te /
translated: then it is not right to say that it is one‚Äôs own scripture merely because it is accepted.

original: skye bo lung khas blangs pa med par reng bur skyes gyur cing lhan cig pa'i lung med do //
analyzed: skye bo lung khas blangs pa med par reng bur skyes gyur cing lhan cig pa'i lung med do //
translated: If a person is born in a place where scripture is not accepted, then there is no scripture that is common to both.

original: gal te phyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pas rang gi lung yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pas rang gi lung yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is one‚Äôs own scripture because one later accepts one‚Äôs own tenets,

original: tshad mas bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang / tshad mas gnod pa'i skyon ma mthong bar te /
analyzed: tshad mas bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang / tshad mas gnod pa'i skyon ma mthong bar te /
translated: then it is not scripture because it is not accepted before one sees the good qualities established by valid cognition and the faults undermined by valid cognition.

original: mi rtog par grub mtha' 'dzin pa 'di /
analyzed: mi rtog par grub mtha' 'dzin pa 'di /
translated: This is because one holds tenets without thinking.

original: kye ma ste kye hud rmongs pa'i tha snyad dbang byed par gzhan gyis byin nam /
analyzed: kye ma ste kye hud rmongs pa'i tha snyad dbang byed par gzhan gyis byin nam /
translated: Alas! Alas! Are the ignorant controlled by others?

original: 'di rang nyid 'gal bas len pa ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rang nyid 'gal bas len pa ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not right for them to accept this, because it is contradictory.

original: sangs rgyas pa de'i lung dang / 'gal ba bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med pa nyid khas blangs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa de'i lung dang / 'gal ba bde ba la sogs pa sems pa med pa nyid khas blangs te /
translated: The Buddhists accept that pleasure and so on are not consciousness, because they contradict the scriptures.üîΩSince the scriptures are undermined by valid cognition, they are not valid.

original: lung la gnod pa'i tshad mas khas blangs pas lung tshad ma ma yin par byas nas yang @229b lung de nyid kyis bstan pa skye ba can la sogs pa de ltar gtan tshigs grub pa yin /
analyzed: lung la gnod pa'i tshad mas khas blangs pas lung tshad ma ma yin par byas nas yang @229b lung de nyid kyis bstan pa skye ba can la sogs pa de ltar gtan tshigs grub pa yin /
translated: The scriptures themselves prove that the teachings of arising and so on are not valid.

original: gal te lung de khas blangs pa yis grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung de khas blangs pa yis grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is established because the scriptures are accepted,

original: lung de khas blangs nas yang lung de la tshad mas gnod phyir lung de btang ba yin la /
analyzed: lung de khas blangs nas yang lung de la tshad mas gnod phyir lung de btang ba yin la /
translated: then the scriptures are rejected because they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: btang ba'i lung ni lung gi tshad ma ma yin pas des grub pa yang ma yin ma grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang ba'i lung ni lung gi tshad ma ma yin pas des grub pa yang ma yin ma grub pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement of the opponent is not a valid scriptural source, it is neither established nor unestablished. Therefore, since it is not a part of the proof, it is not right to infer the conclusion.

original: gal te tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir lung ma yin yang sangs rgyas pa des khas blangs pas lung du gzhag pa yin la tshad mas gnod pas byas pa'i skye ba can la sogs pa grub pa ma yin pa de gtan tshigs su byas te /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir lung ma yin yang sangs rgyas pa des khas blangs pas lung du gzhag pa yin la tshad mas gnod pas byas pa'i skye ba can la sogs pa grub pa ma yin pa de gtan tshigs su byas te /
translated: If you say that the opponent‚Äôs scriptural statement is not a valid scriptural source, but it is posited as a scriptural source because the Buddhist accepts it, and that the existence of things that arise from causes, etc., is not established because it is undermined by valid knowledge, and that this is the reason,

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sems pas med pa'i dngos po gnas pa'i phyir yang dngos po legs par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ste ba sting ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir sems pas med pa'i dngos po gnas pa'i phyir yang dngos po legs par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ste ba sting ba'o //
translated: then the argument is: ‚ÄúThe existence of things is well established because things endure without mind.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi lung gang yin ma grub par ma zad kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa 'gal ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi lung gang yin ma grub par ma zad kyi gtan tshigs ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa 'gal ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only is the scripture of the opponent not established, but also the reason is not established.

original: gal te gtan tshigs skye ba can la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pas gzhan la kho bo cag la ni ma grub mod kyi zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs skye ba can la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pas gzhan la kho bo cag la ni ma grub mod kyi zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason, arising, etc., is not established for us because of the opponent‚Äôs assertion,

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then the response is that the reason is not established because of the person‚Äôs assertion.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i byas pa ni gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa dag kyang dngos po la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i byas pa ni gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod pa dag kyang dngos po la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Those who assert that the product is a reason are not certain that it engages the thing,

original: mi slu bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not certain that it is nondeceptive.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang bye brag med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang bye brag med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not different from a fallacious reason.

original: yang na 'dod pa ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par nges pa med pa ste /
translated: Or, the assertion is not certain to engage the thing as it is,

original: bdag nyid la 'jug pa'i tshig brjod par 'dod pa mthong bas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la 'jug pa'i tshig brjod par 'dod pa mthong bas so //
translated: because one sees that the expression of engagement is asserted by the person himself.

original: dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa nyid yang de rtags shes pa'i rtogs pa la ltos te /
analyzed: dngos po la gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa nyid yang de rtags shes pa'i rtogs pa la ltos te /
translated: The meaning of the reason exists in the thing itself.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: In terms of the realization of the reason, it is the probandum and the proof.

original: rtags kyi don med par rtogs pa tsam 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi don med par rtogs pa tsam 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: But the mere realization of the meaning of the reason does not exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa ma yin na /
translated: If the mere conceptualization did not prove the probandum,

original: gang gi phyir pha rol gyis khas blangs pa rtogs pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol gyis khas blangs pa rtogs pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: then how could the probandum be established by the mere realization of what the opponent accepts?

original: gal te skye pha la sogs pa dngos por yod pa yang srid do snyam na yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te skye pha la sogs pa dngos por yod pa yang srid do snyam na yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that arising and so on exist as things, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúEven if they existed,‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa dngos po yod kyang rtags rtogs pa lung tsam las grub bas dngos pos byas ba ma yin na @230a * //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dngos po yod kyang rtags rtogs pa lung tsam las grub bas dngos pos byas ba ma yin na @230a * //
translated: even though arising and so on exist as things, the reason is established by mere citation in the realization of the reason. Therefore it is not created by a thing.

original: rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni rtags ma yin dngos pos yod ba'i rtogs pa dang bye brag med pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni rtags ma yin dngos pos yod ba'i rtogs pa dang bye brag med pa ste /
translated: Since it is not a realization, it is not a reason. It is not different from the realization of the existence of a thing.

original: rtags tshad mas ma nges pa ni yid ches par byed pa ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags tshad mas ma nges pa ni yid ches par byed pa ma yin par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason is not ascertained by a valid cognition, it is not a means of conviction.

original: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu ni gtan tshigs yin la de lta bu'i rtags shig yin na ni tshad mas nges pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po la grub pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na ci'i phyir grangsüîΩcan bdag nyid la sogs pa lam grub /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu ni gtan tshigs yin la de lta bu'i rtags shig yin na ni tshad mas nges pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po la grub pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na ci'i phyir grangs can bdag nyid la sogs pa lam grub /
translated: If a reason is like the one explained above, which is an effect, nature, or non-observation, and if it is such a reason, then it is ascertained by a valid cognition. Therefore, if the definition of a reason is that it is established for both parties, why is it not established for the proponent himself?

original: gal te rang nyid la tshad mas ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang nyid la tshad mas ma grub po zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established for the proponent himself?üîΩIf he says that it is not established for himself by a valid cognition,

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba la yang tshad ma las gzhan gyis rtags 'grub par rigs pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba la yang tshad ma las gzhan gyis rtags 'grub par rigs pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then it is not reasonable for the proponent to establish the reason for the opponent, the Buddhist, by means of something other than a valid cognition.

original: gal te lung las grub pa rtags ma yin na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i rtags kyis thal bar bsgrub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung las grub pa rtags ma yin na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i rtags kyis thal bar bsgrub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If a scripture is not a reason, how can one prove a consequence by means of a reason accepted by the opponent?

original: thal bar 'gyur ba ni pha rol gyis kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba ni pha rol gyis kun brtags pa ste /
translated: The consequence is imagined by the opponent.

original: 'gal ba'i chos khas blangs pas de'i 'gal ba ston par zad kyi bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos khas blangs pas de'i 'gal ba ston par zad kyi bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that by accepting contradictory properties, one is simply demonstrating their contradiction, but one is not establishing the probandum.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, for example,

original: dpyod pa pa dang bye brag pa dang gang dag spyi ni gcig pur khas len la /
analyzed: dpyod pa pa dang bye brag pa dang gang dag spyi ni gcig pur khas len la /
translated: the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and NaiyƒÅyikas accept that universals are singular,üîΩand that the particulars, which are ascertained as objects, times, and states, are the many.

original: rang gi gsal ba yul dang / dus dang / gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag gsal ba gcig dang rnam par mchad pa zhes bya ba spyi'i rang bzhin cha shas lus pa med par spyi rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid 'dre ste 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi gsal ba yul dang / dus dang / gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag gsal ba gcig dang rnam par mchad pa zhes bya ba spyi'i rang bzhin cha shas lus pa med par spyi rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid 'dre ste 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: They assert that the nature of a universal is to be mixed with, that is, to be related to, a single manifest thing without remainder, that is, without exception, of the universal‚Äôs parts.

original: spyi la de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gcig las gzhan ma 'brel ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa du ma la 'jug par yang khas len to //
analyzed: spyi la de dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin gcig las gzhan ma 'brel ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dod pa du ma la 'jug par yang khas len to //
translated: This is because a universal is related to that which is related to it, but it is not related to that which is not related to it.

original: de la 'di ltar 'gal ba khas blangs pa ston te gsal ba du ma 'jug pa spyi gcig po de yul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'gal ba khas blangs pa ston te gsal ba du ma 'jug pa spyi gcig po de yul la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is illogical for a single universal to engage in objects and so on

original: dus dang gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag bzhin du gzhan du ste /üîΩdu mar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus dang gnas skabs nges pa'i bye brag bzhin du gzhan du ste / du mar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: in different ways, in other words, in a manifold way.

original: gcig pu'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi spyi ni yul la sogs pa ste dus dang gnas skabs gzhan de mi 'dra ba rnams dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba 'jug par 'gal te /
analyzed: gcig pu'i rang bzhin de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi spyi ni yul la sogs pa ste dus dang gnas skabs gzhan de mi 'dra ba rnams dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba 'jug par 'gal te /
translated: A single entity that has such a nature cannot be said to be related to other different objects and so on, that is, times and occasions. It is contradictory for a single entity to engage in multiple things.

original: gcig dang du ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because singularity and multiplicity are mutually exclusive.

original: de ltar khas len pa de ni chos du ma la 'jug pa gcig khas blangs na /
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa de ni chos du ma la 'jug pa gcig khas blangs na /
translated: The point of teaching this is to show that if one asserts that a single entity engages in many phenomena,

original: cig shos rang bzhin tha dad pa khas blangs par bstan pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: cig shos rang bzhin tha dad pa khas blangs par bstan pa'i don du ste /
translated: one is asserting that the other, the phenomena, are of different natures.

original: de ltar na gcig nyid dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig nyid dang 'gal lo //
translated: In that case, it would contradict the assertion of oneness.

original: gal te tha dad @230b pa nyid khas mi len na ste gcig nyid du 'dod na tha dad par ldog par 'gyur bas du ma la 'jug pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gal te tha dad @230b pa nyid khas mi len na ste gcig nyid du 'dod na tha dad par ldog par 'gyur bas du ma la 'jug pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If you do not accept difference, and instead assert that they are the same, then since difference is excluded, it would contradict engaging in multiplicity.

original: gal te de ltar gyur pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy would that be the case?‚Äù

original: du ma la 'jug pa la tha dad pas de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir dbye bar mi nus pas tha dad pa log na du ma la 'jug pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma la 'jug pa la tha dad pas de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir dbye bar mi nus pas tha dad pa log na du ma la 'jug pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since engaging in multiplicity is pervaded by difference, it is impossible to separate them. Therefore, if difference is refuted, engaging in multiplicity would also be refuted.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid yin pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid yin pa ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is that nature established?‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'brel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù indicates a connection by way of identity.

original: bzhin du ste dpe la'o //
analyzed: bzhin du ste dpe la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike‚Äù refers to the example.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig par ro //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEntity‚Äù refers to a single nature.

original: 'brel to zhes bya ba ni 'brel bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel to zhes bya ba ni 'brel bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs connected‚Äù indicates a connection is understood.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang zhig du ma la 'jug pa de ni tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig du ma la 'jug pa de ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: That which engages in multiplicity is different.

original: rdzas dang yul la sogs pa du ma la zhugs pa'i sngon po dang ser po lta bu'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdzas dang yul la sogs pa du ma la zhugs pa'i sngon po dang ser po lta bu'o zhes so //
translated: For example, blue and yellow engage in many substances, objects, and so on.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi ste gal te spyi la tha dad pa mi srid pa der ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur snyam pa'o //üîΩlan sbyin pa ni tha dad pa mi srid na du ma la 'jug pa de yang spyi de srid de /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi ste gal te spyi la tha dad pa mi srid pa der ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur snyam pa'o // lan sbyin pa ni tha dad pa mi srid na du ma la 'jug pa de yang spyi de srid de /
translated: Now, the opponent thinks, if it is impossible for a universal to be different, how can it be cognized?

original: khyab par byed pa tha dad pa log pa la khyab par bya ba du ma la 'jug pa ldog pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa tha dad pa log pa la khyab par bya ba du ma la 'jug pa ldog pas khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reply is: If it is impossible for it to be different, then its occurrence in many is also impossible, because the occurrence of the pervaded in many is necessarily concomitant with the negation of the difference of the pervader.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i gsal ba gcig bzhin no //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa'i gsal ba gcig bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the case of an individual that is restricted to a particular place.

original: gal te du ma la 'jug pa'i gcig po de mi ldog par khas len na de la khyab par byed pa tha dad pa gzhan de nges par 'thob pa'i phyir tha dad pa dor bar dka'o //
analyzed: gal te du ma la 'jug pa'i gcig po de mi ldog par khas len na de la khyab par byed pa tha dad pa gzhan de nges par 'thob pa'i phyir tha dad pa dor bar dka'o //
translated: If you accept that the occurrence of the one in many is not negated, then it is difficult to avoid the difference, because the difference of the pervader is necessarily obtained.

original: gal te khyab pa de lta mod kyi sangs rgyas pa la thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te khyab pa de lta mod kyi sangs rgyas pa la thal bar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma grub ste /
translated: Even if you accept the pervasion, the Buddhist opponent says, the reason ‚Äúbecause it occurs in many‚Äù is not established.

original: rang gi 'dod pa spyi gcig du ma la 'jug par 'dod pa las gzhan du gnas te /üîΩde lta bu mi 'dod pa'i phyir te /üîΩgal te de khas blangs na dam bcas pa la rang gi 'dod pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pa spyi gcig du ma la 'jug par 'dod pa las gzhan du gnas te / de lta bu mi 'dod pa'i phyir te / gal te de khas blangs na dam bcas pa la rang gi 'dod pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from what is to be inferred, because the meaning of the reason is the property of the subject.

original: rtags kyi don gang rtogs na de rtogs nas rang gi khyab par byed pa mi 'dor pa'i phyir shugs kyis gzhan med de khyab par byed pa'i chos kyang rtogs te /üîΩkhyab par bya ba gang khas blangs pas khyab par byed pa de khas blangs par 'gyur te'o //
analyzed: rtags kyi don gang rtogs na de rtogs nas rang gi khyab par byed pa mi 'dor pa'i phyir shugs kyis gzhan med de khyab par byed pa'i chos kyang rtogs te / khyab par bya ba gang khas blangs pas khyab par byed pa de khas blangs par 'gyur te'o //
translated: It is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the predicate, because the meaning of the predicate is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the pervasion, because the meaning of the pervasion is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the example, because the meaning of the example is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the thesis, because the meaning of the thesis is included in the meaning of the reason.

original: don las don rtogs pa de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' gzhan du gnas kyang don rtogs pa la gags byed cing phan pa yang med pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' gzhan du gnas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i skabs na ma yin no //
analyzed: don las don rtogs pa de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' gzhan du gnas kyang don rtogs pa la gags byed cing phan pa yang med pa'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' gzhan du gnas pa'i skyon brjod pa'i skabs na ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the proof statement, because the meaning of the proof statement is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the proof statement, because the meaning of the proof statement is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the proof statement, because the meaning of the proof statement is included in the meaning of the reason.üîΩIt is not the case that the meaning of the reason is different from the meaning of the proof statement, because the meaning of the proof statement is included in the meaning of the reason.

original: de lta bas na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal yang don gang rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa de dang de dag thams cad khas blang bar bya ste'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal yang don gang rigs pa'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa de dang de dag thams cad khas blang bar bya ste'o //
translated: Therefore, even if it contradicts tenets, whatever meaning is established by the power of reasoning should be accepted.

original: @231a * // yang na 'ga' yang ste khyab par byed pa khas mi len na /
analyzed: @231a * // yang na 'ga' yang ste khyab par byed pa khas mi len na /
translated: Or else, if one does not accept the pervader,

original: khyab bar bya ba rang gis khas blangs pa'i rtags kyi chos du ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyab bar bya ba rang gis khas blangs pa'i rtags kyi chos du ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: one should also accept the pervaded, such as the many properties of the reason that are accepted by oneself.

original: khyab par byed pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not accept the pervader.

original: de ltar grub pa'i mtha' ma grub kyang skyon med do zhes smras nas da ni ma grub pa yang ma yin ba nyid du bstan par bzhed pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar grub pa'i mtha' ma grub kyang skyon med do zhes smras nas da ni ma grub pa yang ma yin ba nyid du bstan par bzhed pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having said that, even if the tenets are not established, there is no fault, now, wishing to teach that they are not even unestablished, he says, ‚ÄúThey are not even unestablished.‚Äù

original: gal te du ma la 'jug pa yin pa lta na tha dad ba 'di yang yin la tha dad pa ma yin na du ma la 'jug pa dang gnyi ga ma yin no zhes chos de gnyis 'brel bar ston ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te du ma la 'jug pa yin pa lta na tha dad ba 'di yang yin la tha dad pa ma yin na du ma la 'jug pa dang gnyi ga ma yin no zhes chos de gnyis 'brel bar ston ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is applied to many, then it is different, and if it is not different, it is applied to many.

original: gcig tu nges par gcig du ma la 'jug pa nyid du yongs su bzung nas rtags ma grub pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi de ltar khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par gcig du ma la 'jug pa nyid du yongs su bzung nas rtags ma grub pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi de ltar khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one definitely holds that one is applied to many, then this fault of the sign being unestablished would arise, but we do not accept that.

original: yang na gtan tshigs du ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa dngos po'i don du yod na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal yang rtags la khyab pa'i rigs pa'i stobs las thob pa ni nges par yongs su gzung bar rigs te /
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs du ma la 'jug pa la sogs pa dngos po'i don du yod na grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal yang rtags la khyab pa'i rigs pa'i stobs las thob pa ni nges par yongs su gzung bar rigs te /
translated: Or, if the reason is applied to many things and so on, and exists as an actual object, then it contradicts our tenets. But if it is definitely held to be established by the power of reasoning that pervades the sign,

original: sngar bshad pa ltar de khas blangs na zhes smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar de khas blangs na zhes smos pa bzhin no //
translated: then it is like what was said earlier, ‚ÄúIf one accepts it as explained.‚Äù

original: 'o na don 'di sngar bshad ma thag pa nyid yin pas zlog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don 'di sngar bshad ma thag pa nyid yin pas zlog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But this point was just explained, so it would be reversed.

original: ma yin te gal te khas blangs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te gal te khas blangs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: No, it is not, for if one accepts it, is it not damaged?

original: khas blangs pas rigs pa la gnod par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di bstan pa'i 'brel ba'i don du bzlas pas so //
analyzed: khas blangs pas rigs pa la gnod par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di bstan pa'i 'brel ba'i don du bzlas pas so //
translated: It will be explained below that acceptance cannot damage reasoning.

original: de lta bas na khyab par bya ba'i chos gcig khas blangs pa can gyis nges par chos gzhan khyab par byed pa khas blang par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyab par bya ba'i chos gcig khas blangs pa can gyis nges par chos gzhan khyab par byed pa khas blang par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one who accepts a single pervasion must definitely accept another pervader.

original: rigs pas byas pa la grub pa'i mtha' dag gi gnod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas byas pa la grub pa'i mtha' dag gi gnod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for reasoning to damage a tenet.

original: gzhan yang gtan tshigs gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba de med na yang rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs te gtso bor gyur pa du ma la 'jug ba zhes bya ba nyid kyis 'dod pa rtogs te khyab par bya ba du ma la 'jug pa yin la
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan tshigs gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba de med na yang rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs te gtso bor gyur pa du ma la 'jug ba zhes bya ba nyid kyis 'dod pa rtogs te khyab par bya ba du ma la 'jug pa yin la
translated: Moreover, even if there is no such thing as a reason that applies to many instances, the root reason, which is the primary reason, is said to apply to many instances, and thus it is understood to be what is accepted. It pervades many instances.

original: de la yang khyab bar byed pa tha dad pa nyid du gnas pa'i dngos po 'di sngon po dang ser po la sogs par sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: de la yang khyab bar byed pa tha dad pa nyid du gnas pa'i dngos po 'di sngon po dang ser po la sogs par sgrub par byed la /
translated: and the thing that is the basis of the pervader is established as blue, yellow, etc.

original: des ni ldog pa'i khyab pa tha dad pa med na du ma la 'jug pa'i yang ldog par ston pas du mal 'jug pa dang gcig nyid 'gal bar ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: des ni ldog pa'i khyab pa tha dad pa med na du ma la 'jug pa'i yang ldog par ston pas du mal 'jug pa dang gcig nyid 'gal bar ston par byed kyi /
translated: Since that shows that if the pervader is not different, the pervaded is also not different, it shows that being a unity and being a plurality are mutually exclusive.

original: de las bzlog pa du ma la 'jug pa dang gcig mi 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa du ma la 'jug pa dang gcig mi 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not prove that the opposite of that, being a plurality and being a unity, are not mutually exclusive.

original: gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya @231b ba'i gtan tshigs tshad ma can ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya @231b ba'i gtan tshigs tshad ma can ma yin te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbeing a unity and being a plurality‚Äù is not a valid reason.

original: 'gal ba'i don de 'dra ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don de 'dra ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the meaning of contradiction to be like that.

original: gal te kho bo yang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pas thal bar 'gyur ba byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kho bo yang skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pas thal bar 'gyur ba byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that we also commit the fallacy of overextension,

original: gal te 'dir yang du ma la 'jug pa de bzhin du sems pa med pa bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba dgag par bya bar thal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang du ma la 'jug pa de bzhin du sems pa med pa bzlog pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba dgag par bya bar thal ba yin na /
translated: If, in the same way, the non-existence of consciousness is refuted here, then impermanence and origination would be refuted.

original: khyed grangs can pa'i smra ba 'ga' yang de ltar dgag par byed ba ni med de skye ba dang / mi rtag pas sems pa can 'gog par zad pas so //
analyzed: khyed grangs can pa'i smra ba 'ga' yang de ltar dgag par byed ba ni med de skye ba dang / mi rtag pas sems pa can 'gog par zad pas so //
translated: But you SƒÅ·πÉkhyas do not refute anything in that way, because you refute consciousness with impermanence and origination.

original: gal te de ltar dgag par bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dgag par bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that is what is to be refuted,

original: de ltar bya ba yang mi nus te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba yang mi nus te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that it is not possible to do that.

original: dgag pa de mi nus so //
analyzed: dgag pa de mi nus so //
translated: That refutation is not possible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems pa can gzhan dag skye ba dang mi rtag pa 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir /üîΩthal bar 'gyur ba skye ba 'am /
analyzed: sems pa can gzhan dag skye ba dang mi rtag pa 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir / thal bar 'gyur ba skye ba 'am /
translated: Because it is not established that origination and impermanence are contradictory for other conscious beings.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa can /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir sems pa med pa can /
translated: Because of the consequence of origination or impermanence,üîΩthe non-existence of consciousness

original: thal ba las bzlog pa sems pa med pa log pas skye ba la sogs pa ldog bdag gi gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa sems pa med pa log pas skye ba la sogs pa ldog bdag gi gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not a logical reason that refutes origination, etc. because the opposite of the consequence, the non-existence of consciousness, is reversed by the reversal of origination, etc.

original: gal te go bar byed pa ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar thal ba ni gang skye ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te go bar byed pa ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na / 'di ltar thal ba ni gang skye ba 'am /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it like to be unestablished?‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa de sems pa med ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa de sems pa med ba ste /
translated: The reductio is as follows: Whatever is arisen or impermanent is unconscious,

original: dper na bum pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: like a pot, for example.

original: 'dir sems pa can skye ba can la sogs pa 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir sems pa can skye ba can la sogs pa 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the opponent does not establish the contradiction of being conscious and being arisen, and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgol bas ni sems nyid skye ba dang mi rtag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgol bas ni sems nyid skye ba dang mi rtag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the opponent sees the mind itself as arisen and impermanent.

original: thal ba las bzlog pa gang sems can de ni skye ba la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: thal ba las bzlog pa gang sems can de ni skye ba la sogs pa med de /
translated: The reversal of the reductio is: Whatever is conscious is not arisen, and so on,

original: dper na bdag shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin na 'di yang sems pa can mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'gal ba phyir rgol ba las ma grub bo //
analyzed: dper na bdag shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin na 'di yang sems pa can mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'gal ba phyir rgol ba las ma grub bo //
translated: like the existent consciousness of the self, for example. But this is also not established for the opponent because of the contradiction of being conscious and being impermanent, and so on.

original: gal te ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù

original: sngar rgyu mtshang pa med pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sngar rgyu mtshang pa med pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe arising of that which lacks a previously existing basis,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is that not established?‚Äù

original: skye ba can dang mi rtag pa rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod pa la sems pa can byung na /üîΩskye ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dag phan tshun spangs pas sems pa can du gnas pa dang / de sbangs pas skye ba la sogs par gnas pa'i 'gal ba 'di dag ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba can dang mi rtag pa rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod pa la sems pa can byung na / skye ba la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dag phan tshun spangs pas sems pa can du gnas pa dang / de sbangs pas skye ba la sogs par gnas pa'i 'gal ba 'di dag ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the sentient being exists as having birth and impermanence,üîΩthen birth, etc., would not exist, and the sentient being would abide in birth and destruction, and these contradictions would not be established, because it is seen that the sentient being is also born and also perishes.

original: sems pa can yang yin la skye ba dang 'jig pa can yang yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa can yang yin la skye ba dang 'jig pa can yang yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the contradictions of the two halves of the syllogism are not established, because the sentient being is seen to be both permanent and impermanent,

original: gal te khyod kyis thal ba dum la 'jug pa dang gcig pa dag ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis thal ba dum la 'jug pa dang gcig pa dag ji ltar 'gal zhe na /
translated: we reply, what is the contradiction in the two halves of the syllogism?

original: gcig pa'i yang zhes bya ba smos te rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa 'ba' @232a * //
analyzed: gcig pa'i yang zhes bya ba smos te rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa 'ba' @232a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only are permanence and impermanence contradictory,üîΩbut also birth and non-birth, and so on.

original: zhig tu ma zang do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //üîΩgcig pa ni spyi'o //
analyzed: zhig tu ma zang do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //üîΩgcig pa ni spyi'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that not only are permanence and impermanence contradictory,üîΩbut also birth and non-birth, and so on.

original: rnam par mchad par 'brel ba zhes sngar ji skad smos pa du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mchad par 'brel ba zhes sngar ji skad smos pa du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir yul la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because of the admission that the object, etc., are empty of the nature of the manifold, as previously explained in the statement, ‚Äúthe connection is a manifold of parts,‚Äù there is no connection of the object, etc.,

original: dus dang rdzas gzhan dang spyi 'brel ba zhes bya ba 'jug pa med de gcig de yin pa dang du ma dang 'brel pa gcig de ma yin pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang rdzas gzhan dang spyi 'brel ba zhes bya ba 'jug pa med de gcig de yin pa dang du ma dang 'brel pa gcig de ma yin pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with time, with another substance, or with a universal, because the one being that and the manifold being connected with that are mutually exclusive, since they are characterized by the exclusion of one from the other.

original: de lta bas na thal dbu ma la 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad de sngon po dang / ser po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thal dbu ma la 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad de sngon po dang / ser po lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to enter into the Madhyamaka, one should understand that the universal is not different from the particulars, like blue and yellow,

original: spyi yang du ma la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa tha dad pa med na du ma la 'jug pa yang med de /
analyzed: spyi yang du ma la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa tha dad pa med na du ma la 'jug pa yang med de /
translated: and that the universal is a manifold, and that the opposite of the reductio, ‚Äúif there were no difference, there would be no manifold,‚Äù

original: dper na yul la sogs pa nges pa'i gsal ba gcig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yul la sogs pa nges pa'i gsal ba gcig bzhin no //
translated: is like the case of a single manifest thing, the object, etc., being ascertained.

original: spyi yang tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtags go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi yang tha dad pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtags go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: And the reason that proves that the universal is not different is understood.

original: slob dpon dag gis zhes bya ba dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga la sogs pas so //üîΩgal te gcig dang du ma la 'jug pa dag 'gal mod spyi ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: slob dpon dag gis zhes bya ba dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga la sogs pas so // gal te gcig dang du ma la 'jug pa dag 'gal mod spyi ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Vasubandhu and so on.üîΩIf it is argued: Although the application to one and to many are contradictory, the universal has the nature of both,

original: 'gal bdag ni zhes bya ba smos te du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba du ma'i rang bzhin gcig khas blangs na /
analyzed: 'gal bdag ni zhes bya ba smos te du ma la 'jug pa zhes bya ba du ma'i rang bzhin gcig khas blangs na /
translated: it is said: The contradictory... If the application to many, that is, the nature of many, is accepted as one,

original: gcig nyid yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid yongs su gtong ste /
translated: one is relinquished.

original: spong ba med na ste gcig ma yin khas mi len na du ma rang bzhin du khas blangs mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: spong ba med na ste gcig ma yin khas mi len na du ma rang bzhin du khas blangs mi 'byung ste /
translated: If it is not relinquished, that is, if one is not accepted, the acceptance of the nature of many does not occur,

original: mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is impossible.

original: spyi la gcig dang / gcig ma yin pa'i chos gnyi ga yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi la gcig dang / gcig ma yin pa'i chos gnyi ga yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not have both the attributes of being one and not being one.

original: gal te spyi de lta bu med na ni ji zhig la dpyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te spyi de lta bu med na ni ji zhig la dpyod par byed ce na /
translated: If such a universal does not exist, what is being analyzed?

original: dpyad pa'i skabs ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpyad pa'i skabs ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: The occasion of analysis...

original: grub pa'i mtha'i don dpyad pa'i skabs na'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i don dpyad pa'i skabs na'o //
translated: The occasion of analyzing the meaning of tenets.

original: grub pa'i mtha' rigs pa 'am mi rigs par khas blangs ba'i phyir de las grags pa'i don khas blangs te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rigs pa 'am mi rigs par khas blangs ba'i phyir de las grags pa'i don khas blangs te /
translated: Because the tenets are accepted as either reasonable or unreasonable, the meaning that is renowned in those is accepted.

original: de la dpyad pa bya'i de lta ma yin na de'i don dpyod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dpyad pa bya'i de lta ma yin na de'i don dpyod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is analyzed in that way, because if it were not, it would not be analyzed in terms of its meaning.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du khas blangs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du khas blangs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúelsewhere,‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' las gzhan du spyi med par khas blangs nas spyi dpyad pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las gzhan du spyi med par khas blangs nas spyi dpyad pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unreasonable to analyze universals without accepting that universals exist elsewhere than in the tenets.

original: de ltar lung las mthong ba bkag nas rnam bar btags ba dag ga pa'i phyir don med ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar lung las mthong ba bkag nas rnam bar btags ba dag ga pa'i phyir don med ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, having refuted seeing in terms of scripture, it says, ‚Äúbecause it is meaningless,‚Äù in order to refute seeing in terms of nominal designations.

original: dngos bor gyur ba'i nye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos bor gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dngos bor gyur ba'i nye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos bor gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubsisting in things‚Äù means that it is concomitant with things.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is it?

original: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod bas gang yang rung zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba yin par brjod do //
analyzed: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod bas gang yang rung zhes bya ba'i 'dra ba yin par brjod do //
translated: It is said to be a similarity that is any of the expressions that the speaker wishes to express.

original: res 'ga' bum pa @232b dang ; sgrar 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ces smras la gzhan yang nam mkha' dang sgrar 'dra ba'i phyir rtag pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: res 'ga' bum pa @232b dang ; sgrar 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ces smras la gzhan yang nam mkha' dang sgrar 'dra ba'i phyir rtag pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: Sometimes it is said that sound is impermanent because it is similar to a pot, and sometimes it is said that sound is permanent because it is similar to space.

original: mi rtag pa'i zla yin pas dang rtag ba'i zla yin bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i zla yin pas dang rtag ba'i zla yin bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause it is the counterpart of the impermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is the counterpart of the permanent‚Äù is just that.

original: gal te rtag pa dang cig shos kyi zla gnyi ga ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang cig shos kyi zla gnyi ga ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If the counterpart of the permanent and the counterpart of the impermanent are both like that, how are they?

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod bar 'dod pa mi rtag pa dang ; cig shos mi rtag pa ma yin pa dag la ring ba dang ring ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod bar 'dod pa mi rtag pa dang ; cig shos mi rtag pa ma yin pa dag la ring ba dang ring ba med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the speaker who wishes to say that the impermanent and its counterpart are distant or not distant,

original: nye ba dang 'gal ba dang / mi 'gal bdag smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ltar sbyar bar zad do //
analyzed: nye ba dang 'gal ba dang / mi 'gal bdag smra ba po brjod par 'dod pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ltar sbyar bar zad do //
translated: that is, near or not near, or that they are contradictory or not contradictory, does not exist in the object of his desire.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni sngar mi rtag pa dang 'dra bar smras nas yang brjod par 'dod pa rtag pa dang 'dra bar brjod par mi bya ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni sngar mi rtag pa dang 'dra bar smras nas yang brjod par 'dod pa rtag pa dang 'dra bar brjod par mi bya ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the nature of the thing itself, then, just like impermanence, it should not be stated again as permanence, which is the opposite of impermanence.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pa 'gyur ba ma yin gyi cig car du'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pa 'gyur ba ma yin gyi cig car du'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the thing is not changed by the desire to state it, but is stated simultaneously,

original: dus gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf it is stated simultaneously, etc.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rim 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rim 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Again‚Äù means that it is only a sequence.

original: de bzhin du 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sgra 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sgra 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú It would not engage in that way‚Äù means that the word would not engage in accordance with the thing.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs de lta bu ni sgra tsam du zad kyi don ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs de lta bu ni sgra tsam du zad kyi don ni med do //
translated: Therefore such a reason is just a word; it has no meaning.

original: de'i phyir de las don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las don mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is not established from that.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dag la rtags de lta bu ni ring ba ste ldog pa dang / nye ba ste rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dag la rtags de lta bu ni ring ba ste ldog pa dang / nye ba ste rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a reason is distant, i.e., not established as the opposite of, or as the consequence of, the characteristics of things.

original: gal te ring ba dang nye ba de grub na ni gang yang rung ba cig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ring ba dang nye ba de grub na ni gang yang rung ba cig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: If that far and near were established, then it would be understood that it is one or the other.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba rgyab kyi cha mthong ba'i dus 'ga' zhig tu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba rgyab kyi cha mthong ba'i dus 'ga' zhig tu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúin some place‚Äù means ‚Äúat some time when the back part is seen.‚Äù

original: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba rva can dang 'dra ba'i'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba rva can dang 'dra ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means ‚Äúlike the one with horns.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di ltar dngos pos ma yin na yang kho bos de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid grub po zhe na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar dngos pos ma yin na yang kho bos de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid grub po zhe na'o //
translated: If it is not so by way of an entity, still permanence is established because we assert it thus.

original: 'dod bas sbyar ba des don rtag pa 'am mi rtag bas stong pa de'i phyir de ltar brjod par 'dod pa tsam ni 'bras bu'i sgra'i sgo nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod bas sbyar ba des don rtag pa 'am mi rtag bas stong pa de'i phyir de ltar brjod par 'dod pa tsam ni 'bras bu'i sgra'i sgo nas kyang ngo //
translated: Since the object is empty of permanence or impermanence, the mere wish to express it thus is also by way of the result of the word.

original: don rtag pa 'am cig shos ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: don rtag pa 'am cig shos ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: The object is not established as permanent or impermanent.

original: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa dngos po kho nal 'jug par nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa dngos po kho nal 'jug par nges pa med pa ste /
translated: The speaker‚Äôs wish to express is not ascertained to engage only the entity.

original: 'di ltar chu klung gi 'gram na bu ram gyi phung po yod do zhes med bzhin du yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu klung gi 'gram na bu ram gyi phung po yod do zhes med bzhin du yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when someone says, ‚ÄúThere is a pile of sugar cane on the bank of the river,‚Äù one goes there, even though there is no sugar cane.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa la dngos pos khyab pa ma grub pas na 'dod pas byas pa'i rtags dngos po la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa la dngos pos khyab pa ma grub pas na 'dod pas byas pa'i rtags dngos po la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion of the thesis by the thing is not established, the reason produced by the thesis is mistaken with respect to the thing.

original: 'dod btsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na /
analyzed: 'dod btsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin na /
translated: If it were merely related to the thesis,

original: @233a * // 'dod pa las ni dngos po yang ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rjes su 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @233a * // 'dod pa las ni dngos po yang ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i rjes su 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: then the thing would not be related to the thesis, because the thing is different from the thesis.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa des byas pa'i rtags ni dngos po la 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa des byas pa'i rtags ni dngos po la 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason produced by the thesis is mistaken with respect to the thing.

original: mngon sum ni phyogs kyi ngag rang gis so //
analyzed: mngon sum ni phyogs kyi ngag rang gis so //
translated: Direct perception is the statement of the position by oneself.

original: brgyud pas ni phyogs kyi dag las skyes pa la brten nas so ;
analyzed: brgyud pas ni phyogs kyi dag las skyes pa la brten nas so ;
translated: Indirectly, it is based on what is produced from the statement of the position.

original: / phyogs dang rtags brjod dag ces bya ba ji ltar de rtags brjod pa ni sbyor ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: / phyogs dang rtags brjod dag ces bya ba ji ltar de rtags brjod pa ni sbyor ba'i ngag yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: How is it that the statement of the reason is not an expression, because it is a statement of the syllogism?

original: rang gi sgrub byed du gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi sgrub byed du gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not present as a proof‚Äù means that it is not present as a direct means of establishing the object.

original: dngos su don rtogs bsgrub par byed par gnas bar yod pa ma yin par phyogs dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su don rtogs bsgrub par byed par gnas bar yod pa ma yin par phyogs dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is similar to the position.

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúStatement‚Äù means sound.

original: 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no certainty of relation‚Äù means that it is used by the power of intention.

original: gdags par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i ngag ni sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: gdags par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i ngag ni sgrub par byed pa rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is asserted to be a designation‚Äù means that the statement of the proof is the cause of understanding the proof.

original: gdags pa'i dogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gdags pa'i dogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The doubt about the designation has been explained previously.

original: gal te de las zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi ngag las so //
analyzed: gal te de las zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi ngag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf from that‚Äù means from the statement of the position.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does it operate?

original: sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod na ci'i phyir zhes the tshom du 'gyur ba las byas pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi ngag 'jug go //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod na ci'i phyir zhes the tshom du 'gyur ba las byas pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi ngag 'jug go //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù because of the doubt, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù the statement of the reason operates.

original: nang du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi don to //
analyzed: nang du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúInner understanding‚Äù means the object that is its nature.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the immediately preceding [statement].

original: de dran pa skyed ba zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i don dran pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dran pa skyed ba zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i don dran pa skyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt produces memory‚Äù means that it produces memory of the object included in the three modes.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni don tshul gsum kho na yin par ma zad kyi ngag kyang tshul gsum brjod pa kho nar nus pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni don tshul gsum kho na yin par ma zad kyi ngag kyang tshul gsum brjod pa kho nar nus pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means that not only is the object just the three modes, but also speech is only able to express the three modes.

original: yul brjod pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: yul brjod pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe statement of the object‚Äù is the position.

original: rtags brjod ba 'jug pa mi srid pa ni rtags yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags brjod ba 'jug pa mi srid pa ni rtags yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe statement of the reason is impossible‚Äù because the reason does not exist in the object.

original: 'di brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni brgyud bas kyang ni nus ma yin zhes bya ba dang / the tshom las kyang shes bar 'dod pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni brgyud bas kyang ni nus ma yin zhes bya ba dang / the tshom las kyang shes bar 'dod pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis has already been stated‚Äù refers to ‚ÄúEven indirectly, it is not possible‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt is asserted that knowledge is from doubt.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dogs pa med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dogs pa med pa yang yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù means that not only is it not possible, but also there is no doubt.

original: nges par de ma bstan to zhes bya bar ni phyogs so //
analyzed: nges par de ma bstan to zhes bya bar ni phyogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is certain that it is not taught‚Äù is the position.

original: gal te snga phyi gang du yang chad bas bcad pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: gal te snga phyi gang du yang chad bas bcad pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: If it were, then it would be a place where it is cut off at any time.

original: tshig bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te ma bsal ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshig bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te ma bsal ba yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not correct to say that there are four, because it is not excluded.

original: 'di bzhi ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'jug ba bsal bas ni gnod par 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir logs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'di bzhi ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'jug ba bsal bas ni gnod par 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir logs su bstan to //
translated: These four are taught separately in order to exclude the fault of not applying the characteristics of the position.

original: nges par khas blangs pa ni sgra mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: nges par khas blangs pa ni sgra mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The definite assertion is that sound is impermanent.

original: @233b de'i med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i yon tan no //
analyzed: @233b de'i med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i yon tan no //
translated: Its non-concomitant is the quality of space.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni dper na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni dper na /
translated: The concomitant is, for example,

original: bdag med par khas blangs pa'i med na mi 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong bdag ste /
analyzed: bdag med par khas blangs pa'i med na mi 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong bdag ste /
translated: the impermanence, suffering, and emptiness of the self, which are the concomitants of the assertion of selflessness.

original: de dag khas ma blangs na bdag med ba mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de dag khas ma blangs na bdag med ba mi 'byung bas so //
translated: If those are not asserted, selflessness does not occur.

original: skabs kyi ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bas bdag med do zhes brtsad pa ni /
analyzed: skabs kyi ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bas bdag med do zhes brtsad pa ni /
translated: The context is this: The Buddha said, There is no self.

original: grangs can gyis skabs de bzlog pa'i phyir smras ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: grangs can gyis skabs de bzlog pa'i phyir smras ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya says this in order to refute that.

original: bdag gi don zhes ma smras kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi don zhes ma smras kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though ‚Äúfor the sake of the self‚Äù is not stated, it is understood.

original: de lta ma yin na rtags don med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dus pa ma yin ba'i don byed pa nyid do zhes khyad bar gzhan spangs pa'i tshig gis chos kyi bye brag nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtags don med pa'i phyir ro // 'dus pa ma yin ba'i don byed pa nyid do zhes khyad bar gzhan spangs pa'i tshig gis chos kyi bye brag nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, the reason would be meaningless.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes other distinctions of the property, such as ‚Äúit performs a function that is not a composite.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya bar gzhan ma spangs pa'i tshig gis chos can gyi bye brag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya bar gzhan ma spangs pa'i tshig gis chos can gyi bye brag tu byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa noncomposite object‚Äù excludes other distinctions of the subject.

original: rnam par gzhag pa tsam zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod ba'i lugs tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa tsam zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod ba'i lugs tsam mo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmere designation‚Äù is a mere convention of verbal expression.

original: de ltar brjod pa las chos kyi bye brag las bzlog ba bsgrub ba'i 'gal ba dang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i ming gi khyad par tsam gyi 'gal ba nyid ni gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa las chos kyi bye brag las bzlog ba bsgrub ba'i 'gal ba dang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba'i ming gi khyad par tsam gyi 'gal ba nyid ni gcig kho na'o //
translated: Thus, from the statement, the contradiction of proving the opposite of the distinction of the property and the contradiction of proving the opposite of the distinction of the subject are merely different names for the same contradiction.

original: gal te gzhan zhes smras kyang 'dus pa na yin pa zhes ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhes smras kyang 'dus pa na yin pa zhes ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the word ‚Äúother‚Äù is not that of a collection,

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin bye brag can de dag tu 'dod pas 'dus pa ma yin pa kho na'i don zhes skabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin bye brag can de dag tu 'dod pas 'dus pa ma yin pa kho na'i don zhes skabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: then the meaning of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù must be established as that of non-collection, because you accept that the nature of the word is qualified.

original: gzhan du rtags don med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du rtags don med pas so //
translated: Otherwise, the reason would be meaningless.

original: gal te nge lta na yang ji ltar skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nge lta na yang ji ltar skyon du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that even if that is so, what is the fault?
