original: de dag gang gis 'brel zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag gang gis 'brel zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy what is their connection?‚Äù

original: dpe la ni 'dus pa'i don kho na dang rtags 'brel gyi cig shos dang ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba ma grub po //
analyzed: dpe la ni 'dus pa'i don kho na dang rtags 'brel gyi cig shos dang ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba ma grub po //
translated: In the example, the reason is connected only with the meaning of the collection, not with the other, so the connection is not established.

original: gang gis ji ltar brjod ba ni gzhan gyi don tsam mo //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar brjod ba ni gzhan gyi don tsam mo //
translated: By what and how it is expressed is only for the sake of others.

original: de ni dpe la gzhan 'dus pa nyid kyi don byed pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba dang rtags rjes su 'gro ba grub po //
analyzed: de ni dpe la gzhan 'dus pa nyid kyi don byed pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba dang rtags rjes su 'gro ba grub po //
translated: In the example, the meaning of the collection itself is established as the predicate of the probandum and the reason is established as the pervader.

original: de lta yin yang bsgrub par bya ba de dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta yin yang bsgrub par bya ba de dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: Even if that is so, it is not established that the reason is pervaded by the predicate of the probandum.

original: de dang 'gal ba 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed pa yang de dang 'gal ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rtags kyis 'dren na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te mes kyang grang ba'i reg pa la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed pa yang de dang 'gal ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba can gyi rtags kyis 'dren na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te mes kyang grang ba'i reg pa la sogs par ro //
translated: And if one draws a reason that is concomitant with the probandum, there is the absurd consequence that fire would be the reason for cold to the touch, etc.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs thams cad 'gal zhing zhes bya ba dag gis khyab par byed ba dang 'gal ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs thams cad 'gal zhing zhes bya ba dag gis khyab par byed ba dang 'gal ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, all reasons are contradictory, because they draw a pervasion that is contradictory with the pervader.

original: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
translated: And the example is incomplete with respect to the probandum,

original: rang gi khyab bar bya ba dang 'gal ba dpe la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na dpe mal cha @234a * //
analyzed: rang gi khyab bar bya ba dang 'gal ba dpe la mi srid pa'i phyir ro // yang na dpe mal cha @234a * //
translated: because it is impossible for the example to be contradictory with what is pervaded by it.

original: la sogs ba la 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed ba ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: la sogs ba la 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed ba ma tshang ba'o //
translated: Or else, the example is incomplete with respect to the non-composite performance of a function,üîΩbecause the example is not a pot, etc.

original: de tsam du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúJust that‚Äù means the contradictory.

original: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni dpe gang la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang na yang zhes bya ba ni dpe gang la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnywhere‚Äù means in any example.

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rtags dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rtags dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConcomitant‚Äù means related to the reason.

original: rtags dang dpe dag med ba de'i phyir rtags gang las kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags dang dpe dag med ba de'i phyir rtags gang las kyang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no reason or example, it is not understood from any reason.

original: brjod pa'i chos de 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid kyi don byed pa tshig tu brjod na ni skyon 'di zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dang dpe med ba dag go //
analyzed: brjod pa'i chos de 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid kyi don byed pa tshig tu brjod na ni skyon 'di zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dang dpe med ba dag go //
translated: If the meaning of the non-composite of the expressed phenomenon is stated as the performance of an action, the fault is this: it is contradictory and there is no example.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa nyid du smras ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa nyid du smras ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no difference in being the object of comprehension, it is like saying it is to be understood by a reason.

original: / gal te 'dod kyang ma smras pa 'gal ba la sogs pa'i skyon med na'o //
analyzed: / gal te 'dod kyang ma smras pa 'gal ba la sogs pa'i skyon med na'o //
translated: If it is accepted but not stated, there is no fault of contradiction, etc.

original: 'dod pa la ni gnod par byed pa la yang 'gal ba'i skyon med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la ni gnod par byed pa la yang 'gal ba'i skyon med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is accepted, it follows that there is no fault of contradiction in refuting it.

original: gal te skyon med par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyon med par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If it is accepted that there is no fault,

original: skyon med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon med pa ma yin te /
translated: there is no fault.

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun ba'i phyogs la 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun ba'i phyogs la 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is defined as a reason that proves the opposite of the probandum, since it engages the opposite of the position.

original: smras ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras ba phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from proving the opposite.

original: gal te 'dus ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la phyin ci log med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la phyin ci log med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no opposite because of being a collection,‚Äù

original: ji skad smos pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa ste /
translated: it is as stated.

original: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos dang chos can gyi bye brag nyid du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos dang chos can gyi bye brag nyid du bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot a collection‚Äù is taught as a distinction between the subject and the predicate, and so on.

original: gzhan du bye brag tu ma byas pa'i gzhan gyi don tsam ni rtags don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du bye brag tu ma byas pa'i gzhan gyi don tsam ni rtags don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the mere meaning of ‚Äúother‚Äù without a distinction is pointless as a reason.

original: de lta bas na de la 'dus pa ma yin ba'i don rjes su 'gro ba med par 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta bas na de la 'dus pa ma yin ba'i don rjes su 'gro ba med par 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, in that case, it is asserted that the meaning of ‚Äúnot a collection‚Äù is not a universal.

original: ji skad du slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis /üîΩbdag gzhan zhe na ma grub phyir //
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis / bdag gzhan zhe na ma grub phyir //
translated: As master Vasubandhu said:

original: zhes gsungs ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs ba lta bu ste /
translated: Because ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúother‚Äù are not established.

original: bdag ma grub pa de nyid 'dod pa la gnod bar byed pa'i 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag ma grub pa de nyid 'dod pa la gnod bar byed pa'i 'gal ba yin te /
translated: That very non-establishment of the self is the contradiction that harms the assertion,

original: bdag de dang rjes su 'gro ba med kyi de dad 'gal ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de dang rjes su 'gro ba med kyi de dad 'gal ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not concomitant with that self, but is concomitant with the contradiction of that.

original: gang las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gang las te /
analyzed: gang las rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gang las te /
translated: From what is there a dispute?

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub ba bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir bsgrub ba bkod pa'o //
translated: From the self, because it is set forth as the probandum in order to establish that.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bkod pa'i 'bras bu bdag bsgrub par bya ba yin par 'dod na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bkod pa'i 'bras bu bdag bsgrub par bya ba yin par 'dod na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is like that, if the result of setting forth the probandum is asserted to be the establishment of the self,

original: phyin ci log tu grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i don du grub pas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i don du grub pas so //
translated: it is established in a mistaken way, because it is established as the meaning of the collection, due to being concomitant with the collection.

original: gal te 'dus pa'i don nyid bsgrub par @234b bya ba yin no zhe na /üîΩ'bras bu med pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa'i don nyid bsgrub par @234b bya ba yin no zhe na / 'bras bu med pa nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: If the meaning of the collection itself is the probandum,

original: de ni phyir rgol ba yang 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni phyir rgol ba yang 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: there is no point in the dispute, because the opponent also asserts that.

original: 'gal ba 'bras bu med ba de nyid dpes bstan pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'bras bu med ba de nyid dpes bstan pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The same contradiction, that there is no effect, is taught by way of an example:

original: bha tri ha ri na re /
analyzed: bha tri ha ri na re /
translated: Bha·π≠·π≠a Hari says:üîΩThe characteristic of a word is that it is related to a name,

original: shes dar ldan dang phyi don dang // rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ste //
analyzed: shes dar ldan dang phyi don dang // rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang ste //
translated: to an external object, and to its own nature.

original: de de sgrub brjod pas rtogs pas //
analyzed: de de sgrub brjod pas rtogs pas //
translated: Since it is said to establish that, it is understood.

original: spyi ni 'brel bar rab tu gnas //
analyzed: spyi ni 'brel bar rab tu gnas //
translated: A universal is well-established as a relation.

original: zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: That is,

original: de nyid sgra rnams ni ming dang 'brel bar ma gyur ba'i sngon nas kyang don dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid sgra rnams ni ming dang 'brel bar ma gyur ba'i sngon nas kyang don dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: words are related to names, but prior to that they are related to objects.

original: ming dang 'brel ba ni brdar byas ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang 'brel ba ni brdar byas ba'o //
translated: The relation to a name is a convention.

original: de'i sngon rol ni de ma grub pa na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i sngon rol ni de ma grub pa na yang ngo //
translated: Prior to that, when that is not established,

original: don dang ldan te /
analyzed: don dang ldan te /
translated: they are related to objects.

original: sgra 'don pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa dang ldan bar go bar byed /
analyzed: sgra 'don pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa dang ldan bar go bar byed /
translated: When a word is uttered, it is understood to be related to the consciousness that wishes to express it.

original: phyi'i don go bar nus /
analyzed: phyi'i don go bar nus /
translated: It is able to make known an external object.

original: rang gi ngo bo go bar byed de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo go bar byed de /
translated: It makes known its own nature.

original: go'i zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par 'dod pa dang / ba lang dang / rang gi ngo bo ga dang ao dang au dag go bar byed pas so //
analyzed: go'i zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod par 'dod pa dang / ba lang dang / rang gi ngo bo ga dang ao dang au dag go bar byed pas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated to indicate that the word is what is intended to be expressed and that the word‚Äôs own nature is understood through the vowels a, ƒÅ, and i.

original: des na brda'i sngon rol nas kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa dang rang gi ngo bor go bar byed do //
analyzed: des na brda'i sngon rol nas kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i shes pa dang rang gi ngo bor go bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, even prior to the convention, the cognition that is intended to be expressed and the word‚Äôs own nature are understood.

original: rnam par dbye ba can du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dang po dang gnyis ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba can du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dang po dang gnyis ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be divisible, that is, because it does not pass beyond the nature of a collection of the first, second, and so on.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan par sgrub par 'dod la rnam par dbye bas ni phyi rol gyi don gyis don dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don dang ldan par sgrub par 'dod la rnam par dbye bas ni phyi rol gyi don gyis don dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'am /
translated: Here, the opponent wishes to prove that the word has the meaning of its own nature, but because the word is divisible, the opponent wishes to prove that it has the meaning of an external object.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don ni grub kyang don du skyes bus 'dod pa med pa'i phyir rtags don med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi don ni grub kyang don du skyes bus 'dod pa med pa'i phyir rtags don med de /
translated: But because the word‚Äôs own nature is established, the reason is pointless, because the person does not desire the meaning.

original: sgra las rang gi ngo bo rtogs bar 'dod pa gzhan pa'i rtogs par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las rang gi ngo bo rtogs bar 'dod pa gzhan pa'i rtogs par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing else to be understood, apart from the nature of the word itself, which is what is desired to be understood.

original: gzhan gyi don bye brag tu ma byas pas zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi zhes bye brag tu ma byas na ni sgrub par 'dod pa bdag gi don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bye brag tu ma byas pas zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa ma yin pa gzhan gyi zhes bye brag tu ma byas na ni sgrub par 'dod pa bdag gi don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the purpose of others is not specified‚Äù means that if the word is not specified as belonging to another, not included in the speaker‚Äôs own purpose, then the statement will not serve the speaker‚Äôs own purpose.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma byas pa sgrub na ni phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas bas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma byas pa sgrub na ni phyir rgol ba sangs rgyas bas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the purpose of others is accepted‚Äù means that if the word is not specified, then the opponent, the Buddhist, will accept it.

original: gnyis pa can gyi sbyor ba ni rgyang pan ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa can gyi sbyor ba ni rgyang pan ba'o //
translated: The statement of the reason is that of the CƒÅrvƒÅka.

original: de dag rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam ji ltar rtags sbyor ba smras she na /
analyzed: de dag rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam ji ltar rtags sbyor ba smras she na /
translated: But don‚Äôt they not accept inference as a means of valid knowledge? How can they state a syllogism?

original: 'di ni 'gal ba med de gzhan la rab tu grags pa rjes su 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba med de gzhan la rab tu grags pa rjes su 'dod pas /
translated: There is no contradiction here, because they accept what is well known to others.

original: gzhan nyid la ston pas byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la ston pas byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the statement is made for the sake of others.

original: sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu zhes bya ba ni de dag @235a * //
analyzed: sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bu zhes bya ba ni de dag @235a * //
translated: The body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness.

original: gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di lta bu ste /
translated: The doctrine of the Samkhyas is as follows:üîΩThere is nothing other than the body, which is the nature of the elements, that is called ‚Äúself‚Äù or ‚Äúconsciousness.‚ÄùüîΩThe body, which is the nature of the elements, is the self, which is manifest as consciousness.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.

original: skyes bu dang sems zhes bya ba dag lus las gzhan pa ni ci yang med de 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi lus nyid sems dang skyes bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dang sems zhes bya ba dag lus las gzhan pa ni ci yang med de 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi lus nyid sems dang skyes bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.

original: de'i phyir sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ste dgun chang rnams so //üîΩso ga'i dus su dang bar 'gyur ba dag chang nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ste dgun chang rnams so // so ga'i dus su dang bar 'gyur ba dag chang nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.

original: sems dang skyes bu yang 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa nyid yin gyi 'byung ba'i lus las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar sgrub pa'i phyir ngan g-yo'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sems dang skyes bu yang 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa nyid yin gyi 'byung ba'i lus las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar sgrub pa'i phyir ngan g-yo'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Just as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and consciousness is the nature of the self.üîΩJust as the body is the nature of the elements, and the self is the nature of consciousness, so the self is the nature of the body, and

original: bum pa sems pa'i ngo bor gsal ba'i lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bus zla dang bcas par grub na lus nyid sems dang skyes bu yin bar shugs kyis grub ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa sems pa'i ngo bor gsal ba'i lus kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyes bus zla dang bcas par grub na lus nyid sems dang skyes bu yin bar shugs kyis grub ba'o //
translated: If the pot, which is manifest in the nature of the mind, were established as having a second, the person of the nature of the body, then it would be established by implication that the body itself is the mind and the person.

original: rtsig pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'i yul te /
analyzed: rtsig pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'i yul te /
translated: The wall is the object of pervasion.

original: de la bum pa dang skyes bu de lta bu'i zla dang bcas pa rtags can dang / autpala ma yin pa nyid kyi rtags dag yod par snang bas so //üîΩde la yang rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni de lta bur gyur ba ste sems nyid kyi ngo bor gsal ba'i lus kyi skyes bus gnyis ba can du ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la bum pa dang skyes bu de lta bu'i zla dang bcas pa rtags can dang / autpala ma yin pa nyid kyi rtags dag yod par snang bas so // de la yang rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa ni de lta bur gyur ba ste sems nyid kyi ngo bor gsal ba'i lus kyi skyes bus gnyis ba can du ma grub ste /
translated: In that, the pot and the person, which are like that, are the sign of having a second, and the sign of not being a blue lotus are seen to exist.

original: lus ni sems las tha mi dad par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni sems las tha mi dad par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the teaching of the absence of pervasion is: the person of the body, which is manifest in the nature of the mind, does not exist as having a second, because the body is doubted to be non-different from the mind.

original: de ltar na sems gsal ba'i lus gnyis pa can zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba'i phyir dper mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sems gsal ba'i lus gnyis pa can zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la the tshom za ba'i phyir dper mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the example is not established because of doubting the predicate of the probandum, ‚Äúthe body, which is manifest in the mind, has a second.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no pervasion.

original: gal te spyis sgrub bar 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi gnyis pa can tsam du sgrub kyi sems su gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can zhes bye brag mi 'phen pa'i phyir lus de tsam gyis sam /
analyzed: gal te spyis sgrub bar 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi gnyis pa can tsam du sgrub kyi sems su gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can zhes bye brag mi 'phen pa'i phyir lus de tsam gyis sam /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, then the reason is not established because the body that is clarified as having a mind is established as merely having a second, but does not indicate a particularity, namely, that it is a body.

original: yang na bum pas gnyis pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na bum pas gnyis pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, the reason is not established because a pot is a second.

original: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom mi za'o zhe na /
analyzed: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom mi za'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no doubt about the pervasion in the example,

original: gal te sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can du mi 'grub na grub par byed pa autpala ma yin pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can du mi 'grub na grub par byed pa autpala ma yin pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ci zhig yin /
translated: then if the body that is clarified as having a mind is not established as having a second, what is the effect of the proof that it is not an utpala?

original: bum ba lus tsam gyis gnyis pa can du ni phyir rgol ba dag kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum ba lus tsam gyis gnyis pa can du ni phyir rgol ba dag kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponents also assert that a pot is a second by merely being a body.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi ste /
translated: Or, the four alternatives are as follows.

original: gal te dpe la yod pa'i bsgrub par bya bar sems las bzlog pa'i bum pas gnyis pa can yin te /
analyzed: gal te dpe la yod pa'i bsgrub par bya bar sems las bzlog pa'i bum pas gnyis pa can yin te /
translated: If the pot, which is the opposite of the object of the probandum that exists in the example, is a second,üîΩthen the pot is a second because it is a pot.

original: skyes bus ni the tshom za ba'i phyir ma yin pa'i phyir sems pa can du gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnyis pa can dang gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro bar dpe la grub pas @235b bum pa la yang mi 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: skyes bus ni the tshom za ba'i phyir ma yin pa'i phyir sems pa can du gsal ba ma yin pa'i gnyis pa can dang gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro bar dpe la grub pas @235b bum pa la yang mi 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes
translated: Since a person is not clearly manifest as sentient due to doubt, and since the example is established as having the reason that is concomitant with the property of the subject, then since the probandum is established with respect to the pot, there would be a contradiction.

original: sngar grangs can pa la smra ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sngar grangs can pa la smra ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is similar to the earlier statement to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: gzhan yang gal te yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, if one says ‚Äúagain,‚Äù

original: skyon sngar ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //
analyzed: skyon sngar ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi don to //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúagain‚Äù is that the previous fault has not been exhausted.

original: gal te dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa spang ba'i phyir bye brag mi 'phen zhes smra ba bye brag de sgrub par byed pa rtags kyis yul du mi byed na ji ltar na rtags autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des sems pa can duüîΩgsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can de 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te dpe la rjes su 'gro ba med pa spang ba'i phyir bye brag mi 'phen zhes smra ba bye brag de sgrub par byed pa rtags kyis yul du mi byed na ji ltar na rtags autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba des sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can de 'grub ste /
translated: If one says that a specific property is not stated in order to eliminate the absence of the reason being concomitant with the example, if the reason does not take as its object the specific property that is to be established, then how is the specific property that is to be established, that is, the body that is clearly manifest as sentient, established by the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not an utpala‚Äù?üîΩIf one says that the specific property is not stated,

original: sgrub par 'dod pa 'di ltar sems pa can du gsal ba'i zhes smra /
analyzed: sgrub par 'dod pa 'di ltar sems pa can du gsal ba'i zhes smra /
translated: then how is the probandum established?üîΩIf one says that the specific property is stated, then how is it that the reason is not concomitant with the example?

original: gal te gtan tshigs autpala ma yin pa nyid kyis sems pa can du gsal ba'i gnyis pa can du 'grub na ni zhes bya ba bye brag 'phen na ni ji ltar na de rtags kyi yul ma yin te /üîΩbye brag de 'phangs pa'i phyir mi 'phen no zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs autpala ma yin pa nyid kyis sems pa can du gsal ba'i gnyis pa can du 'grub na ni zhes bya ba bye brag 'phen na ni ji ltar na de rtags kyi yul ma yin te / bye brag de 'phangs pa'i phyir mi 'phen no zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: If the reason is the non-lotusness which is the basis of the distinction of the sentient being, then how can it not be the object of the reason?üîΩIf it is not projected, it is not correct to say that the reason is the non-lotusness which is the basis of the distinction of the sentient being.

original: gal te yul yin no zhes bya ba bye brag 'phen na'o //
analyzed: gal te yul yin no zhes bya ba bye brag 'phen na'o //
translated: If the reason is the non-lotusness which is the object of the distinction of the sentient being, then how can it not be the object of the reason?

original: rang la brten par 'gyur ba'i skyon ni sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus su the tshom za ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: rang la brten par 'gyur ba'i skyon ni sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus su the tshom za ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: If it is projected, then the fault of being based on itself would arise, because there would be doubt about the body which is the basis of the distinction of the sentient being, and so there would be doubt about the pervasion.

original: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yod pas ni 'dod pa ma grub na ni rjes su 'gro ba yod pas ni 'dod pa mi 'grub pa la 'dod pa grub na ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu'i lus khyad par
analyzed: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yod pas ni 'dod pa ma grub na ni rjes su 'gro ba yod pas ni 'dod pa mi 'grub pa la 'dod pa grub na ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu'i lus khyad par
translated: Such a reason is not established, because if the probandum is not established, then the pervasion is not established, and if the probandum is established, then there is no pervasion. Therefore, the body of a person is not the basis of the distinction of the sentient being.

original: can 'phen du yang mi rung la mi 'phen du yang mi rung ba'i rgyang pan pa'o //
analyzed: can 'phen du yang mi rung la mi 'phen du yang mi rung ba'i rgyang pan pa'o //
translated: and it is not suitable to be a proponent of annihilation.

original: autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags nus pa med pa la /
analyzed: autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags nus pa med pa la /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not a lotus,‚Äù is incapable.

original: mi 'dod bsgrub pa de la brten ba'i bsgrub par bya ba de 'grub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa de lta bus nye bar 'tsho ste bde bar gnas na'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod bsgrub pa de la brten ba'i bsgrub par bya ba de 'grub par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa de lta bus nye bar 'tsho ste bde bar gnas na'o //
translated: One lives in that way, that is, one lives happily, when one establishes the probandum based on that non-desired probandum.

original: pha rol sun 'byin pa klan ka'i 'jigs pa med pa ni mi 'tsho 'am ci ste rang gi nyes pa la mi lta bar pha rol gnon ba ni rgyal rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol sun 'byin pa klan ka'i 'jigs pa med pa ni mi 'tsho 'am ci ste rang gi nyes pa la mi lta bar pha rol gnon ba ni rgyal rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: One who is fearless of the danger of refutation by the opponent, who does not look at one‚Äôs own faults but subdues the opponent, is a king by social position.

original: rigs pa la brten pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs pa la brten pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is not based on logic.

original: klan ka dang bcas pa dgod pa la mi bde ba med na sun 'byin pa 'jigs pa med pa de'i phyir ji srid don du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: klan ka dang bcas pa dgod pa la mi bde ba med na sun 'byin pa 'jigs pa med pa de'i phyir ji srid don du gyur pa ste /
translated: When one is not uncomfortable in setting forth the fault, one is fearless in refuting. Therefore, as long as one is useful,

original: sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi gnyis pa can no //
analyzed: sems pa can du gsal ba'i lus kyi gnyis pa can no //
translated: one is a sentient being, and one is a body with two parts.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i mthus grub pa 'phangs pa ni autpala ma yin pa nyid sgrub par 'dod bas 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i mthus grub pa 'phangs pa ni autpala ma yin pa nyid sgrub par 'dod bas 'phangs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the probandum by the power of the proof is the establishment of the non-lotusness by the power of the proof.

original: des khyab pa ni bsgrub pa ma btang gi ngar du'o //
analyzed: des khyab pa ni bsgrub pa ma btang gi ngar du'o //
translated: The pervasion is established by the non-abandonment of the probandum.

original: sun 'byin pas kyang khyab ste /üîΩji srid du rjes su 'gro ba the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: sun 'byin pas kyang khyab ste / ji srid du rjes su 'gro ba the tshom za ba'am /
translated: The refutation is also pervasion.üîΩAs long as there is doubt about the concomitance,

original: the tshom mi zan phyin ci log gam @236a * //
analyzed: the tshom mi zan phyin ci log gam @236a * //
translated: or if there is no doubt, then there is a contradiction.

original: zhes smra bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes smra bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu'i bye brag can sems pa can du gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu'i bye brag can sems pa can du gsal ba'o //
translated: Moreover, such a specific cognition is clearly established.

original: khas mi len na zhes bya ba ni sems pa can du gsal par the tshom za ba'i phyir de lta bu nyid du khas mi len no //
analyzed: khas mi len na zhes bya ba ni sems pa can du gsal par the tshom za ba'i phyir de lta bu nyid du khas mi len no //
translated: If one does not accept, because of the doubt about the clarity of cognition, one does not accept it as such.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dang bcas pa tsam nyid do //
translated: The general is merely the possession of the second.

original: lus de lta bu ni ma grub pa'i phyir dang bum pa yang gnyis ba can du bsgrub par bya ba'i bum pa la mi srid par ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba la gnyis pa can gyi don nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus de lta bu ni ma grub pa'i phyir dang bum pa yang gnyis ba can du bsgrub par bya ba'i bum pa la mi srid par ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba la gnyis pa can gyi don nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a body is not established, and because it is shown that a pot also does not have a second, since it is impossible for the pot that is to be established to have a second, there is no object that has a second in either case.

original: gcig za ba mi srid pa ni gang yang rung ba gcig za zhes bya ba 'di sbyor bar mi 'dod la /
analyzed: gcig za ba mi srid pa ni gang yang rung ba gcig za zhes bya ba 'di sbyor bar mi 'dod la /
translated: The impossibility of one eating is not asserted to be the application of ‚Äúone eats,‚Äù

original: smra ba po za ba po gnyis la the tshom mi za ste /
analyzed: smra ba po za ba po gnyis la the tshom mi za ste /
translated: and there is no doubt that the speaker is the eater.

original: lha sbyin kho na za snyam na yang gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di sbyor bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: lha sbyin kho na za snyam na yang gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di sbyor bar mi 'dod do //
translated: If one thinks that only Devadatta eats, then this sound ‚Äúone eats‚Äù is not asserted to be the application.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te bum pa rang nyid bum pa las don gzhan yin par ni khas mi len te de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te bum pa rang nyid bum pa las don gzhan yin par ni khas mi len te de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúJust as a pot is not different from a pot,‚Äù because it is not different from itself.

original: gal te bum pa nyid bum pa las gzhan yin par khas len na ni yang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te bum pa nyid bum pa las gzhan yin par khas len na ni yang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If one asserts that a pot is different from a pot, then it is contradictory, because

original: bum pa dang bum pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang bum pa ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a pot and a non-pot are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i phyir bum pa las gzhan ma yin pas lus tsam zhig bum pa las don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba yin par gnyis pa can gyi tshig gi don shugs kyis te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa las gzhan ma yin pas lus tsam zhig bum pa las don gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba yin par gnyis pa can gyi tshig gi don shugs kyis te ;
translated: Therefore, since it is not different from a pot, the body alone is called ‚Äúdifferent from a pot.‚Äù The meaning of the word ‚Äúalone‚Äù is implied by the logic,

original: rigs pas rnam par gnas pa gzhan gcig las med pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba gcig gis gnyis pa can zhes smos pa ni don med do //
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par gnas pa gzhan gcig las med pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba gcig gis gnyis pa can zhes smos pa ni don med do //
translated: since there is no other. Therefore, it is meaningless to say ‚Äúalone‚Äù with regard to either one.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bum pa las gzhan yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bum pa las gzhan yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means different from a pot.

original: gal te lus nyid 'dir don gzhan du 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus nyid 'dir don gzhan du 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you assert that the body alone is different here,

original: de nyid de skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gnyis pa can yin te zhes dam bca' bar bya ba'i bum pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhes ma brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid de skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gnyis pa can yin te zhes dam bca' bar bya ba'i bum pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhes ma brjod do //
translated: then that is exactly what should be said. The thesis should be stated as ‚Äúthe body alone is different,‚Äù not ‚Äúeither a pot or a body is different.‚Äù

original: bum pa yang de skad ces bya bar 'gal bas mi srid pa'i brjod pa mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: bum pa yang de skad ces bya bar 'gal bas mi srid pa'i brjod pa mi rigs pas so //
translated: It is illogical to say that a pot is different, because it is contradictory for a pot to be different in that way.

original: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyir brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni spyir brjod pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúAny‚Äù is a general term.

original: spyir ni rdzas brjod bar 'dod pa thams cad la srid na rung gi rdzas thams cad la srid pa ma yin pa de ni spyi mi rigs ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyir ni rdzas brjod bar 'dod pa thams cad la srid na rung gi rdzas thams cad la srid pa ma yin pa de ni spyi mi rigs ba'i phyir te /
translated: In general, it is possible for any substance that is asserted to be a universal to exist, but it is not possible for all substances to exist. That is because a universal is not reasonable.

original: de ltar na bye brag kyang de thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bye brag kyang de thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, a particular would also follow.

original: bram ze la sogs pas ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pas ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Brahmins and so on grasp k·π£atriyas and so on.

original: de ltar bram ze la sogs pas gang yang med pa la rigs nyid kyi spyi'i @236b chos mi srid do //
analyzed: de ltar bram ze la sogs pas gang yang med pa la rigs nyid kyi spyi'i @236b chos mi srid do //
translated: In that case, it is not possible for a universal property of caste to exist for those who are not any of those, such as brahmins and so on.

original: gzhan yang dbang po zhes bya ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid rtog par byed pa'i yid kyi shes pa la dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po zhes bya ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid rtog par byed pa'i yid kyi shes pa la dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of a universal called sense faculty is not produced from a sense faculty. It is like the mental consciousness that conceives the characteristic of a universal called sense faculty, which is not produced from a sense faculty.

original: de ni ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa nyid ce na /
translated: How is it not produced from a sense faculty?

original: de ltar rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not understood in that way.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i mig gi shes pas gsal ba dang bya ba byed par nus pa de ltar rtog pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po de 'gyur yang rtog pa tsam mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dbang po med par yang rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag la de ltar khas len na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du ma grub pa de dag la gang yang rung ba zhes khas len na'o //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i mig gi shes pas gsal ba dang bya ba byed par nus pa de ltar rtog pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po de 'gyur yang rtog pa tsam mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dbang po med par yang rtog pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de dag la de ltar khas len na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du ma grub pa de dag la gang yang rung ba zhes khas len na'o //
translated: because the eye consciousness produced from the faculty is clear and able to perform a function, but the conception does not understand it in that way; because even though the faculty changes, the conception alone does not change; and because the conception occurs even without the faculty.üîΩIf one accepts that they are like that,üîΩthat is, if one accepts that they are not established as different objects, then the general proof is stated:

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey would be like that.‚Äù

original: gal te ci'i phyir don gzhan med ce na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir don gzhan med ce na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy are they not different objects?‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrjes su 'gro ba med pas the chom zal zhes bya ba rtsig pa la sems pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus kyis gnyis pa can nyid ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba smos te / rjes su 'gro ba med pas the chom zal zhes bya ba rtsig pa la sems pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus kyis gnyis pa can nyid ma grub pa ste /
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúThat also is not so.‚Äù

original: lus nyid sems pa yin par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus nyid sems pa yin par the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no concomitance, the statement ‚ÄúThey are like a doubt‚Äù is not established as having a double nature, like a wall, because the body itself is doubtful as to whether it is a conception.

original: des na bum pa la yang sems par gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can du the tshom za ba'i rtags kyis 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: des na bum pa la yang sems par gsal ba'i lus kyis gnyis pa can du the tshom za ba'i rtags kyis 'grub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not established by the reason of doubt that a pot also has a body that is clear and has thoughts.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: As for ‚Äúbecause of contradiction,‚Äù this has already been explained above.

original: de'i phyir lus dang bum pa gnyis pa la ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang bum pa gnyis pa la ni mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for both a body and a pot to be like that.

original: de ltar na rdzas bye brag med pa'i spyi lta zhig ga la 'grub /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas bye brag med pa'i spyi lta zhig ga la 'grub /
translated: Thus, how could a universal that is not a distinct substance be established?

original: dper na lha spyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te za ba'i chos gnyi ga la srid na gang yang rung ba zhes spyir brjod pa rigs kyi /
analyzed: dper na lha spyin dang zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te za ba'i chos gnyi ga la srid na gang yang rung ba zhes spyir brjod pa rigs kyi /
translated: For example, it is like Devadatta, etc. When the property of eating is possible for both, it is correct to express it in general as ‚Äúeither one.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la za ba nyid mi 'dod na gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba gcig cig sod dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga la za ba nyid mi 'dod na gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba gcig cig sod dam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But if one does not assert that both have the property of eating, then the meaning of ‚Äúeither one‚Äù is ‚Äúone of the two eats.‚Äù

original: gal te lha sbyin kho na za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba las lta spyin gcig bu zab zhes bya ba chos 'di lta sbyin la 'gog pa tsam zhig bsam pas gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes brjod par mi rung ba'i skyon med do zhe na
analyzed: gal te lha sbyin kho na za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba las lta spyin gcig bu zab zhes bya ba chos 'di lta sbyin la 'gog pa tsam zhig bsam pas gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes brjod par mi rung ba'i skyon med do zhe na
translated: If you say that there is no error because it is not suitable to say that only Devadatta eats, but that it is suitable to say that either one eats, since this phenomenon, ‚ÄúDevadatta eats,‚Äù is merely the negation of ‚ÄúDevadatta does not eat,‚Äù

original: / gcig gzung bar thal ba ste /
analyzed: / gcig gzung bar thal ba ste /
translated: then it follows that it is one.

original: rdzas gcig gi chos bsam ba'i skabs yin bar thal ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas gcig gi chos bsam ba'i skabs yin bar thal ba ste /
translated: It follows that it is the occasion of thinking about the phenomenon of one substance,

original: mi 'dod pa der 'gyur ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa der 'gyur ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not the occasion of being that which is not wanted,

original: du ma'i gnyis pa can sems pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di rnam par brtag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'am 'di'o zhes gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig tu @237a * //
analyzed: du ma'i gnyis pa can sems pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di rnam par brtag pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di'am 'di'o zhes gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig tu @237a * //
translated: because it is the occasion of thinking about the second of the many.üîΩBecause it is the object of that conception,üîΩbecause it is the object of the conception of either this or that.

original: rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gcig gi chos sems par thal ba med do //üîΩder ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul der ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gcig gi chos sems par thal ba med do // der ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul der ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the conception of either this or that, it is not the case that it follows that it is the occasion of thinking about the phenomenon of one.üîΩThere,

original: bum pa yang gnyis pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa yang gnyis pa ma yin la /
translated: that is, in the object of conception, the pot is not the second.

original: lus de lta bu'i khyad par can yang gnyis pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: lus de lta bu'i khyad par can yang gnyis pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mi 'dod de /
translated: But it is not asserted that the body is not a special kind of that.

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: gnyi ga yang mi srid na brtag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi srid na brtag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if both are impossible, there is no object of investigation.

original: de ni re zhig gcig kho na za ba ma yin no zhes dgag par rtog pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ni re zhig gcig kho na za ba ma yin no zhes dgag par rtog pa bsal nas /
translated: First, having dispelled the conception that it is not the case that only one eats,

original: gal te lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba zab po gcig nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa yin na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag las gang yang rung ba gcig za'o zhes bya ba zab po gcig nyid yin no zhes sgrub pa yin na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: if it is established that only one person is the eater,

original: gnyis po dag las cig shos kyis gnyis pa nyid mi srid kyi gcig gi gnyis pa dang bcas par sgrub na yang rnam par rtog pas bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis po dag las cig shos kyis gnyis pa nyid mi srid kyi gcig gi gnyis pa dang bcas par sgrub na yang rnam par rtog pas bsdu ba ste /
translated: then that is not logical, because it is impossible for either of the two to be the second of the two. If it is established that one has a second, that is also subsumed by conception.

original: 'di 'am 'dis gnyis pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di 'am 'dis gnyis pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this or that has a second,

original: gang yang rung ba gcig gis gnyis pa can yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig gis gnyis pa can yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so //
translated: it is illogical to say that one of the two has a second.

original: de ltar na rang gi 'dod pa'i don yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub la spyi yang bye brag mi srid pas ma yin gcig tu dgag pa dang sgrub pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir mi 'grub pas na /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi 'dod pa'i don yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mi 'grub la spyi yang bye brag mi srid pas ma yin gcig tu dgag pa dang sgrub pa yang mi rigs pa'i phyir mi 'grub pas na /
translated: Thus, since the meaning that you want is not established because there is no pervasion, and since it is not possible for a universal to exist without a particular, the negation and affirmation are not correct, and so it is not established.

original: da ni autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang rtags 'dis ci zhig sgrub par nus /
analyzed: da ni autpala ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang rtags 'dis ci zhig sgrub par nus /
translated: Now, what is this reason that proves ‚Äúbecause it is not an utpala‚Äù?

original: phyogs dad mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid dang / gcig tu nges par gzung ba yang mi 'thad pa dag tu rab tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dad mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba zhig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid dang / gcig tu nges par gzung ba yang mi 'thad pa dag tu rab tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: And in ‚Äúbecause it is either a homogeneous or heterogeneous case,‚Äù the absence of pervasion and the non-tenability of the ascertainment of one are clearly stated.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nam mkha' dang bum pa dag la mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang bum pa dag la mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin gyi /
translated: Space and a pot are homogeneous cases.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang / bdag nyid med pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang / bdag nyid med pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: But because they are not heterogeneous cases, and because there is no reason called ‚Äúeither,‚Äù there is no pervasion.

original: gal te phyogs sam mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin gyi cig shos ni yin pa mi srid pas des par ba zung na yang gang yang rung ba'i sgra mi 'thad do zhes bya bar sun dbyung bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te phyogs sam mthun pa'i phyogs gcig yin gyi cig shos ni yin pa mi srid pas des par ba zung na yang gang yang rung ba'i sgra mi 'thad do zhes bya bar sun dbyung bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: If it is one part or one aspect of the property of the subject, then it is impossible that it be the other, and therefore, even if both were mentioned, the term ‚Äúany‚Äù would be untenable.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rtags ma grub pa 'am rdzas med na spyi mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rtags ma grub pa 'am rdzas med na spyi mi rung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, if the reason is not established, or if there is no substance, the universal is not tenable.

original: ji ltar spyi dang rtags ma grub ce na /üîΩgnyi ga la srid par 'gal pa med na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs de dag de ltar de gang yang rung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar spyi dang rtags ma grub ce na / gnyi ga la srid par 'gal pa med na phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs de dag de ltar de gang yang rung ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //
translated: How is the universal not established?üîΩIf there is no contradiction in its existence in both, then the property of the subject and the similar property would be like that, and it would be called ‚Äúany.‚Äù

original: de ltar srid pa ni med de 'di ltar gang yang rung ba gcig ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa'am @237b nam mkha' zhes bya ba gzhan du gyur na rtags de phyogs sgra lam grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar srid pa ni med de 'di ltar gang yang rung ba gcig ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa'am @237b nam mkha' zhes bya ba gzhan du gyur na rtags de phyogs sgra lam grub ste /
translated: But such existence is impossible, because if either of the two, the similar property or the dissimilar property, is changed, the reason is not established as the property of the subject.

original: 'di ltar sgra rtag pa 'am mi rtag ba zhes bya ba lta bu'i bye brag gi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rtag pa 'am mi rtag ba zhes bya ba lta bu'i bye brag gi ste /
translated: For example, it is like the particular of ‚Äúsound is permanent‚Äù or ‚Äúsound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni sgra de ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni sgra de ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The probandum is that sound is not a universal, because it is not found in any of the homogeneous parts.

original: rnam par brtag pa ni 'di 'am 'di yang rung zhes spyir brjod pa yin la sgra'i bdag nyid ni so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa ni 'di 'am 'di yang rung zhes spyir brjod pa yin la sgra'i bdag nyid ni so sor nges pa ste /
translated: The analysis is that it is either this or that, and the expression is general. But the nature of sound is individual.

original: phyogs kho na gnas kyi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir so sor nges pa dang ma nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kho na gnas kyi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir so sor nges pa dang ma nges pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because only a part is a location, not a homogeneous part, individual and non-individual are mutually exclusive.

original: so sor nges pa nyid khas mi len na ma nges par spang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa nyid khas mi len na ma nges par spang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not accept individuality, non-individuality is abandoned.

original: de ltar na sgra la mthun pa'i phyogs kyang yin pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir rtags ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar na sgra la mthun pa'i phyogs kyang yin pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir rtags ma grub po //
translated: Thus, because there is no such thing as sound being a homogeneous part, the reason is not established.

original: de'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yang phyogs yin pa nyid pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yang phyogs yin pa nyid pas rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although it is true that the homogeneous part of that [sound] is not a part,

original: de ni sngar bshad zin pas rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir brjod pa ma mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad zin pas rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir brjod pa ma mdzad do //
translated: since that has already been explained above, it is not mentioned here.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag so sor nges pa la spyi mi srid pa'i phyir spyi ma grub po ;
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag so sor nges pa la spyi mi srid pa'i phyir spyi ma grub po ;
translated: Because a generality is impossible in the individual determinations of the parts and the whole, the generality is not established.

original: / de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa bstan nas don dkyus ma nyid bshad de /
analyzed: / de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa bstan nas don dkyus ma nyid bshad de /
translated: Having explained the digression, now the main point will be explained.

original: gal te rtsig pa ni spyir gang yang rung bas gnyis pa can yin par smra bas gnyis pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtsig pa ni spyir gang yang rung bas gnyis pa can yin par smra bas gnyis pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that since a wall is generally said to have two parts, it has two parts, therefore pervasion exists,

original: gang yang rung bas zhes spyir smras kyang sgrub par 'dod par 'dod pa'i skabs kyi don gyi shugs kyis gnyis pa ni lus kho nas so zhes bye brag tu yang gnas te /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas zhes spyir smras kyang sgrub par 'dod par 'dod pa'i skabs kyi don gyi shugs kyis gnyis pa ni lus kho nas so zhes bye brag tu yang gnas te /
translated: although generally it is said that it is anything, it is specified that the two parts are by the body alone by the force of the meaning of the context of the desire to prove.

original: lus sems par gsal bar sgrub par 'dod pas lus kho na gnyis par rtogs kyi bum pa ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus sems par gsal bar sgrub par 'dod pas lus kho na gnyis par rtogs kyi bum pa ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the body is clearly established as the agent, the body alone is understood to have two parts, but a pot is not understood because it is not necessary.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rigs pa can srog chags la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la the tshom za'i /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rigs pa can srog chags la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la the tshom za'i /
translated: One may doubt whether going and coming exist for some living beings, such as CƒÅrvƒÅkas.

original: ri'am shing la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri'am shing la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: not a mountain or a tree.

original: gal te lus kho na brjod pa'i bye brag gi sgra cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus kho na brjod pa'i bye brag gi sgra cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because there is not even a slight word of distinction in the word body,

original: bye brag gi sgra dang nye ba kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag gi sgra dang nye ba kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe word of distinction is only in proximity.‚Äù

original: skabs kyi shugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skabs kyi shugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The force of the context, etc.

original: de smra ba 'dod pa'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de smra ba 'dod pa'i dbang gis kyang ngo //
translated: is also by the power of the desire to speak.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa gnyis rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni lus kho na rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa gnyis rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni lus kho na rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú It is not reasonable for two to be different in meaning‚Äù because only the body is reasonable.

original: yang na don gzhan pa gcig kyang med de gnyi ga zhes bya ba lus bye brag can dag ma grub pa dang bum pa yang bum pa las don gzhan du mi rung bas so //
analyzed: yang na don gzhan pa gcig kyang med de gnyi ga zhes bya ba lus bye brag can dag ma grub pa dang bum pa yang bum pa las don gzhan du mi rung bas so //
translated: Or, there is not even one different in meaning, because both are not established as a particular body, and because a pot is not suitable as different in meaning from a pot.

original: khas mi len zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'am rigs pas na gnyi ga yang ngo //
analyzed: khas mi len zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'am rigs pas na gnyi ga yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú We do not accept‚Äù means that both are not by the power of the opponent or of reasoning.

original: gal te sgra dang @238a * //
analyzed: gal te sgra dang @238a * //
translated: If you say that the word body is not a particular body,

original: bum pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi gang yang rung ba zhes smras pa la dpe rtsig pa la bum pas gnyis pa can yin yang lus kyi ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi gang yang rung ba zhes smras pa la dpe rtsig pa la bum pas gnyis pa can yin yang lus kyi ma yin la /
translated: If one thinks that the example of a wall is a double instance because of a pot, but not because of a body,

original: bum pa la lus tsam gyis gnyis pa tsam yin yang lus bye brag can gyis gnyis pa ma yin zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: bum pa la lus tsam gyis gnyis pa tsam yin yang lus bye brag can gyis gnyis pa ma yin zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: and that a pot is a double instance merely because of a body, but not because of a particular body,

original: gal te bum par gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin na sgra lam grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te bum par gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin na sgra lam grub pa yin la /
translated: then if impermanence is a pot, the example is established,

original: sgra'i mi rtag pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: sgra'i mi rtag pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: but impermanence of sound is not a universal.

original: gal te mi rtag pa spyir yin na gnyis ba can tsam spyir rtags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa spyir yin na gnyis ba can tsam spyir rtags yin no zhe na /
translated: If impermanence is a universal, then merely being a double instance is a universal reason.

original: dpe la grub pa'i mi rtag pa de dang sgra ldan par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe la grub pa'i mi rtag pa de dang sgra ldan par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the impermanence established in the example is to be established as having sound.

original: mi rtag pa grub pa de ltar gnyis pa can gang gis yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i lus dang bum pa dag khas len na gang yang rung bas gnyis pa can gyi don gzhan du gyur pa'i spyi srid par 'gyur na don gzhan de ni mi srid do
analyzed: mi rtag pa grub pa de ltar gnyis pa can gang gis yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i lus dang bum pa dag khas len na gang yang rung bas gnyis pa can gyi don gzhan du gyur pa'i spyi srid par 'gyur na don gzhan de ni mi srid do
translated: Just as impermanence is established, so too, if one accepts that the body and the pot, which are the two bases, are different objects, then it would follow that a universal that is a different object from the two bases would exist, but such a different object is impossible.

original: zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: This has already been established.

original: de ltar 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa dang / gnyis pa can gyis spyad pa de de dag gis tshig dag gzhan du snang yang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba smras pas na /
analyzed: de ltar 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa dang / gnyis pa can gyis spyad pa de de dag gis tshig dag gzhan du snang yang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba smras pas na /
translated: Thus, because of being a composite, and because of being used by the two bases, although the words appear to be different, the meaning is said to establish the thesis.

original: chos dang chos can dag gis khyab par byas pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag gis khyab par byas pa ste /
translated: Thus the subject and the predicate are pervaded.

original: 'di nyid kyi dper brjod pa ni 'og nas ston te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi dper brjod pa ni 'og nas ston te /
translated: The example of this is taught below.

original: sel ba ni de las gnod pa can smra ba ste /
analyzed: sel ba ni de las gnod pa can smra ba ste /
translated: The refutation is the statement of the fault in that.

original: de la yang lan so sor brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang lan so sor brjod pa yin te /
translated: And the individual responses to that are as follows.

original: dper na mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra yin te byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra yin te byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced.‚Äù

original: de la gnod pa smra ba na re /
analyzed: de la gnod pa smra ba na re /
translated: In response to that, the one who states the fault says,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i sgra de'i sgra ni de brjod pa'i sgra ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i sgra de'i sgra ni de brjod pa'i sgra ste /
translated: The sound of that which possesses impermanent properties is the sound that expresses that.

original: de ltar rtags byas nas bsgrubs na sgra rang brjod pa'i sgra dang ldan par 'gyur gyi sgra mi rtag par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtags byas nas bsgrubs na sgra rang brjod pa'i sgra dang ldan par 'gyur gyi sgra mi rtag par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one establishes that way, having made a reason, then sound would possess the sound that expresses it, but sound would not be impermanent.

original: gang yang sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa yin te byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la yang gnod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa yin te byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la yang gnod par smra ba ste /
translated: Also, in the case of ‚ÄúSound possesses impermanence because it is produced,‚Äù the opponent states the fault:

original: sgra'i mi rtag pa sgra las gzhan pa zhig dang ldan par grub na yang sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i mi rtag pa sgra las gzhan pa zhig dang ldan par grub na yang sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is established that sound possesses impermanence that is different from sound, sound would not be impermanent.

original: sgra dang mi rtag pa'i spyi la gnod pa smra bas chos dang chos can brjod pa'i don la 'gal te skyon smra ba de med pa'i phyir de yang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba smras pa 'dis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang mi rtag pa'i spyi la gnod pa smra bas chos dang chos can brjod pa'i don la 'gal te skyon smra ba de med pa'i phyir de yang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba smras pa 'dis gsal ba yin no //
translated: Since the opponent states the fault that the universal of sound and the universal of impermanence are different, the meaning of the expression of the subject and predicate is contradictory. Since that fault does not exist, that is also clarified by this statement that proves the thesis.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de ltar smra ba'i rgol ba de dag kyang 'dod pa ni sgra mi rtag ces spyi de brjod pas sgrub par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba'i rgol ba de dag kyang 'dod pa ni sgra mi rtag ces spyi de brjod pas sgrub par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon med do //
translated: The opponent who speaks in this way does not commit the error that the sound is not impermanent, because he asserts that the proof is the expression of the generality ‚Äúsound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra'i brjod pa'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra'i brjod pa'i sgra yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the sound is the expression of the sound that is impermanent.

original: de ltar gyur par @238b sgrub par 'dod na sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur par @238b sgrub par 'dod na sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts that it is so, then the sound is not impermanent.

original: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgrar te /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgrar te /
translated: The sound is the sound of the impermanent sound.

original: de'i rjod par byed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the proof of its expression, it is the sound of the sound that is impermanent.

original: de yang sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i phyir mi rtag pa sgrub par 'dod pa la der mi 'gyur ba'i gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de yang sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i phyir mi rtag pa sgrub par 'dod pa la der mi 'gyur ba'i gnod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Since that is not asserted to be the proof, there is no fault that it is not so in the assertion that the sound is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig chos can sgra la sgrub par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig chos can sgra la sgrub par bya ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, the mere phenomenon called ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is to be proven with respect to the subject, sound.

original: de ma yin pa grub na phyin ci log tu ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa grub na phyin ci log tu ste /
translated: Or, if it is not so, it is the opposite.

original: 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i 'ga' ba byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa'i 'ga' ba byed do //
translated: It is a contradiction that contradicts a desire.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i spyi ni sgra mi rtag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i spyi ni sgra mi rtag ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the general property of desire is the statement ‚ÄúSound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log kyang mi 'dod pa'i spyi ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang mi 'dod pa'i spyi ste /
translated: A contradiction is also a general property of non-desire.

original: sgra rtag ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra rtag ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is permanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'gal ba ste 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni thams cad du spyi ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gal ba ste 'dod pa la gnod par byed pa 'ba' zhig ni thams cad du spyi ste /
translated: Thus, a contradiction that is a contradiction of a desire is a general property in all cases.

original: chos can dang mi 'dod pa'i chos bsdoms pa de nyid la yin no //
analyzed: chos can dang mi 'dod pa'i chos bsdoms pa de nyid la yin no //
translated: It is a combination of a property-possessor and a property that is not desired.

original: 'gal ba de gal te chos kyi sgo nas brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don nyid do zhes ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba de gal te chos kyi sgo nas brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don nyid do zhes ba lta bu ste /
translated: If that contradiction is expressed by way of a property, it is like ‚ÄúThe eyes, etc. are for the sake of another.‚Äù

original: de 'dod pa las phyin ci log tu gyur na chos kyi bye brag las bzlog pa zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de 'dod pa las phyin ci log tu gyur na chos kyi bye brag las bzlog pa zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: If it is the opposite of what is desired, it is called ‚Äúthe opposite of a particular property.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi sgo nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi sgo nas brjod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe eyes, etc. are for the sake of another‚Äù is expressed by way of a property-possessor.

original: de'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba yang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa zhes tha snyad du byas kyi 'dod pa phyin ci log nyid kyi don ni gcig pa nyid do //üîΩde bzhin du gtan tshigs la yang sgra mi rtag ces pa dang / mi rtag pa'i sgra zhes bya ba dag tha snyad du bye brag yod kyi sgra mi rtag pa nyid du don la ni gcig go //
analyzed: de'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba yang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa zhes tha snyad du byas kyi 'dod pa phyin ci log nyid kyi don ni gcig pa nyid do // de bzhin du gtan tshigs la yang sgra mi rtag ces pa dang / mi rtag pa'i sgra zhes bya ba dag tha snyad du bye brag yod kyi sgra mi rtag pa nyid du don la ni gcig go //
translated: And the contradiction of that is called ‚Äúthe opposite of the particular of the subject,‚Äù but the meaning of ‚Äúthe opposite of the thesis‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe opposite of the predicate.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, with regard to the reason, ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound‚Äù are different in name, but in fact they are the same as ‚Äúsound‚Äôs impermanence.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra zhes bya ba ni chos kyi chos can bye brag pa'i sgo nas tha snyad du byas pa ste /üîΩrtag pa'i sgra las sgra bye brag tu byas te brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i sgra'i sgra zhes bya ba ni chos kyi chos can bye brag pa'i sgo nas tha snyad du byas pa ste / rtag pa'i sgra las sgra bye brag tu byas te brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe impermanence of sound.‚Äù

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni chos can sgras mi rtag pa bye brag tu byas pas brjod pa ste /üîΩsgra ma yin pa'i mi rtag pa las sgra bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni chos can sgras mi rtag pa bye brag tu byas pas brjod pa ste /üîΩsgra ma yin pa'i mi rtag pa las sgra bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe particular of the subject‚Äù in name, but ‚Äúthe sound of the impermanence of sound‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúthe

original: de dag don du ni bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag don du ni bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
translated: In fact, there is not the slightest difference between them.

original: thams cad kyang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos sgra dang ldan par rtogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos sgra dang ldan par rtogs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For both agree in maintaining that the word ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is understood to be a sound that is impermanent.

original: de yang byas pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par nus pa'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de yang byas pa'i rtags kyis rtogs par nus pa'i phyir 'dod pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: And since that is something that can be understood by the mark of being produced, there is no harm in maintaining that.

original: 'dus pa yod pa'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod pa sgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te bdag nyid bsgrub par mi 'dod na bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa gzhan thams @239a * //
analyzed: 'dus pa yod pa'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod pa sgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te bdag nyid bsgrub par mi 'dod na bstan bcos byed pa'i 'dod pa gzhan thams @239a * //
translated: But since the existence of an assemblage is not something that can be established by the mark of being produced, it is not possible to establish the existence of action, etc., by mere assertion.

original: cad bsgrub par bya ba yin pa gsal bar rigs pa'i phyir rang nyid smos mi dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: cad bsgrub par bya ba yin pa gsal bar rigs pa'i phyir rang nyid smos mi dgos so zhe na /
translated: If you do not wish to establish yourself, then it is not necessary to mention yourself, since it is clear that all other assertions of the treatise are to be established.

original: 'dod pa gzhan thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He states that all other assertions, etc.

original: bdag ni bye brag par gyur pa'i smra bas smra'o zhes rtsod pa na /
analyzed: bdag ni bye brag par gyur pa'i smra bas smra'o zhes rtsod pa na /
translated: When a Vaise~ika argues, ‚ÄúI speak as a Vaise~ika,‚Äù

original: bye brag pa des sgra byas pas mi rtag par bsgrub pa na /
analyzed: bye brag pa des sgra byas pas mi rtag par bsgrub pa na /
translated: and he proves that sound is impermanent because it is produced,

original: dpyod pa pa na re ;
analyzed: dpyod pa pa na re ;
translated: the Dvyardhasatik~ prajfiiimula says that the Lokayatikas object:

original: khyed kyi ston pa thub pa gzegs can gyis sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan du khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyi ston pa thub pa gzegs can gyis sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan du khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Because your teacher Kanada the Splitter accepts sound to be a quality of space,üîΩif sound is impermanent, space would be a quality.
