original: sgra mi rtag na nam mkha' dag yon tan du 'gyur ro zhes sgra rang gi ston pa'i khas blangs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa dang / dam bcas pa rang gi bstan bcos dang 'gal par gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bye brag pa yang khas len bar sems la /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag na nam mkha' dag yon tan du 'gyur ro zhes sgra rang gi ston pa'i khas blangs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa dang / dam bcas pa rang gi bstan bcos dang 'gal par gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bye brag pa yang khas len bar sems la /
translated: Thus the reason would be unestablished and the thesis would be contradictory to his own treatise.

original: dpyod pa pa yang skyon yin pa bye brag pa dang dpyod pa pa la kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa pa yang skyon yin pa bye brag pa dang dpyod pa pa la kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that the reason and thesis are faulty because they are accepted by the Vaise~ika and the Diibkiintika.

original: gal te de lta bas na rgol ba de dag byas pas sgra 'jig par bsgrub pa la de nyid kyis dri za'i yon tan nyid yin par 'dod pa'i don phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta bas na rgol ba de dag byas pas sgra 'jig par bsgrub pa la de nyid kyis dri za'i yon tan nyid yin par 'dod pa'i don phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then because those disputants are faulty, the proof that sound is impermanent would be contradictory to the meaning of the thesis that sound is a quality of space.

original: sgra mi rtag na bstan bcos las gzhan pa'i yon tan du 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag na bstan bcos las gzhan pa'i yon tan du 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: Because sound is impermanent, it is similar to a quality that is different from the treatise.

original: dri yang mi rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dri yang mi rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: Odor would also be impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nas rtag pa'i yon tan ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nas rtag pa'i yon tan ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And impermanence would not be a quality of permanence.

original: byas pa'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: byas pa'i gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: The reason of being produced would be contradictory.üîΩWhy do you not consider this fault?

original: skyon 'di ci'i phyir mi sems de gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: skyon 'di ci'i phyir mi sems de gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan la yang mtshungs te /
translated: The same applies to the qualities of space.

original: rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa sems pa'i skabs yin gyis nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa sems pa'i skabs yin gyis nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no //
translated: It is the occasion for considering whether space is permanent or impermanent, not whether it is a quality of space.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan ni skabs ma yin pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan ni skabs ma yin pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: No, it is not the case that the qualities of space are not the occasion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos can de sgra'i chos su mi rtag pa dang gcig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos can de sgra'i chos su mi rtag pa dang gcig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the subject is impermanent and one with the quality of sound.üîΩBecause there is no connection with the thing.

original: dngos po'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bstan bcos byed par brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bstan bcos byed par brtags pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: The qualities of space are only imagined by the author of the treatise, they are not qualities of the thing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos las zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it says in the treatise, and so on.

original: gal te bstan bcos las khas blangs pas kyang gnod na ni /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos las khas blangs pas kyang gnod na ni /
translated: If it is faulty because it is accepted in treatises,

original: de lta na dril sa'i yon tan nyid do yang bstan bcos pas khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dril sa'i yon tan nyid do yang bstan bcos pas khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be contradictory because it is similar to the acceptance of treatises by the proponents of sound as a quality of space.

original: de mi 'gyur na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mi 'gyur na nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not, then the quality of space would not be sound.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir gal te sgra las nam mkha'i yon tan nyid rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin pa yang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir gal te sgra las nam mkha'i yon tan nyid rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin pa yang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: If the opponent‚Äôs assertion is that sound is a quality of space, then that must be proven.

original: rigs @239b pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rigs @239b pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning?

original: rjes su dpag pas te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas te /
translated: It is inference.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba sgra mi rtag pa'i spyi'i phyogs gcig sgra'i rang bzhin nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag ces pa spyi'i phyogs gcig rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba sgra mi rtag pa'i spyi'i phyogs gcig sgra'i rang bzhin nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag ces pa spyi'i phyogs gcig rgol ba'i 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, the opponent‚Äôs assertion is that sound is a quality of space, which is a part of the general subject of sound, because it is a quality of space, which is a part of the general subject of sound.

original: bye brag yin pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgra'i rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag yin pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgra'i rang bzhin yin par khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase merely as a particular is stated after accepting that sound's nature is the quality of space.

original: don ni de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba rang gi chos kyi bye brag tshul mtha' yas pa rnams nam yang mi 'dor bar rgol ba'i 'dod pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: don ni de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba rang gi chos kyi bye brag tshul mtha' yas pa rnams nam yang mi 'dor bar rgol ba'i 'dod pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that the nature of that is not abandoned at any time, even though there are limitless ways of positing its particular attributes.

original: bsgrub par bya ba rgyun mi 'chad de mtha' yas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rgyun mi 'chad de mtha' yas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The probandum would be endless, and it follows that it would be impossible to establish.

original: de la thal bar 'gyur ba ci yod ce na /üîΩbsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la thal bar 'gyur ba ci yod ce na / bsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: What would be the consequence of that?

original: de snyed kyi rtags dang 'brel ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snyed kyi rtags dang 'brel ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be impossible to establish because the evidence would not be ascertained as being related to that extent.

original: phyin ci log nyams su myong ba ni sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub par 'dod pa ni blo'i'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyams su myong ba ni sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid sgrub par 'dod pa ni blo'i'o //
translated: The experience of error is the cognition that wishes to establish that sound is the quality of space.

original: de 'gog pa ni de dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de 'gog pa ni de dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: The refutation of that is the opposite of that.

original: de ltar mi 'dod pa'i blo mi rtag pa tsam sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod pa'i blo mi rtag pa tsam sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The cognition that does not wish to do that is the wish to establish that sound is merely impermanent.

original: de ltar 'jug pa ni de ltar rang rig pa nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa ni de ltar rang rig pa nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: Thus, the experience of reflexive awareness is engaged in that way.

original: de la tshad ma med bzhin stobs kyis de 'dod rgyal gyis nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par 'dod pa yod do zhes sgrub pa'i rgol ba ni byas pa'i gtan tshigs smra ba'i rgol ba'i 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i rang rig pa'i mngon
analyzed: de la tshad ma med bzhin stobs kyis de 'dod rgyal gyis nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par 'dod pa yod do zhes sgrub pa'i rgol ba ni byas pa'i gtan tshigs smra ba'i rgol ba'i 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i rang rig pa'i mngon
translated: The opponent who asserts that, although there is no valid knowledge, one can still posit the quality of space by force of the experience of reflexive awareness is a proponent of the argument from the effect. The opponent who asserts the argument from the effect contradicts the reflexive awareness that is the subject, which does not assert the quality of space.

original: sum gyis grub pa dang 'gal ba kun du spyod do //üîΩgal te mi rtag ba tsam zhig sgrub par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtogs na 'di la nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par 'dod pa med do zhes rang gi nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba yang kun du spyod do //
analyzed: sum gyis grub pa dang 'gal ba kun du spyod do // gal te mi rtag ba tsam zhig sgrub par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtogs na 'di la nam mkha'i yon tan sgrub par 'dod pa med do zhes rang gi nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba yang kun du spyod do //
translated: The opponent who asserts the argument from the effect acts in contradiction to his own experience.üîΩIf the opponent asserts that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness, then he contradicts his own assertion that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness.

original: de rtogs pa ni bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i nyams su myong ba ste /üîΩde yang 'dod pa kho na dang mthun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i nyams su myong ba ste /üîΩde yang 'dod pa kho na dang mthun pa yin gyi /
translated: If the opponent asserts that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness, then he contradicts his own assertion that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness.üîΩIf the opponent asserts that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness, then he contradicts his own assertion that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness.üîΩIf the opponent asserts that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness, then he contradicts his own assertion that the quality of space is established by the experience of reflexive awareness.

original: mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no experience of what is not desired.

original: de la stobs kyis te nyams su myong ba'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de la stobs kyis te nyams su myong ba'i tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang ngo //
translated: There, by force, there is also contradiction with the valid cognition of experience.

original: myong ba mi 'dod pa yang 'dod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba mi 'dod pa yang 'dod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And the non-experience of what is desired is also desired.

original: gal te spyi'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes ma smras sam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes ma smras sam zhe na /
translated: But wasn't it said that it is because it is a part of the general position?

original: rgol ba'i bsam pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgol ba'i bsam pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not a reason for the result of the opponent's intention.

original: rang bzhin gyis rtags ni med de bsam pa rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin mi rtogs bas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rtags ni med de bsam pa rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin mi rtogs bas so //
translated: There is no natural reason, because the intention is naturally distant, and its nature is not understood.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa dang ma 'brel ba'i don nam @240a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa dang ma 'brel ba'i don nam @240a * //
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is not related to desire,

original: mkha'i yon tan nyid gang yang mi rtogs pas gzhan mi rtag pa rang gi rtags kyis go bar nus pa la ci yid gnyis te mi gnod /
analyzed: mkha'i yon tan nyid gang yang mi rtogs pas gzhan mi rtag pa rang gi rtags kyis go bar nus pa la ci yid gnyis te mi gnod /
translated: or any quality of space, is not understood. So what doubt is there about the other impermanence that can be understood by its own reason? It is not harmed.

original: gal te bstan bcos kyis gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos kyis gnod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is harmed by the treatise,

original: rjes su dpag pa rang gi yul dngos po'i stobs kyis rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rang gi yul dngos po'i stobs kyis rtogs pa la'o //
translated: it is for inference, which is understood by the power of the object.

original: lung la mi ltos te /
analyzed: lung la mi ltos te /
translated: It does not depend on scripture.

original: des phan pa 'am gnod pa med de dngos po'i rang bzhin tshig bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des phan pa 'am gnod pa med de dngos po'i rang bzhin tshig bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not helpful or harmful, because the nature of things does not change according to words.

original: das grub pas ni rjes su dpag pas mo  //
analyzed: das grub pas ni rjes su dpag pas mo  //
translated: It is established by reasoning, not by scripture.

original: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid btang na kho bo bye brag pa'i smra ba po zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa btang par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid btang na kho bo bye brag pa'i smra ba po zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa btang par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you give up the quality of space, you give up the argument that you are a Vaise~ika.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: At that time,

original: rtsod pa'i tshe 'di ni zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i de'i lung khas len pa'i thabs yin te brtsad nas rigs pas grub na lung gzod khas blangs par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i tshe 'di ni zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i de'i lung khas len pa'i thabs yin te brtsad nas rigs pas grub na lung gzod khas blangs par bya'o //
translated: at the time of the argument, this is the method of accepting the scripture of the opponent. If it is established by reasoning, then the scripture should be accepted.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i tshe'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of the argument.

original: de yod kyang zhes bya ba lung yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yod kyang zhes bya ba lung yod kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it exists means even though the scripture exists.

original: thags min te rigs pas rtsod pa ni lung gis phan pa'am gnod pas mi nus pas so //
analyzed: thags min te rigs pas rtsod pa ni lung gis phan pa'am gnod pas mi nus pas so //
translated: It is not, because a dispute by reasoning cannot be helped or harmed by scripture.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //
translated: Thus means by reasoning.

original: yul gnyis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i lung ni don to //
analyzed: yul gnyis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i lung ni don to //
translated: The ‚Äútwo objects‚Äù are the direct and the indirect.

original: rnam dag ni tshad mas grub pa ste /
analyzed: rnam dag ni tshad mas grub pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Valid‚Äù means established by a means of valid knowledge.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa lung gi don mngon sum gyis grub ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa lung gi don mngon sum gyis grub ba'o //
translated: The objects of scriptural statements such as ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù etc., are established by direct perception.

original: mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas grub pa'o //
translated: The objects of scriptural statements such as ‚Äúimpermanence,‚Äù ‚Äúemptiness,‚Äù etc., are established by inference.

original: de lta bu bstan bcos tshad mas grub cing tshad mas ma grub pa don la yang tshad ma dang rang gi tshig gis mi gnod pa yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de lta bu bstan bcos tshad mas grub cing tshad mas ma grub pa don la yang tshad ma dang rang gi tshig gis mi gnod pa yongs su bzung ste /
translated: Thus, the treatise is established by a means of valid knowledge, and the object is established by a means of valid knowledge, and is not contradicted by a means of valid knowledge, either in its own words or in its meaning.

original: khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted.

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa ni lung khas blangs pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa ni lung khas blangs pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: Thus, the treatise is a means of accepting scriptural statements.

original: yang yongs su gzung bar 'dod na gzung ba de'i dus yin pas zhes bya ba ni lung nyid la grub pa'i don lung nyid kyis yongs su gzung bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: yang yongs su gzung bar 'dod na gzung ba de'i dus yin pas zhes bya ba ni lung nyid la grub pa'i don lung nyid kyis yongs su gzung bar 'dod na'o //
translated: ‚Äú If one wishes to accept the object, it is the time of the acceptance‚Äù means that if one wishes to accept the object established by the scriptural statement itself by the scriptural statement itself,

original: de tshe bstan bcos kyis rtags dang dam bca' ba'i skyon gyis brtsad de /
analyzed: de tshe bstan bcos kyis rtags dang dam bca' ba'i skyon gyis brtsad de /
translated: then the treatise should be disputed by the faults of the reason and thesis.

original: lung des grub pa'i don la ni lung de dang mi 'gal bas sems par rigs pa ste /
analyzed: lung des grub pa'i don la ni lung de dang mi 'gal bas sems par rigs pa ste /
translated: The meaning established by that scripture is reasonable to consider, because it is not contradictory to that scripture.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be a fault in the proof, called ‚Äúcontradictory and non-mistaken.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar lung gis brtsad pa de tshad mas grub pa la yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar lung gis brtsad pa de tshad mas grub pa la yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: If one argues with scripture in that way, it is not established by valid knowledge.

original: gnas gsum par ni 'jug pa na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas gsum par ni 'jug pa na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúWhen engaging in the third stage‚Äù is stated.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la dpyod pa na ste /
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la dpyod pa na ste /
translated: When analyzing what is extremely hidden,

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa la ni ma yin te de @240b la lung mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa la ni ma yin te de @240b la lung mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not when it is manifest or hidden, because the latter do not rely on scripture.

original: lung gis brtsad ba de la yang bsgrub bya'i chos kyis ni 'brel bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: lung gis brtsad ba de la yang bsgrub bya'i chos kyis ni 'brel bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In that argument with scripture, the probandum is related to the property of the position.

original: stong pa nyid kyi 'brel ba mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa lta bu'i chos gang med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi 'brel ba mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa lta bu'i chos gang med na /
translated: If the property of the position, such as impermanence and suffering, is not related to emptiness,

original: bsgrub par bya ba stong pa nyid mi 'byung ba dag la gnod pa'i lan gdab po //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba stong pa nyid mi 'byung ba dag la gnod pa'i lan gdab po //
translated: then the response is to refute the probandum, emptiness, which does not occur if the property of the position is not related to emptiness.

original: thug pa med par thal 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal 'gyur phyir //
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that there would be no end.

original: de bstan bcos kyi don mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan bcos kyi don mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the treatise is limitless.

original: gal te bstan bcos med par rtog ge ba 'ba' zhig gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma las lung gis phan par bya ba 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos med par rtog ge ba 'ba' zhig gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma las lung gis phan par bya ba 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the purpose of PramƒÅ·πáavƒÅrttika is established by scripture, not by logic, because it cannot be understood by logicians without the treatise,

original: sems pa kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems pa kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [Dharmakƒ´rti] says in all reasoning, and so on.

original: gal te sgrub byed cig la bstan bcos kyi don kun gyi dpe dag ni zhes bya brtags dang 'brel ba dag mthong na ste /
analyzed: gal te sgrub byed cig la bstan bcos kyi don kun gyi dpe dag ni zhes bya brtags dang 'brel ba dag mthong na ste /
translated: If one sees that all the examples in the treatise are related to the probandum,

original: grub na de grub nyid du 'gyur gyi rang gi don tsam grub pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grub na de grub nyid du 'gyur gyi rang gi don tsam grub pas ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is established, not by establishing one's own meaning alone.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na srid pa'i tha snyad las 'das te shes par mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na srid pa'i tha snyad las 'das te shes par mi nus pa'am /
translated: Supramundane body means that which cannot be known by transcending worldly conventions or existence,

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos pos ma 'dres pa'i chos nam mkha'i yon tan lung las grags pa ma grub pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos pos ma 'dres pa'i chos nam mkha'i yon tan lung las grags pa ma grub pas /
translated: or that which is not mixed with things that contradict worldly renown, and whose qualities are like space, renowned in the scriptures.

original: rang gi khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa de ci 'grub pa 'am yang na sgra dang ma 'brel ba nam mkha'i yon tan ma grub pas sgra'i byas pas mi 'grub bam ;üîΩde'i rtags byas pas rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa de bsgrub par brjod pa la 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: rang gi khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa de ci 'grub pa 'am yang na sgra dang ma 'brel ba nam mkha'i yon tan ma grub pas sgra'i byas pas mi 'grub bam ; de'i rtags byas pas rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa de bsgrub par brjod pa la 'dod pa la'o //
translated: Is it that its pervader, impermanence, is not established, or is it that the quality of space, which is not related to sound, is not established, and therefore sound‚Äôs being produced is not established?üîΩIn response to the statement that the reason, being produced, establishes its property, impermanence, the opponent says, ‚ÄúHow does the establishment of impermanence as being produced serve as the thesis and the reason?

original: mi rtag pa byas pa de grub pa la ji ltar byed dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon can yin de'i phyir dpe'i chos can tshang bang dang / rang gi ngag las ni bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos mtha' dag mthong ba ma yin yang ngo /
analyzed: mi rtag pa byas pa de grub pa la ji ltar byed dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon can yin de'i phyir dpe'i chos can tshang bang dang / rang gi ngag las ni bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos mtha' dag mthong ba ma yin yang ngo /
translated: ‚Äù Therefore, the subject of the example is the kitchen, and from one‚Äôs own words, all the phenomena known from the treatise are seen.

original: gal te ltar grub pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltar grub pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why it is established in that way,

original: rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúnature and so on.‚Äù

original: rtsod pa'i gnod pa ni lung la sogs pa gang gis kyang ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnod pa ni lung la sogs pa gang gis kyang ste /
translated: The fault of the debate is that it is not established by any scripture and so on.

original: dngos po la tshig gis mi gnod pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma la tshad mas mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la tshig gis mi gnod pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma la tshad mas mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because words do not invalidate things, and because valid cognitions do not invalidate other valid cognitions.

original: de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dpyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dpyad nas /
translated: Having thus analyzed inference for oneself,

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan la bstan par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan la bstan par 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the author] states one who wishes to teach others and so on, in order to explain inference for others.

original: de'i gtan tshigs nges so //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs nges so //
translated: The reason for that is certain.

original: lung mi par ji ltar rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung mi par ji ltar rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it that scripture is not understood?

original: rtogs pa nyid do //üîΩgal te bstan bcos kyi rigs pa @241a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid do // gal te bstan bcos kyi rigs pa @241a * //
translated: It is understood.

original: la gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: la gnod do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it contradicts the reasoning of the treatise,

original: bstan bcos mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: the treatise is unreasonable,

original: nam mkha'i yon tan las byas pa'i tshad mas gnod pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan las byas pa'i tshad mas gnod pas so //
translated: because it is invalidated by a valid cognition produced from the quality of space.

original: gzhan rigs pa smra ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan rigs pa smra ba ste /
translated: Others argue that it is reasonable,

original: byas pa dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mi rtag par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa dang 'brel ba'i dngos po mi rtag par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: establishing impermanence as a property related to the produced.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir don kun mtshungs par byas nas ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir don kun mtshungs par byas nas ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to summarize, [the author] states having made all the meanings similar,

original: bstan bcos kyi don kun mtshungs par zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gcig gis bsgrub par ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don kun mtshungs par zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gcig gis bsgrub par ro //
translated: The meaning of the treatise is all the same, i.e., it is established by one reason.

original: nyams par 'gyur te mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur te mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be destroyed, i.e., it would be impossible.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba rang nyid 'dod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba rang nyid 'dod pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, i.e., because it is established by one‚Äôs own assertion alone.

original: gcig gis grub pa la 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gcig gis te byas pas mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bdag grub pa la'o //
analyzed: gcig gis grub pa la 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gcig gis te byas pas mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal bdag grub pa la'o //
translated: Even though there is no contradiction in establishing one, i.e., by one reason, that the produced is impermanent and that suffering is self-produced.

original: 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni tshad mas mi gnod kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni tshad mas mi gnod kyang ngo //
translated: Even though there is no contradiction, i.e., even though it is not invalidated by valid cognition.

original: gnod pa ni bstan bcos te thub pa gzegs can gyi tshig gis so //
analyzed: gnod pa ni bstan bcos te thub pa gzegs can gyi tshig gis so //
translated: The treatise is the invalidation, i.e., the words of the sage Kanada.

original: de ni gzhan gyi yul la ste dris pa'i yon tan nyid la yong ngo //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi yul la ste dris pa'i yon tan nyid la yong ngo //
translated: That is in the domain of others, i.e., in the very quality of the questioned virtue.

original: gal te de nyid la gnod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid la gnod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa nyid la'o //
translated: If it is an invalidation of that itself, i.e., of the impermanence of sound.

original: de rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni byas pa de rang gis mi rtag pa bsgrub pa la tshad mas mi gnod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la 'gal ba med kyang zhes bya ba ni byas pa de rang gis mi rtag pa bsgrub pa la tshad mas mi gnod kyang ngo //
translated: means that although that which is produced is not contradicted by valid cognition in proving that it is impermanent by itself.üîΩBecause it is similar for the produced of others,

original: gzhan gyi byas ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi byas ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dri la'o //
translated: means that it is similar for smell.üîΩIf it is said that the fault of the thesis is also in the treatise of the sage Kanada, that the quality of space has sound,

original: gal te gzhan thub pa gzegs zin gyi bstan bcos pa na nam mkha'i yon tan can yang dam bcas pa'i skyon yin ba nyid de yid ches pas gsal ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan thub pa gzegs zin gyi bstan bcos pa na nam mkha'i yon tan can yang dam bcas pa'i skyon yin ba nyid de yid ches pas gsal ba'o zhe na /
translated: because it is clear by means of what is accepted,

original: yin mod kyi zhes bya ba yid ches pas gsal ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: yin mod kyi zhes bya ba yid ches pas gsal ba yin pa'o //
translated: it is clear by means of what is accepted.

original: gzhan gyi yul ni dril yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul ni dril yang ngo //
translated: The object of others is also smell.

original: gal te byas bas gnod par byas pa'i chos can sgra'i brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te byas bas gnod par byas pa'i chos can sgra'i brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that the quality of space is harmed by the property of the subject that is harmed by production, because it is desired to be expressed by sound,

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod pa yin gyi gzhan dril ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod pa yin gyi gzhan dril ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: it is the quality of space that is harmed, not another smell.üîΩIt is also for others,

original: gzhan la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dri la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dri la yang ngo //
translated: means that it is also for smell.

original: byas pa gang yang rang gi mi rtag pa sgrub par nus pa de'i phyir bstan bcos kyi gnod pa 'di'o //
analyzed: byas pa gang yang rang gi mi rtag pa sgrub par nus pa de'i phyir bstan bcos kyi gnod pa 'di'o //
translated: Whatever is done is capable of establishing one‚Äôs own impermanence, therefore this is the fault of the treatise.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni di la sogs pa bstan bcos las bshad do cog bsgrub dgos par ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni di la sogs pa bstan bcos las bshad do cog bsgrub dgos par ro //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence, this is explained in the treatise.

original: de'i nus pa ma yin te sngar bshad ba de'i phyir bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kho bo ni bye brag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i nus pa ma yin te sngar bshad ba de'i phyir bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kho bo ni bye brag pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is not capable of that, because it was previously explained. Therefore, because of accepting the treatise, it is said, ‚ÄúI am a Vaise·π£ika.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos ma grub pa ni sgra la mig gis gzung ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos ma grub pa ni sgra la mig gis gzung ba'o //
translated: The nonestablishment of the treatise is that sound is apprehended by the eye.

original: de yang dam bca' bar 'gyur @241b te ;
analyzed: de yang dam bca' bar 'gyur @241b te ;
translated: That also becomes a thesis.

original: bstan bcos las mig gis gzung ba bshad pa de sgra la ma grub pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa'i ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las mig gis gzung ba bshad pa de sgra la ma grub pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa'i ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the explanation in the treatise that sound is apprehended by the eye is the nonestablishment of the explanation in the nonestablished treatise, it is a nonestablishment of the treatise.

original: rigs pas grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba mig gis gzung ba ste bstan bcos las byung ba yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'ongs pa'o ;
analyzed: rigs pas grub pa'i bsgrub par bya ba mig gis gzung ba ste bstan bcos las byung ba yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i yon tan bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'ongs pa'o ;
translated: The probandum established by reasoning is the object of the eye, because it is mentioned in the treatise, like the qualities of space.

original: / de kho na'i tshig gis bzlog bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de kho na'i tshig gis bzlog bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be refuted by the words of reality itself.

original: rigs pas 'ongs ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pas 'ongs ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of reasoning is the nature of things.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra yang rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa zhes bya ba phyogs kyi rang bzhin gyi don can yin na /üîΩgal te bdag nyid mi 'dod kyang bstan btsos byed pas 'dod pas yang phyogs pas phyi rol tu gyur pa ste don can du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho nas 'grub pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi sgras ni don 'ga' yang rgyas par byed pa
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra yang rgol ba bdag nyid kyis 'dod pa zhes bya ba phyogs kyi rang bzhin gyi don can yin na / gal te bdag nyid mi 'dod kyang bstan btsos byed pas 'dod pas yang phyogs pas phyi rol tu gyur pa ste don can du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho nas 'grub pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi sgras ni don 'ga' yang rgyas par byed pa
translated: Moreover, if the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù has the meaning of the nature of the thesis of the opponent,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: even if one does not accept it oneself, since the treatise accepts it, it becomes external to one‚Äôs own position, and since it is established by the term ‚Äúaccepts,‚Äù the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù does not add anything to the meaning.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa'am /
translated: If it is a Buddhist,

original: bye brag pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa dag la bdag gi 'dod pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don du bdag nyin gyi sgra smos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa dag la bdag gi 'dod pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don du bdag nyin gyi sgra smos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúown‚Äù is mentioned in the sense of ‚Äúengaging the treatises by one‚Äôs own wish.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma rnams mi rigs par ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma rnams mi rigs par ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Also‚Äù means not only are the former interpretations unreasonable.

original: bstan bcos la bdag nyid mi 'dod bas mi 'jug ces bya ba'i dogs pa 'dig las te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la bdag nyid mi 'dod bas mi 'jug ces bya ba'i dogs pa 'dig las te /
translated: The doubt that the treatises are not engaged because one does not wish to is eliminated.

original: 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bdag nyid ces ma smras kyang bdag nyid 'dod na 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces ma smras kyang bdag nyid 'dod na 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though ‚Äúown‚Äù is not mentioned, one engages them if one wishes to.

original: de'i phyir rgyu gang gis na bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i 'bad ba byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gang gis na bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i 'bad ba byed /
translated: Therefore, what is the reason for applying the word ‚Äúown‚Äù?

original: gal te bskul ba'i don du'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bskul ba'i don du'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is for the purpose of urging,

original: tshad mas zhes bya ba smos te bstan bcos la mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gags mi byed de mi gnod na cis ldog par 'gyur te rang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes bya ba smos te bstan bcos la mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gags mi byed de mi gnod na cis ldog par 'gyur te rang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the response is ‚Äúby valid knowledge.‚Äù If valid knowledge, such as direct perception, does not obstruct or harm the treatises, how could one turn away from them? One would not engage them.

original: tshig gis zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gis zhes bya ba ni bdag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúwords‚Äù are the words ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: gang yang mi 'jug go zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod na'o //
analyzed: gang yang mi 'jug go zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod na'o //
translated: ‚Äú It does not engage‚Äù means that it is contradicted by perception and so on.

original: yang rnam par bshad ba byed pa gzhan dag ni bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ltar 'chad de /
analyzed: yang rnam par bshad ba byed pa gzhan dag ni bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ltar 'chad de /
translated: Other commentators explain the phrase ‚Äúin terms of itself‚Äù as follows.

original: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' la yod pa'i'o //
analyzed: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' la yod pa'i'o //
translated: It is in terms of a philosophical tenet system.

original: rab tu grags pa'i tshad mas grub ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i tshad mas grub ba'o //
translated: It is well known and established by valid cognition.

original: dpyod pa'i skabs su nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rtags sbyor ba'i skabs kyis so //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i skabs su nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rtags sbyor ba'i skabs kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú In terms of itself‚Äù in the context of analysis means in the context of a syllogism.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can gzung ba'i don du 'chad pa'o //üîΩci yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @242a * //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can gzung ba'i don du 'chad pa'o // ci yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @242a * //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the subject that is a phenomenon that is an object of apprehension of a specific mode of perception.üîΩ‚Äú It is nothing at all‚Äù means

original: don med pa'o //
analyzed: don med pa'o //
translated: that it is nonexistent.

original: gal te dpyod pa'i skabs nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i chos can ci'i phyir rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te dpyod pa'i skabs nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i chos can ci'i phyir rtogs she na /
translated: If the subject that is established by its own nature in the context of analysis is understood, why is it not understood in the context of the syllogism?

original: rang gi 'dod bas brtags ba'i bye brag ste spyi gcig dum la 'jug pa nyid sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang / mi rtogs pa la spyi gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / don gcig la 'du ba can yod pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod bas brtags ba'i bye brag ste spyi gcig dum la 'jug pa nyid sgra la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang / mi rtogs pa la spyi gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / don gcig la 'du ba can yod pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: The particular that is imagined by one‚Äôs own desire, that is, the universal, is applied to the word by the quality of space, and to the non-apprehension by the difference from the universal and the particular, and to the existent by the collection in one object.

original: de nyid tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: de nyid tshig gi don yin no //
translated: That is the meaning of the word.

original: des na bdag nyid 'dod pas brtags pa'i bye brag nyid tshig gi don to //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid 'dod pas brtags pa'i bye brag nyid tshig gi don to //
translated: Therefore, the particular that is imagined by one‚Äôs own desire is the meaning of the word.

original: brtags pa'i bye brag gis tshig gi don kyang yin la don la rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: brtags pa'i bye brag gis tshig gi don kyang yin la don la rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pa yang yin pas /
translated: The particular that is imagined is the meaning of the word, and it is not applied in dependence on the object.

original: brtags pa'i bye brag gis don la rag las ba'i nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pa'o //üîΩde ni du ma yin pa'i phyir rnams te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i bye brag gis don la rag las ba'i nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pa'o // de ni du ma yin pa'i phyir rnams te /
translated: The particular that is imagined is not applied in dependence on the object.üîΩThat is the many, because it is applied in dependence on the object imagined by the desire of the person.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i don la rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i don la rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is applied in dependence on the object imagined by the desire of the person.

original: rag las pa yang yin la nye bar sbyor ba yang yin pas /
analyzed: rag las pa yang yin la nye bar sbyor ba yang yin pas /
translated: It is applied in dependence, and it is applied.

original: rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba can te /
analyzed: rag las pa'i nye bar sbyor ba can te /
translated: It is a dependent designation.

original: don gyis bskyed pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: don gyis bskyed pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is a manifestation that is generated by the meaning.

original: de ma yin ba ni ma yin pa ste rang dgar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin ba ni ma yin pa ste rang dgar snang ba'o //
translated: It is not that which is not, that is, it is not a manifestation that is independent.

original: de lta bu'i don med ba rtogs pa tsam dag la rnam par gzhag pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don med ba rtogs pa tsam dag la rnam par gzhag pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mere conceptualizations that do not have such an object is a proof.

original: dgag ba ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dgag ba ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The refutation is a clarification.

original: sbyor ba ni rtags la sogs pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rtags la sogs pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: The application is the understanding through a reason, and so on.

original: 'ga' yang med de rtog pa dang ldan pa dag gi 'jug pa ni don bya ba'i don du gnyer ba yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' yang med de rtog pa dang ldan pa dag gi 'jug pa ni don bya ba'i don du gnyer ba yin la /
translated: There is no application at all, because those who have conceptualization seek to engage in an object in order to achieve its purpose.

original: de lta bu ni don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na / ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //üîΩ'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
analyzed: de lta bu ni don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // des na / ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes // 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtags ci phan //
translated: But that is not the case, because it does not perform a function.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is as explained:üîΩWhat is the use of the lustfulüîΩinvestigating whether a eunuch is beautiful or ugly?

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa dag kyang dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: If one investigates in order to refute that which is not a specific characteristic,

original: dpyod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that one is not investigating?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis la grub pa'i gzhi med pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis la grub pa'i gzhi med pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as there is no basis for the two kinds of intrinsic identity, so it is here.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol la spyir grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol la spyir grub pa'o //
translated: The basis is established in general for both the proponent and the opponent.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes dpyod pa'i gzhir byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhes dpyod pa'i gzhir byed pa med de /
translated: There is no basis for the analysis of the question, ‚ÄúWhat is its intrinsic reality?‚Äù

original: gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis is not established.

original: de'i phyir gzhi tha snyad byed pa ni med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi tha snyad byed pa ni med de /
translated: Therefore, the basis is not the subject of the expression,

original: spyir mthun pa'i tha snyad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyir mthun pa'i tha snyad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to make a general expression about it.

original: de lta bas na brtags pa dag dgag bar bya bar ni rigs kyi rtags kyi gzhir bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtags pa dag dgag bar bya bar ni rigs kyi rtags kyi gzhir bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is proper to refute the imagined, but not the basis of the logical reason.

original: rang nyid kyi sgras ni rtags kyi yul ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sgras ni rtags kyi yul ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates the domain of the logical reason.

original: yang kha cig ste chos can ni rab tu grub pa kho @242b na ste yin par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig ste chos can ni rab tu grub pa kho @242b na ste yin par brjod pa ste /
translated: Now, some say that the subject is well established, that is, it is stated to be established by the proponent and the opponent.

original: 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pas so //
translated: Because of their assertion.

original: de grub pa nyid yin pas chos can bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de grub pa nyid yin pas chos can bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not the case that the subject is to be established, because it is already established, he says,

original: bdag nyid zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo phyogs yin par brjod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo phyogs yin par brjod do zhes zer na /
translated: The word itself indicates the subject that is to be established.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes dang por bstan pa 'di nyid kyis chos can bsgrub par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes dang por bstan pa 'di nyid kyis chos can bsgrub par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the very first statement, the word itself, is for the purpose of refuting the establishment of the subject.

original: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba gang gis chos can la sogs pa grub pa dang / sgrub par byed ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba gang gis chos can la sogs pa grub pa dang / sgrub par byed ba ste /
translated: Thus, the word itself indicates the subject, etc., that are to be established, and the reason and example that are the proof.

original: rtags dang dpe dag bsgrub par bya bar bstan pa srid na'o //
analyzed: rtags dang dpe dag bsgrub par bya bar bstan pa srid na'o //
translated: This is possible if the subject is indicated as that which is to be established.

original: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la grub pa'i chos can bsgrub par 'gyur pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gi bdag nyid la grub pa'i chos can bsgrub par 'gyur pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: If the word itself is used in order to refute the establishment of the subject that is established by itself,

original: bdag nyid kyi sgra smos ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sgra smos ba yin te /
translated: then the word itself is used because

original: rang nyid 'dod ces brjod pas rang gi mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rang nyid 'dod ces brjod pas rang gi mtshan nyid ni bdag nyid mi 'dod pas so //
translated: the intrinsic identity is not accepted by oneself.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyi smra mi brjod na'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos can dgag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyi smra mi brjod na'o //
translated: If the word itself is used in order to include the refutation of the subject that has intrinsic identity,üîΩthen the word itself is used becauseüîΩthe intrinsic identity is not accepted by oneself.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub pa 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bsgrub pa 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba de yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the establishment of the property of the position would be established,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi nyid do // zhes bya ba nyid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of inference is a universal.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúnot a particular‚Äù is understood from that statement.

original: de nyid chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that in ‚ÄúThe subject, etc.‚Äù

original: nyes pa gzhan bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach another fault, he says,

original: rnam par rtog pas bslad pa'i phyir ci ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas bslad pa'i phyir ci ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of being polluted by conceptuality, etc.‚Äù

original: chos can la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chos can la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He mentions the subject, etc.

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of being unable‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: ci'i phyir bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù is the proponent of the tenets‚Äô.

original: gal te gtan tshigs bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of not following the particular reason‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: cha shas gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang po dam bcas pa'o //
analyzed: cha shas gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang po dam bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of relying on another part‚Äù is the first part of the thesis.

original: gnyis pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The second is the reason.

original: gsum pa ni dpe'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dpe'o //
translated: The third is the example.

original: de las 'di dam bca' ba las gzhan pa'i cha shas kyi nyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las 'di dam bca' ba las gzhan pa'i cha shas kyi nyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this is a fault of a part other than the thesis,

original: dam bca' ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur na /
translated: if it is not a fault of the thesis,

original: ci'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon du smra zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon du smra zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: why is it said to be a fault of the thesis?

original: de ltar cha shas phye nas dpyod pa'i skabs btang ste dpyod na ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar cha shas phye nas dpyod pa'i skabs btang ste dpyod na ni gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, if one analyzes having given up the opportunity to analyze by distinguishing parts, then there are faults of the reason, etc.

original: dpe'i skyon yang ngo //
analyzed: dpe'i skyon yang ngo //
translated: There are also faults of the example.

original: phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: There are faults of the position.

original: de ltar na cha shas kyi rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na cha shas kyi rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the arrangement of the parts would be nonexistent.

original: cha shas kyis dbye ba med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir phyogs tsam ste /
analyzed: cha shas kyis dbye ba med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir phyogs tsam ste /
translated: Since there would be no division by parts, therefore, it is just a position,

original: gtan tshigs la sogs pa bsal @243a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs pa bsal @243a * //

analyzed: dka' ba de'i phyir rtogs par bla ba'i phyir /

original: gtan tshigs la sogs gnod spangs las /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la sogs gnod spangs las /

analyzed: logs shig phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ni brjod pa ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: ji ltar bstan ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan ce na /

original: ma khyab pa dang ste grangs can dag tshig tu smras pa tsam phyogs su smra ba'o //

original: bzlog pa dag ni khyab ches pa ste /

original: bye brag pa dang / dpyod pa pa dag byas pas mi rtag bsgrub pa na /

translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika and NaiyƒÅyika, when proving that what is produced is impermanent,

analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan yang sgrub par 'dod pa'o //

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /

original: de las gzhan phyogs ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan phyogs ma yin te /

original: bsal ba dag ni gnod 'gyur bas //
analyzed: bsal ba dag ni gnod 'gyur bas //

original: khas len par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: khas len par mi 'gyur bas so //

analyzed: lhag ma ni ma khyab pa dang bzlog ba dag go //

original: mtshan nyid mi 'jug phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'jug phyir /

translated: The reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.

analyzed: ci'i phyir log par rtogs ba yin zhe na / bsgrub byar 'dod cing mi nyams la //
translated: The reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.

original: thug pa med pa'ang gzigs phyir ro ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'ang gzigs phyir ro ; / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.

original: bstan bcos kyi don thams cad bkag par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don thams cad bkag par gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that the subject is established as the opposite of the probandum.

original: gal te bdag nyid dang 'dod pa //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid dang 'dod pa //
translated: The reason is not superfluous, because it is not the case that

original: zhes bya ba dag gis kho na'i don rtogs pa'i phyir kho na zhes bya ba brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag gis kho na'i don rtogs pa'i phyir kho na zhes bya ba brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say, Because the meaning of 'only' is understood, the word 'only' should not be stated,

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then we reply, Here, etc.

original: bstan zhes bya ba'i sgra dus gsum dang mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar bsgrub par bya bar ma bstan kyang rtags ma grub pa la sogs pa phyis bstan par 'gyur ba'i yang de ltar phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i don du kho na'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: bstan zhes bya ba'i sgra dus gsum dang mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar bsgrub par bya bar ma bstan kyang rtags ma grub pa la sogs pa phyis bstan par 'gyur ba'i yang de ltar phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de rnam par gcod pa'i don du kho na'i sgra smos te /
translated: Because the word teaches is related to the three times, even though the past and present are not taught as objects to be established, the word only is stated in order to eliminate the possibility that the reason is not established, etc., which will be taught later, and that the consequence that all is so will apply to that.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang rung rang gi ngo bo kho na'o zhes bya bar @243b rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang rung rang gi ngo bo kho na'o zhes bya bar @243b rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word only is stated in order to understand that the future is also just its own nature.

original: de ltar na thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo ma grub ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo ma grub ba'o //
translated: Thus, in all cases, the nature of the object to be established is not established.üîΩ If you say, If you accept that, the word 'only' is stated in order to eliminate the superimposition that the object to be established is not established,

original: gal te 'dod 'gyur ces bya ba'i sgras 'dogs par 'gyur ba bsal zin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod 'gyur ces bya ba'i sgras 'dogs par 'gyur ba bsal zin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: we reply, Is the superimposition that the object to be established is not established eliminated by the word 'only'?

original: 'dir de rang gi ngo bo dang nyid bstan ces bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir de rang gi ngo bo dang nyid bstan ces bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used.

original: 'dod 'gyur ces bya ba ni nus pa med ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod 'gyur ces bya ba ni nus pa med ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äú One would desire‚Äù means that because of the absence of the capacity,

original: de ltar rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: it is not a part of the process of understanding.

original: don gcig tu 'dus pa'i chos can gcig la 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: don gcig tu 'dus pa'i chos can gcig la 'brel ba ste /
translated: The connection is with a single property that is the collection of the single meaning.

original: de lta bu'i zla med kyang byas pa'i rtags kyis mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi rgol bas mi 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyis khyad par du byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zla med kyang byas pa'i rtags kyis mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi rgol bas mi 'dod pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyis khyad par du byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that way, even though there is no counterpart, impermanence is to be established by the reason of being produced, and not by the distinction of the quality of space, which is not desired by the opponent.

original: tha dad par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rten gsal ba las so //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rten gsal ba las so //
translated: ‚Äú Having become different‚Äù is from the clear support.

original: dbang pos yongs su gzung ba ni bltar rung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang pos yongs su gzung ba ni bltar rung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Being apprehended by the sense faculty‚Äù is being visible.

original: gzhan du na ste phyir rgol ba khong du chud par mi 'dod na skabs dang ma 'brel ba smra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ste phyir rgol ba khong du chud par mi 'dod na skabs dang ma 'brel ba smra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if one does not desire to be understood by the opponent, one would just be speaking without connection to the topic.

original: gal te bye brag 'ga' ni rtag par bsgrub pas spyi sgra nyid la sogs pas 'phen pas spyi de grub par rgol ba'i 'dod pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩrtogs par byed pa ste /üîΩnyan pa po mi rtag / la la 'ba' zhig rtogs par 'dod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bye brag 'ga' ni rtag par bsgrub pas spyi sgra nyid la sogs pas 'phen pas spyi de grub par rgol ba'i 'dod pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na / rtogs par byed pa ste / nyan pa po mi rtag / la la 'ba' zhig rtogs par 'dod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: we reply that it is not so, because the general term is not a means of knowledge.üîΩThe general term is not a means of knowledge, because it is not a means of knowing the particular,üîΩbecause it is not a means of knowing the general, and because it is not a means of knowing both.

original: gzhan yang nges par spyi'i don bye brag gi nges pa ste /üîΩrtogs pa'i don can yin ba ni med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges par spyi'i don bye brag gi nges pa ste / rtogs pa'i don can yin ba ni med de /
translated: It is not a means of knowing the particular, because it is not a means of knowing the particular as particular.üîΩIt is not a means of knowing the general, because it is not a means of knowing the general as general.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a means of knowing both, because there is no such thing as a general that is related to a particular.

original: bye brag dang 'brel pa dngos por yod na yang /
analyzed: bye brag dang 'brel pa dngos por yod na yang /
translated: If the relation of the general to the particular were a real entity,

original: khyad par gzhan la mi rtsod pa yang srid de me la tsha ba nyid la rtsod pa na 'byung ba 'am 'byung ba las gyur ba'i bye brag la mi rtsod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan la mi rtsod pa yang srid de me la tsha ba nyid la rtsod pa na 'byung ba 'am 'byung ba las gyur ba'i bye brag la mi rtsod pa lta bu'o //
translated: then it would be possible that the particular would not be disputed, as when one disputes the heat of fire, one does not dispute the particular of the element or derivative element.

original: gal te stong pa nyid du rtsod pa la bdag med pa lta bu ni khyad bar nges pa sgrub ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid du rtsod pa la bdag med pa lta bu ni khyad bar nges pa sgrub ba yin te /
translated: If you say that in a dispute about emptiness, the particular is established as a means of knowing the general, as in the case of selflessness,üîΩwe reply that it is not so, because there is no relation.

original: de med na stong pa nyid mi 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: de med na stong pa nyid mi 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If it did not exist, emptiness would not occur.

original: de lta bu ma yin pa mi rtag pa la nam mkha'i yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pa mi rtag pa la nam mkha'i yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that. Impermanence is not the predicate to be proven, such as the quality of space or the universal.

original: spyi la sogs pa'i chos kyi bye brag da lta bu ni gzhung lugs de la mi gnas pa rnams la gang na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa'i chos kyi bye brag da lta bu ni gzhung lugs de la mi gnas pa rnams la gang na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: The particular qualities of universals and so on are not found in the texts of those who do not accept them.

original: de sgrub par 'dod pa med do //
analyzed: de sgrub par 'dod pa med do //
translated: There is no desire to prove them.

original: 'dod na yang mi 'khrul ba'i rtags yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod na yang mi 'khrul ba'i rtags yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there were, there is no evidence that is nonerroneous.

original: de dag dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not qualities of things.

original: spyi bsgrub pa mi srid par bstan pa 'dis gnyis pa can gyi sbyor ba la yang sun dbyung ba rab tu brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: spyi bsgrub pa mi srid par bstan pa 'dis gnyis pa can gyi sbyor ba la yang sun dbyung ba rab tu brjod pa yin te /
translated: This demonstration that the proof of universals is impossible also expresses the refutation of the second type of syllogism.

original: de yang spyi bkod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩspyi la sogs pa bstan bcos @244a * //
analyzed: de yang spyi bkod pa'i phyir ro // spyi la sogs pa bstan bcos @244a * //
translated: Because it is also a universal that is posited.

original: las byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: las byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that universals and so on are accepted because they occur in the treatises,

original: yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: then it is explained that there is an absurd consequence.

original: skabs su bab pa kho na zhes bya ba ni rtogs ba po'i 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa kho na zhes bya ba ni rtogs ba po'i 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The phrase only at the proper time means only when the proponent wishes.

original: bye brag tu ma byas pa ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang / spyi dang don gcig la 'du ba can zhes bye brag tu ma byas pa'i mi rtag pa'i chos can nyid do //
analyzed: bye brag tu ma byas pa ni nam mkha'i yon tan dang / spyi dang don gcig la 'du ba can zhes bye brag tu ma byas pa'i mi rtag pa'i chos can nyid do //
translated: The phrase without distinction means that the subject is impermanent without distinguishing the quality of space, the universal, and the collection.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po'i mi 'dod pa sgrub par byed na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa po'i mi 'dod pa sgrub par byed na'o //
translated: The phrase otherwise means that if one proves what the proponent does not wish.

original: don gzhan du 'gro ba ste bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ston pa ni skabs su ma bab pa ston pas mi rigs pa'i phyir chad pas bcad pa ste /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gro ba ste bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ston pa ni skabs su ma bab pa ston pas mi rigs pa'i phyir chad pas bcad pa ste /
translated: The phrase one is punished for teaching what is irrelevant means that one is punished for teaching what is not to be taught, that is, for teaching at the wrong time, because it is unreasonable.

original: phan pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase one becomes a source of benefit means that one becomes a source of benefit for others.

original: bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo zhes bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bar kun la sbyar ba bstan to //
analyzed: bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo zhes bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bar kun la sbyar ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase one should teach means that one should teach the nature of the subject, and so on, up to the phrase one should teach the manifestation of the subject.

original: yid ches ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i du ma'i tshig tu byas pa ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: yid ches ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i du ma'i tshig tu byas pa ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig gi dbye bas so //
translated: The phrase by those who are trustworthy is stated in the plural because there are different treatises and different statements by the proponents.

original: mngon su mngon zhes bya ba'i don zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: mngon su mngon zhes bya ba'i don zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the point of saying ‚Äúthe meaning of direct perception‚Äù?

original: mngon sum gyi don zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhen direct perception is mentioned . . . ‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba the tshom za ba la gtan tshigs brjod de ston pa yin na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba the tshom za ba la gtan tshigs brjod de ston pa yin na'o //
translated: When a reason is stated to prove something that is doubted, it is a demonstration.

original: rten ma yin zhes bya ba ni de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: rten ma yin zhes bya ba ni de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa mi srid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot a basis‚Äù means that it is impossible for a reason to apply to it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos can gcig la ni phyin ci log pa'i yang dag pa'i shes ba dag ste /üîΩmngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gcig na chos de 'gog la /
analyzed: chos can gcig la ni phyin ci log pa'i yang dag pa'i shes ba dag ste / mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gcig na chos de 'gog la /
translated: In regard to one subject, there are two correct cognitions that are mutually exclusive.üîΩIf one is direct perception or inference, then that property is refuted.

original: yang de la rtags yang dag pa la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i chos de nyid de la sgrub pa 'gal ba gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de la rtags yang dag pa la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i chos de nyid de la sgrub pa 'gal ba gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is impossible for both of those to be established in regard to that, because it is contradictory for a property to be established in regard to that based on a correct reason and for that property to be refuted in regard to that based on a correct reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yang ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yang ste /
translated: It is also because the domain of the reason is demonstrated.

original: phyogs bstan pa yang gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin na gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bstan pa yang gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin na gtan tshigs kyi yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir yin zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
translated: And the indication of the position is for the purpose of indicating the domain of the reason, and the indication of the domain of the reason is for the purpose of indicating the domain of the reason.

original: the tshom ni rgyu'i byed pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bar bya ba yod par srid pa gtan tshigs kyis sgrub par byed pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: the tshom ni rgyu'i byed pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bar bya ba yod par srid pa gtan tshigs kyis sgrub par byed pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Doubt is the domain of the function of the cause, because the existence of the probandum is the domain of the function of the reason that establishes it.

original: bsal bas bsgrub par bya ba mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: bsal bas bsgrub par bya ba mi srid pa'am /
translated: The probandum is not the domain of the function of the reason when it is absent,

original: grub zin pa gtan tshigs kyi byed ba'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: grub zin pa gtan tshigs kyi byed ba'i yul ma yin te /
translated: nor is the established probandum the domain of the function of the reason,

original: de la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the function of the reason is impossible in regard to it.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa gcig dang 'gras bu dang / rang bzhin du brtags pa bdag gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis rjes su dpag pa gcig dang 'gras bu dang / rang bzhin du brtags pa bdag gi dbye bas so //
translated: The division of inference is one, inference by the power of fact, and two, inference by the power of thought, by the division of its own effect and nature.

original: rang gi 'bras bu yang dag par brjod cing zhes bya ba ni @244b rang gi don yang dag par brjod cing ngo //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu yang dag par brjod cing zhes bya ba ni @244b rang gi don yang dag par brjod cing ngo //
translated: The expression its own effect means its own object.

original: de dang 'gal bar khas len pa'i gags byed ces bya ba ni the tshom za bar byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'gal bar khas len pa'i gags byed ces bya ba ni the tshom za bar byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúobstructing‚Äù is ‚Äúcausing doubt.‚Äù

original: gags byed par mtshungs pa de'i phyir 'di ltar rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos dag mngon par bsdus te /
analyzed: gags byed par mtshungs pa de'i phyir 'di ltar rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos dag mngon par bsdus te /
translated: Since it is the same as obstructing, the words of one‚Äôs own speech and treatises are collected together.

original: mtshungs par yid ches 'bras bu yan lag ces brjod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par yid ches 'bras bu yan lag ces brjod do //
translated: The result of the parts of the mind is called ‚Äúsimilar.‚Äù

original: rang tshad ma ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshang ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang tshad ma ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshang ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one‚Äôs own is not valid cognition, the words of inference will not engage.

original: 'on kyang rang gi don de mthong la de nyid la yang gzhan la phyin ci ma log par brjod par 'dod nas smra ba'i phyir ram mi smra bar khas len to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi don de mthong la de nyid la yang gzhan la phyin ci ma log par brjod par 'dod nas smra ba'i phyir ram mi smra bar khas len to //
translated: However, one sees that very object and, desiring to express it to others without error, one speaks or accepts without speaking.

original: bstan bcos ma brten na der grags pa ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos ma brten na der grags pa ste /
translated: If one does not rely on treatises, one is known there.

original: shin tu klog tu gyur ba tshad ma gnyis kyis mthu'i yul ma yin pa dpyad pa yang mi 'jug pa de lta bas te /
analyzed: shin tu klog tu gyur ba tshad ma gnyis kyis mthu'i yul ma yin pa dpyad pa yang mi 'jug pa de lta bas te /
translated: Even if one has become very learned, one does not engage in analysis that is not the domain of the two valid cognitions.

original: bstan bcos tshad mar khas ma blangs na dpyad pa 'jug bar mi 'gyur bas bstan bcos tshad mar khas blangs nas 'jug go //
analyzed: bstan bcos tshad mar khas ma blangs na dpyad pa 'jug bar mi 'gyur bas bstan bcos tshad mar khas blangs nas 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, one engages in analysis by accepting the validity of the treatises.

original: mtshungs par lta bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang khas blangs pas gnod par byed ba yin no zhes bya bar mtshungs par ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par lta bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang khas blangs pas gnod par byed ba yin no zhes bya bar mtshungs par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to view them as equivalent‚Äù means that both are equivalent in that they are invalidated by acceptance.

original: mtshungs par gsungs te zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: mtshungs par gsungs te zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is said to be equivalent‚Äù is by Master Dignaga.

original: tshad ma dang des gzhal bar bya ba'i don dag med do zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: tshad ma dang des gzhal bar bya ba'i don dag med do zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi gzhung lugs so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere are no valid cognitions and objects of comprehension‚Äù is the Vedanta system.

original: rang gi tshig dag mi rigs te /
