analyzed: rang gi tshig dag mi rigs te /
translated: One‚Äôs own words are unreasonable.

original: gal te rang gi tshig don la mi slu bar 'gyur na ni de nyid tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te rang gi tshig don la mi slu bar 'gyur na ni de nyid tshad ma yin la /
translated: If one‚Äôs own words were nondeceptive with regard to their object, then they would be valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ma yin na ni tshig gi don med do //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin na ni tshig gi don med do //
translated: If they are not valid cognition, then the meaning of the words does not exist.

original: bstan bcos kyang tshad ma ma yin na mi rigs te dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyang tshad ma ma yin na mi rigs te dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unreasonable for the treatises to not be valid cognition because there is no doubt.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang des gzhal bar bya ba don med do zhes bya ba dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang des gzhal bar bya ba don med do zhes bya ba dper brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, that refers to the example, valid cognition and the object cognized by it are meaningless.

original: 'dir chos can ni chos so //
analyzed: 'dir chos can ni chos so //
translated: Here, the subject is the phenomenon.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan bcos de la brten ba'i phyir bstan bcos de la gnod pa nyid na des gzhag pa'i gzhi chos nyid mi gnas par ni bde ba rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bsam pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa ni bstan bcos de la brten ba'i phyir bstan bcos de la gnod pa nyid na des gzhag pa'i gzhi chos nyid mi gnas par ni bde ba rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bsam pa'i gzhi med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa'i
translated: If the treatise is undermined, then the basis for the establishment of that phenomenon, which is based on that treatise, does not remain. The basis for the distinction of happiness, suffering, etc. does not exist, so it does not engage.

original: phyir bstan bcos las grags pa'i phyir bye brag sems pa de lta bu la nges par bstan bcos tshad mar bya dgos so //
analyzed: phyir bstan bcos las grags pa'i phyir bye brag sems pa de lta bu la nges par bstan bcos tshad mar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must accept the treatise as valid with regard to such distinctions, which are known from the treatise.

original: da ni ji ltar 'bab stegs dag tu zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'bab stegs dag tu zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste /
translated: Now, how is it that in the case of fords, etc.? This refers to external objects.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal skyon yin na sangs rgyas pa dag ste 'bab stegs su khrus byas pas chos ma yin pa dag par mi @245a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal skyon yin na sangs rgyas pa dag ste 'bab stegs su khrus byas pas chos ma yin pa dag par mi @245a * //
translated: If there is fault in contradicting the treatise, then Buddhists, having bathed at a ford, do not purify what is not Dharma.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bstan bcos mang po las khrus kyi chos ma yin ba dag bar bshad pa dang 'gal bar smra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bstan bcos mang po las khrus kyi chos ma yin ba dag bar bshad pa dang 'gal bar smra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the statement, It contradicts the many treatises that explain the non-dharmas of bathing.

original: ma mthong ba rtogs par byed pa ni gcig tu bskal ba rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rtogs par byed pa ni gcig tu bskal ba rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The realization of what is not seen is the realization of the single eon.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i bstan bcos dag de ltar mi smra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i bstan bcos dag de ltar mi smra'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word all means that the Buddhist treatises do not say that.

original: bkag pa'i skyon med de rang gi bstan bcos dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkag pa'i skyon med de rang gi bstan bcos dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of contradiction is not present, because it does not contradict our own treatises.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gzhan dang 'gal ba med do zhas ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gzhan dang 'gal ba med do zhas ston to //
translated: Moreover, means that it does not contradict other treatises.

original: de la yang zhas bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de la yang zhas bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: There, means other accepted treatises.

original: smra zhing sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir tshad mar khas mi len pas na de dag dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smra zhing sems pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir tshad mar khas mi len pas na de dag dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they speak and think, means that because of that, they are not accepted as valid cognition, so there is no contradiction with them. This is the meaning.

original: 'o na bstan bcos gang zhig dang 'gal ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos gang zhig dang 'gal ce na /
translated: Then with which treatise is there contradiction?

original: bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The treatise is called ‚Äúthat which is to be upheld,‚Äù etc.

original: bstan bcos des gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba des bstan pa'i don rnams gzung ba'i phyir yin pa na de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba sems kyi gzhan dang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos des gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba des bstan pa'i don rnams gzung ba'i phyir yin pa na de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba sems kyi gzhan dang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is upheld by the treatise, it is to be upheld in order to understand the meaning that is taught.  The meaning of ‚Äúit is not the case that it is not‚Äù is that it is not contradictory.

original: bstan bcos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de khas len pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de khas len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe treatise is called ‚Äòthat which is to be upheld‚Äô‚Äù means that it is accepted.

original: de la mi brten pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las bstan pa ma yin pa'i don to //üîΩde bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur na ni de dang bstan bcos dag phan tshun gnod pa ni ma yin gyi phan tshun gags su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mi brten pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las bstan pa ma yin pa'i don to // de bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur na ni de dang bstan bcos dag phan tshun gnod pa ni ma yin gyi phan tshun gags su 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe thing that is not based on that‚Äù means the meaning that is not taught in the treatise.üîΩIf it were contradictory to the treatise, then it would be contradictory to the treatise, but it is not contradictory to the treatise.

original: gnyi ga yang khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is contradictory to the treatise, but it is not contradictory to the treatise.

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSo it is‚Äù means

original: stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir gags nyid yin gyi gnod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir gags nyid yin gyi gnod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: that it is contradictory because it is of equal strength, but it is not contradictory because it is of equal strength.

original: stobs mtshungs pa de yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi bstan bcos dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: stobs mtshungs pa de yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi bstan bcos dang ni ma yin te /
translated: And that equal strength is a contradiction of one‚Äôs own words, not of the treatise.

original: bstan bcos dang stobs mtshungs ba ni bstan ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang stobs mtshungs ba ni bstan ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The equal strength to the treatise is just what was just explained.

original: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las so //
analyzed: de gnyis las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those two‚Äù means from the contradiction of the treatise and one‚Äôs own words.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ne tshad ma med pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ne tshad ma med pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo another‚Äù means to one without valid knowledge.

original: gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i don 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i don 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a refutation‚Äù means it stops the meaning of that.

original: gags ni 'gog par mi nus kyi the tshom du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gags ni 'gog par mi nus kyi the tshom du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAn obstruction‚Äù is that which cannot stop but creates doubt.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means without valid knowledge.

original: dam bca' bar stobs mtshungs pa 'am zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang / bstan bcos dang / rang gi tshig dang rang gi tshig tu'o //
analyzed: dam bca' bar stobs mtshungs pa 'am zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos dang / bstan bcos dang / rang gi tshig dang rang gi tshig tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEqual strength of the thesis‚Äù means of the treatise, of the treatise and one‚Äôs own words, and of one‚Äôs own words.

original: de dag @245b phan tshun rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' bas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag @245b phan tshun rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' bas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur /
translated: How do those mutually unreasonable theses refute?

original: de dag gi cig shos don ji lta ba bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa can la yang rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' bas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi cig shos don ji lta ba bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa can la yang rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' bas ji ltar gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And how can the other, which is inference according to the real state of things, be invalidated by a thesis that is not a logical reason?

original: gal te lung yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that scripture is a means of valid knowledge, and so can invalidate,

original: lung tshad ma nyid ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bsal zin to /
analyzed: lung tshad ma nyid ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bsal zin to /
translated: we have already refuted the idea that scripture is a means of valid knowledge, in the section on inference for oneself.

original: khas blangs te zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du'o //
analyzed: khas blangs te zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos tshad ma nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccepting‚Äù means accepting the treatise as a means of valid knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni lung dang rang gi tshig dag don gyi 'bras bur brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni lung dang rang gi tshig dag don gyi 'bras bur brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means that scripture and one‚Äôs own words are stated to be the effects of the object.

original: yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to show the division of the object,

original: yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang zhe na /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the object?‚Äù

original: khas blangs pa'i yul la gnod pa dang gags byed par gnod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i yul la gnod pa dang gags byed par gnod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the object accepted, because it is invalidated and obstructed by the object accepted.

original: dngos po'i don la gnod pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i don la gnod pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not invalidated by the object that is a thing.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i don ni dngos po'i yul la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i don ni dngos po'i yul la'o //
translated: The object of inference is the object that is a thing.

original: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba yul gyi dbye ba med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba yul gyi dbye ba med na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if there is no division of the object,

original: rtags kyi bye brag gi dbye bas mtha' yas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags kyi bye brag gi dbye bas mtha' yas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: there would be an infinite regress of divisions of the reason.

original: gal te de dag rjes su dpag par 'dus na ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba logs shig tu byas pa don med do //
analyzed: gal te de dag rjes su dpag par 'dus na ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba logs shig tu byas pa don med do //
translated: If they are included in inference, it is pointless to treat contradiction of one's own words separately.

original: gal te khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar mtshungs pa na ci'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bstan bcos las logs su bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar mtshungs pa na ci'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bstan bcos las logs su bstan ce na /
translated: If contradiction of one's own words is similar to contradiction of what is accepted, why is contradiction of one's own words taught separately in the treatise?

original: ngag brjod pa tsam de nyid la de nyid gags byed pa nyid kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: ngag brjod pa tsam de nyid la de nyid gags byed pa nyid kyi don gyis so //
translated: It is because that very expression of speech itself acts as an obstruction, in the sense of being an obstacle.

original: gal te bstan bcos kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de yang bstan bcos la gags byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de yang bstan bcos la gags byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If even the treatise is not valid cognition, then that too would be an obstruction to the treatise.

original: gzhi yod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhi yod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, he says when there is an existent basis... and so on.

original: bstan bcos kyis so sor gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis so sor gzhag pa yin na /
translated: If it is posited by the treatise,üîΩthen it is not established by valid cognition.

original: bstan bcos de la gnod pa byas na des gzhag pa'i chos can yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnod par byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bstan bcos de la gnod pa byas na des gzhag pa'i chos can yang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnod par byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: If one damages that treatise, then the subject matter that it sets forth is also refuted, and therefore it is called ‚Äúdamaging.‚Äù

original: gal te bstan bcos de dam bca' ba tsam yin pa'i phyir de ltar tshad ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos de dam bca' ba tsam yin pa'i phyir de ltar tshad ma yin na'o //
translated: If that treatise is only an assertion, then it is a valid cognition in that way.

original: bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rang gi tshig dag khas blangs pas tshad mar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rang gi tshig dag khas blangs pas tshad mar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference, because the words of the treatise are accepted as being similar in being valid cognitions.

original: chos can 'gogs par byed pa de'i phyir bstan bcos dang chos su 'gal ba dag ni gegs zhes bya ba the tshom du byed pa ma yin gyi gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos can 'gogs par byed pa de'i phyir bstan bcos dang chos su 'gal ba dag ni gegs zhes bya ba the tshom du byed pa ma yin gyi gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: Because it refutes the subject matter, a contradiction with the treatise and the subject matter is called ‚Äúobstructive,‚Äù which creates doubt, but it is not damaging.

original: chos can 'gog par byed pa yin no //üîΩsngar khas blangs pa la phyi ma gzhan gyis gnod pa ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba slob dpon phyogs @246a * //
analyzed: chos can 'gog par byed pa yin no // sngar khas blangs pa la phyi ma gzhan gyis gnod pa ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'o zhes bya ba slob dpon phyogs @246a * //
translated: It is a refutation of the subject matter.

original: kyi glang pos gsungs so //
analyzed: kyi glang pos gsungs so //
translated: The master DignƒÅga says, ‚ÄúThe later contradicts the former that was asserted,‚Äù and that is a contradiction with the treatise.

original: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na gags kyang ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag tshad ma ma yin pa de bas na gags kyang ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If the treatise and its words are not valid cognitions, then how can they be refutations?

original: de stobs mtshungs te /
analyzed: de stobs mtshungs te /
translated: They are equal in strength.

original: gnyi ga yang rigs pas stong pa'i khas blangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rigs pas stong pa'i khas blangs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both are mere assertions that are empty of reason.

original: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshi ga de dag gang la tshad mar yod par gyur na ni rang gi don grub pa nyid yin pas de dang 'gal ba tshang ma med pa de tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gags ma yin to /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshi ga de dag gang la tshad mar yod par gyur na ni rang gi don grub pa nyid yin pas de dang 'gal ba tshang ma med pa de tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gags ma yin to /
translated: If the treatise and its words were valid cognitions for someone, then since they would have already established their own purpose, the absence of a contradiction with that would not be a valid refutation.

original: tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a valid cognition contradicts an invalid cognition.

original: gal te tshad ma med pa'i bstan bcos dang tshig dag kyang rgol ba des tshang mar khas blangs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pas rang dang 'gal ba'i dngos po thams cad la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma med pa'i bstan bcos dang tshig dag kyang rgol ba des tshang mar khas blangs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pas rang dang 'gal ba'i dngos po thams cad la gnod par byed pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If the treatise and its words, which are not valid cognitions, are accepted by the opponent as valid cognitions, then since they are not valid cognitions, they would contradict all things.

original: gang khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang khas blangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you say that they are refutations, then what is the point of saying ‚Äúbecause they are accepted‚Äù?

original: ci zhig yin te cir mi rung ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci zhig yin te cir mi rung ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is it? What is it not? There is no difference.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam ste /
translated: It is merely the desire of a person.

original: dngos po la mi ltos pa khas blangs pas tshad mar byas nas gnod pa byed par gzhan yang yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: dngos po la mi ltos pa khas blangs pas tshad mar byas nas gnod pa byed par gzhan yang yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshad ma ste /
translated: Since it is accepted that it does not depend on an object, it is a valid cognition that is made into a valid cognition and then harms.üîΩMoreover, it is a complete valid cognition,

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'o zhes bzhad gad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'o zhes bzhad gad du bya ba'o //
translated: a valid cognition with a complete definition.

original: the tshom za ba'i de phyogs kha na ma tho ba med pa la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i de phyogs kha na ma tho ba med pa la yang mtshungs te /
translated: It is the same for a faultless position that is doubted,

original: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don la the tshom yod kyi des pa ni ma yin /
analyzed: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don la the tshom yod kyi des pa ni ma yin /
translated: because there is doubt about the object of proof, not about the position.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that itself‚Äù means by the mere indication of the position.

original: nges pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: Certainty is with regard to the object of proof.

original: 'gal ba'i skyon dang ldan par smra ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i skyon dang ldan par smra ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like stating something that has the fault of contradiction.

original: gal te de ltar na de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de ci'i phyir /
translated: If it is like that, why is it so?

original: de ltar the tshom du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar the tshom du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is there doubt in that way?

original: gang rtags kyi mchan nyid gsum smra ba'i tshig ji tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par nus pa de phyogs kyi tshig gis mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rtags kyi mchan nyid gsum smra ba'i tshig ji tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par nus pa de phyogs kyi tshig gis mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of the proposition are not able to prove the probandum, to the extent that the words of the reason are able to prove it.

original: the tshom za ba yin gyi /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yin gyi /
translated: There is doubt,

original: bsal ba bzhin du mi srid par ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsal ba bzhin du mi srid par ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but it is not shown that it is impossible, as in the case of a negation.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir srid pa'i bsam ba med pa dam bca'i tshig gis rab tu ston pas na khyad par yod do //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir srid pa'i bsam ba med pa dam bca'i tshig gis rab tu ston pas na khyad par yod do //
translated: There is a difference, because the words of the proposition show that it is possible, since there is no contradiction, although there is no intention to prove that it is possible.

original: mi srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is impossible?

original: tshad ma ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ste /
translated: It is that which is contradicted by a valid cognition.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis gnod na mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis gnod na mi srid pa yin no //
translated: If it is contradicted by direct perception or inference, it is impossible.

original: gal te khas blangs pa dang rang gi tshig dag ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges 'gal yang srid pas phyogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa dang rang gi tshig dag ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges 'gal yang srid pas phyogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the proposition is a position because it is possible that there is a contradiction, since the assertion and one's own words are not valid cognitions,

original: de bzhin du stobs mtshungs pas chos can gcig la chos gnyis @246b sbyar ba yang mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs mtshungs pas chos can gcig la chos gnyis @246b sbyar ba yang mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: then in the same way, it is impossible for two properties to be connected to one basis, since they are equal in strength.

original: gal te khas blangs ba dang rang gi tshig dag 'gal ba sbyar ba ni smra ba'i skyon nyid yin gyi dngos po la ni ma yin pas de spyad pas ci zhig dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs ba dang rang gi tshig dag 'gal ba sbyar ba ni smra ba'i skyon nyid yin gyi dngos po la ni ma yin pas de spyad pas ci zhig dgos she na /
translated: If you object, ‚ÄúIt is a fault of the speaker to contradict his own words, but not a fault of the thing itself. What need is there to consider that?‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFor the sake of others.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis khong du chud pa la dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khong du chud pa la dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is necessary for the sake of others‚Äô understanding.

original: gal te smra ba po'i skyon yang gzhan la ci gnod ce na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba po'i skyon yang gzhan la ci gnod ce na /
translated: If you object, ‚ÄúWhat harm is there in the speaker‚Äôs fault for others?‚Äù

original: smra ba po'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa gzhan ma rtogs par 'dod pa dag the tshom skyes pas tho 'tshams pa'i phyir smra ba po'i yon tan yang dpyad par bya ste smra ba de nyid gzhan gyis rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: smra ba po'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa gzhan ma rtogs par 'dod pa dag the tshom skyes pas tho 'tshams pa'i phyir smra ba po'i yon tan yang dpyad par bya ste smra ba de nyid gzhan gyis rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir
translated: We reply, ‚ÄúSince those who do not understand the speaker‚Äôs meaning as it is will be confused and will be harmed by the arising of doubt, the speaker‚Äôs good qualities should be examined, because that speech is the cause of others‚Äô understanding and so forth.‚ÄùüîΩIf there is not even the slightest difference,

original: ro // bye brag cung zad kyang med na zhes bya ba ni sngar khas blangs pa bye brag med kyang ji ltar gcig tshad ma dang zhes smras pas so //
analyzed: ro // bye brag cung zad kyang med na zhes bya ba ni sngar khas blangs pa bye brag med kyang ji ltar gcig tshad ma dang zhes smras pas so //
translated: as you have previously accepted, then how can you say that one is valid knowledge and the other not?

original: grub pa'i mtha' la ma brten par dpyod pa rab tu mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su 'jug par mi nus pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la ma brten par dpyod pa rab tu mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su 'jug par mi nus pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwithout relying on tenets, analysis does not occur‚Äù refers to objects that cannot be engaged by direct perception or inference.

original: thams cad la yin par brjod do zhes bya ba ni khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yin par brjod do zhes bya ba ni khas blangs par mtshungs pa'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is said to be in all cases‚Äù means that even contradictions with treatises that are similar to contradictions with what one asserts are contradictions with one‚Äôs own words.

original: gal te bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni pha rol gyis smras pa dang 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni pha rol gyis smras pa dang 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it the case that contradictions with treatises are contradictions with what is said by others?‚Äù

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba 'di la yang rgyu cis na des par pha rol gyis khas blangs ba kho na'o zhes bya ba la rten /üîΩ'di ltar bstan bcos khas len pa'i skyes bus de nyid bstan bcos de'i don te gzhan gyi kha nas te /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba 'di la yang rgyu cis na des par pha rol gyis khas blangs ba kho na'o zhes bya ba la rten / 'di ltar bstan bcos khas len pa'i skyes bus de nyid bstan bcos de'i don te gzhan gyi kha nas te /
translated: Why do you definitely rely on the fact that contradictions with treatises are contradictions with what others assert?üîΩThis is because the person who asserts the treatise determines that that is the meaning of the treatise.

original: bstan bcos byed pa 'di skad zer ro zhes gzhan yang de bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir don de rang gi yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa 'di skad zer ro zhes gzhan yang de bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir don de rang gi yin la /
translated: The treatise author says, ‚ÄúOthers say this,‚Äù and others also assert that to be the case. Therefore that meaning is one‚Äôs own.

original: yang de dang 'gal bar smra ba yin na /
analyzed: yang de dang 'gal bar smra ba yin na /
translated: If one speaks in contradiction to that,

original: don de nyid kun du slong bar byed de /
analyzed: don de nyid kun du slong bar byed de /
translated: one is raising up that very matter,

original: mi gnas par byed pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi gnas par byed pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: because one is not abiding in it.

original: grags pa dang 'gal bar byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: grags pa dang 'gal bar byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is there contradiction with what is well known?

original: 'dod pa dang 'brel ba'i don de rnam par rtog pa'i yul du gyur ba don rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'brel ba'i don de rnam par rtog pa'i yul du gyur ba don rnams la'o //
translated: In regard to the matter that is the object of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i sgra zhes bya ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra zhes bya ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid do //
translated: the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is the object of conceptual thought.

original: de'i ste sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin ba ste /
analyzed: de'i ste sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid yin ba ste /
translated: That is to say, it is the object of expression of that word.

original: des de rtogs par nus pa la'o //
analyzed: des de rtogs par nus pa la'o //
translated: It is in regard to that which is able to understand it.üîΩIt is not the object of expression of that, because of the thesis.

original: de'i brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bcas pas brjod par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de'i brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bcas pas brjod par mi nus pa ste /
translated: One is not able to express it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba la des gnod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba la des gnod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thesis is undermined by that.

original: grags pa'o zhes bya ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grags pa'o zhes bya ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad las skyes pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚Äúarisen from convention.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyis den gyi chos te grags @247a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyis den gyi chos te grags @247a * //
translated: The object of conceptual thought is the matter that is well known.

original: pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated to eliminate the notion that the object of a word is a real entity.

original: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i dngos po'i yul gyi don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i dngos po'i yul gyi don to //
translated: The object of a word is a thing that is known to have a variety of natures.

original: byas dang ma byas pa'i brda grub pa dang ma grub pa'o //üîΩ'dod pa tsam gyis brda 'jug par rung ba yin te /
analyzed: byas dang ma byas pa'i brda grub pa dang ma grub pa'o // 'dod pa tsam gyis brda 'jug par rung ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúestablished‚Äù means ‚Äúknown,‚Äù and ‚Äúnot established‚Äù means ‚Äúnot known.‚ÄùüîΩA word is applied to an object merely by desire,

original: brda ni 'dod pa la brten pas so //
analyzed: brda ni 'dod pa la brten pas so //
translated: because the application of a word depends on desire.

original: des zhes bya ba ni 'jug par rung ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni 'jug par rung ba nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the mere fact of being applicable.

original: don tsam zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rdzas nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don tsam zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rdzas nges pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely the object‚Äù means that there is no restriction of place, time, or substance.

original: de'i phyir rung ba de ni don thams cad dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba de ni don thams cad dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is applicable has a nature that is related to all objects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra dag gis te dus mi mtshungs pa'i sgra dag gis kyang brjod par rung ba de dang 'gal bar byed pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bca' bas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'das ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i sgra dag gis te dus mi mtshungs pa'i sgra dag gis kyang brjod par rung ba de dang 'gal bar byed pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes dam bca' bas so //
translated: For this very reason, the words ‚Äúpast‚Äù and ‚Äúfuture‚Äù are applicable, and the words ‚Äúpresent‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù are not applicable.

original: gal te sgra gang dag brdar ma byas pa'i rung ba nyid dag gis don rtogs par mi byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra gang dag brdar ma byas pa'i rung ba nyid dag gis don rtogs par mi byed pa yin nam /
translated: If it is said that words that are not suitable for use as signs do not express meaning,

original: ji ltar de dag 'gal ba ma grags pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag 'gal ba ma grags pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: then why are they called ‚Äúcontradictory‚Äù and ‚Äúnot well known to be contradictory‚Äù?

original: sgra thams cad don 'di dag dang 'brel to zhes dngos su grags pa ste ;
analyzed: sgra thams cad don 'di dag dang 'brel to zhes dngos su grags pa ste ;
translated: It is well known that all words are related to these meanings.

original: brda grub pa med mod kyi 'on kyang grags par rung ba'i stobs nyid kyis kyang ste /
analyzed: brda grub pa med mod kyi 'on kyang grags par rung ba'i stobs nyid kyis kyang ste /
translated: Although the establishment of signs does not exist, still, by the power of being suitable to be known,

original: brdar byas pa nyi tsher ma zad par don der sgra de rab tu grags pa nyid du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs te /
analyzed: brdar byas pa nyi tsher ma zad par don der sgra de rab tu grags pa nyid du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs te /
translated: the master Dignaga says that those words are well known to be the meaning, not just used as signs.

original: ji skad du gang la yang thun mong ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ri bong can zla ba'i sgras brjed par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du gang la yang thun mong ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ri bong can zla ba'i sgras brjed par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: As he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not shared with others,‚Äù the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù does not refer to a rabbit.

original: yod pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes gzhan dag rung ba nyid la gnod pa smras te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes gzhan dag rung ba nyid la gnod pa smras te /
translated: Because it exists, it is like a pot. Others say that it is contradictory to be suitable.

original: de ni bum pa yang zla ba'i sgras brjod par rung ba nyid du yod pa 'gal ba ma grub the tshom za ba'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang bas thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas na rjes su dpag pa med do //
analyzed: de ni bum pa yang zla ba'i sgras brjod par rung ba nyid du yod pa 'gal ba ma grub the tshom za ba'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba ma tshang bas thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas na rjes su dpag pa med do //
translated: The example is incomplete with respect to the probandum, because it is not common to both. Therefore there is no inference.

original: sgra rab tu grags pa da ltar med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag rab tu grags pa mi 'gal ba'i don gyis bsal te nges gnod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra rab tu grags pa da ltar med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag rab tu grags pa mi 'gal ba'i don gyis bsal te nges gnod pa'o //
translated: Although the well-known sound does not exist in the present, it is not contradictory that the well-known past and future exist. This is the meaning of the refutation.

original: de'i phyir ma grags pa ni rung ba dang 'gal ba yang phyogs ma yin par gsungs pa'i phyir rung ba 'gal ba yang grags pa dang 'gal ba nyid do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir ma grags pa ni rung ba dang 'gal ba yang phyogs ma yin par gsungs pa'i phyir rung ba 'gal ba yang grags pa dang 'gal ba nyid do ;
translated: Therefore, because it is said that what is not well known and what is contradictory with what is suitable is not a subject, what is contradictory with what is suitable is also contradictory with what is well known.

original: / bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la rung ba nyid dag srid pas na gang la yang zla ba'i sgra'i don ma yin par ma grub pa'i dpe ma grub pas so //
analyzed: / bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa thams cad la rung ba nyid dag srid pas na gang la yang zla ba'i sgra'i don ma yin par ma grub pa'i dpe ma grub pas so //
translated: Since it is possible that everything, such as a pot or a cloth, is suitable, it is not established that anything is not the meaning of the word moon. The example is not established.

original: 'di dgag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di dgag par mi nus te /
translated: This cannot be refuted.

original: gnod pa can thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid rab tu grags pa ni mi 'gal @247b ba zhes de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: gnod pa can thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid rab tu grags pa ni mi 'gal @247b ba zhes de skad gsungs so //
translated: Because it is a unique harm, the unique is well known as non-contradictory, so it is said.

original: de la 'gog par byed pa'i tshad ma med par nges pa yang yin te rung ba nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'gog par byed pa'i tshad ma med par nges pa yang yin te rung ba nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is certainty that there is no valid cognition to refute it, because suitability is established by valid cognition.

original: de ltar na yod pa nyid kyang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa nyid kyang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, existence itself is contradictory.

original: rung ba nyid mi nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gsum pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid mi nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gsum pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suitability is uncertain, it is because of the three times.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni yod pa las lhag par 'jug pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir yod pas ma rnyed na de dag gis mthun pa'i phyogs rnyed par mi 'gyur ba'i dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i yod pa nyid dper byas
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni yod pa las lhag par 'jug pa'i dngos po ni med pa'i phyir yod pas ma rnyed na de dag gis mthun pa'i phyogs rnyed par mi 'gyur ba'i dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba'i yod pa nyid dper byas
translated: And all reasons, because there is no entity that engages beyond existence, when existence is not found by them, the concordant side is not found. The example is the result, so existence is exemplified.

original: pa'i'o // sngar rung ba nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa'i tshad ma de 'di yin te ;
analyzed: pa'i'o // sngar rung ba nyid tshad mas grub pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa'i tshad ma de 'di yin te ;
translated: The proof by means of a validating cognition that sound is suitable to be a symbol has already been explained.

original: sgra'i brdal yang dag par brten la brda de ni 'dod pa tsam la yang dag par brten pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra'i brdal yang dag par brten la brda de ni 'dod pa tsam la yang dag par brten pa'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The symbol is not unestablished because it is based on mere desire.

original: sgra'i tha snyad du zhes bya ba'i sgra yis brjod par rung ba nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad du zhes bya ba'i sgra yis brjod par rung ba nyid du grub ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúconventionally‚Äù in the verse indicates that sound is suitable to be expressed.

original: 'dod pa ni thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because desire operates in all cases.

original: de'i gang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa de ni brdar byas te brjod par rung ba yin te zla bas ga pur bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa de ni brdar byas te brjod par rung ba yin te zla bas ga pur bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is the object of conceptualization is a symbol, and is suitable to be expressed, like the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù for the moon.

original: ri bong can yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: ri bong can yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúrabbit‚Äù is also the object of conceptualization, because it is a word.

original: de lta bas na sgra rab tu grags pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra rab tu grags pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that sound is well known.

original: gal te brjod par rung ba la gags byed pa de gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid par yin gnyis za na the tshom can du gyur pa'i phyir rung bar mi 'grub na gags kyang mi snang ste /
analyzed: gal te brjod par rung ba la gags byed pa de gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma srid par yin gnyis za na the tshom can du gyur pa'i phyir rung bar mi 'grub na gags kyang mi snang ste /
translated: But even if there is no contradiction, it is not suitable to say that the object is suitable for all people, because it is not seen for a long time.

original: 'di ltar yun ring du ma mthong bar don rnams te sngon ma rtogs pa'i don rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yun ring du ma mthong bar don rnams te sngon ma rtogs pa'i don rnams la'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that previously unknown objects are not seen.

original: phyis bye brag tu rtogs par mthong ba ste nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyis bye brag tu rtogs par mthong ba ste nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Later, one sees the specific realization, that is, the definite realization.

original: de dang sgras yul du byas nas rtogs pa mthong ba srid pa ste mthong na'o //
analyzed: de dang sgras yul du byas nas rtogs pa mthong ba srid pa ste mthong na'o //
translated: If one sees that it is possible to realize the object by means of the word, then one sees that.

original: mthong ba de yod na skyes bu tsam ste skyes bu gang gis kyang rung ba ste med par ma nges te /
analyzed: mthong ba de yod na skyes bu tsam ste skyes bu gang gis kyang rung ba ste med par ma nges te /
translated: If that seeing exists, then it is not ascertained that the object is nonexistent, because it is suitable for any person, that is, for any person.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba kun la rung ba nyid grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba kun la rung ba nyid grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that it is suitable for all, both for those who see and for those who do not see.

original: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi grub par gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi grub par gsungs pa la /
translated: The master DignƒÅga said that the establishment of the reason is by nature.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis tshad mas rung ba nyid du nges par gsungs pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis tshad mas rung ba nyid du nges par gsungs pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the master says that it is ascertained by valid knowledge that it is suitable,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid par don gyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid par don gyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is implicitly taught that it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradictory object of inference.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod na rab tu grub mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod na rab tu grub mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is a valid cognition that contradicts it, it is impossible for it to be well established.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa'i tshad ma med par nges pa yin no //üîΩtshad ma nges pa la @248a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa'i tshad ma med par nges pa yin no // tshad ma nges pa la @248a * //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: gnod pa can mi srid par bshad pa de dag gi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag mtshungs pa nyid du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa can mi srid par bshad pa de dag gi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag mtshungs pa nyid du bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation that it is impossible for there to be a contradiction of a valid cognition that ascertains it is the same as the explanation of the sameness of direct perception and inference.

original: de gnyi ga yang tshad ma nyid yin par bye brag med par tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa byed pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang tshad ma nyid yin par bye brag med par tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa byed pa mi srid do //
translated: Because both of them are valid cognitions, there is no difference in their being valid cognitions. Just as it is impossible for there to be a contradiction of direct perception, it is impossible for there to be a contradiction of inference.

original: gal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de dag kyang ldan du zin kyang gcig tu ste rjes dpag la 'gal zla mthong na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de dag kyang ldan du zin kyang gcig tu ste rjes dpag la 'gal zla mthong na /
translated: Even if they have those characteristics of valid cognition, if one sees the contradictory object of a valid cognition that ascertains it, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de la mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang 'gal zla yod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang 'gal zla yod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is seen, because of the similarity of the characteristics, there is the doubt that even perception has an opposite.

original: gal te bye brag yod na ni bye brag des gcig ste mngon sum grub par byed pa zhes bya bar tshad mar rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: gal te bye brag yod na ni bye brag des gcig ste mngon sum grub par byed pa zhes bya bar tshad mar rnam par gzhag la /
translated: If there is a difference, then by that difference, one is established as a means of valid cognition, called ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: de'i bye brag las phyi rol tu gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i bye brag las phyi rol tu gyur pa ni med do //
translated: And because of that difference, there is nothing that is external.

original: de tsam gyis ni gang dag rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni gang dag rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba /
translated: To the extent that inference is not a means of valid cognition, because error is seen,

original: phur bu pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: phur bu pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin no //
translated: the followers of B·πõhaspati and so on are clear.

original: de ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i lugs dgag pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i lugs dgag pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to refute the system of the NaiyƒÅyikas and so on, it is said, ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa can mi srid de brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can yin pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa can mi srid de brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can yin pas so //
translated: It is not possible that there is an internal contradiction in inference, because it has the single property that is desired to be stated.

original: gtan tshigs la 'gal zla med pa nyid 'di 'dra ba nyid rnam par nges pa yod dam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs la 'gal zla med pa nyid 'di 'dra ba nyid rnam par nges pa yod dam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This very nonexistence of an opposite in the reason is ascertained.

original: med na mi 'byung ba khas mi len na nges par mi nus so snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba khas mi len na nges par mi nus so snyam du dgongs so //
translated: If one does not accept the invariable concomitance, one cannot be certain.

original: mtshan nyid khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i rang bzhin du mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout a difference in their characteristics‚Äù means that they are similar in not having an invariable concomitance.

original: de 'dra ba las 'gal zla'i gtan tshigs mthong ba dang 'dra ba gzhan la yang 'gal zla ldog par nges par byas par mi nus so zhes 'das ma thag par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba las 'gal zla'i gtan tshigs mthong ba dang 'dra ba gzhan la yang 'gal zla ldog par nges par byas par mi nus so zhes 'das ma thag par bshad zin to //
translated: As was just explained, one cannot be certain that the negation of the counter-positive is established in other cases, just as one sees a reason that is the counter-positive of the similar instance.

original: gal te gnod pa can ma mthong ba dag brjod par 'dod pa ni grangs gcig pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa can ma mthong ba dag brjod par 'dod pa ni grangs gcig pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says that the one that is not seen by the refuting evidence is the one that is intended to be expressed, then it would be the one that has a single instance.

original: skyes bu'i rtogs pa'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtogs pa'i bye brag las te /
translated: It is due to the specific realization of a person.

original: dngos po rtag pa btang bas so //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa btang bas so //
translated: It is due to the abandonment of the permanence of things.

original: dngos po de yang de ltar nges par bya ba nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po de yang de ltar nges par bya ba nus pa ma yin te /
translated: That thing also cannot be ascertained in that way.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gal ba med pa'i don dag lhan cig pa dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'gal ba med pa'i don dag lhan cig pa dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one cannot negate the simultaneity of things that are not seen to be contradictory merely by not seeing them.

original: gal te mthong na med par nges pa ma yin yang rtags su sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong na med par nges pa ma yin yang rtags su sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: If you see it, you do not ascertain its nonexistence, but you do apply the reason.

original: de'i mtshan nyid la ste rtags kyi mtshan nyid gnod par byed pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la ste rtags kyi mtshan nyid gnod par byed pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: In the definition of that, i.e., in the definition of the reason, there is the absence of a refutation.

original: gal te nges par ma shes kyang dngos po la gnod pa med pa nyid kyang srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nges par ma shes kyang dngos po la gnod pa med pa nyid kyang srid do zhe na /
translated: Even if you do not ascertain it, it is possible that there is no refutation of the thing.

original: shes pa nyid kyang ste tshad @248b mas rtags kyi mtshan nyid nges pa nyid kyang rtags kyi mtshan nyid du thams cad kyis smos so //
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyang ste tshad @248b mas rtags kyi mtshan nyid nges pa nyid kyang rtags kyi mtshan nyid du thams cad kyis smos so //
translated: Even if you do not know it, the definition of the reason is ascertained by the valid cognition.

original: gal te khyod la yang 'gal zla med pa nyid ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te khyod la yang 'gal zla med pa nyid ji ltar nges she na /
translated: If you ask, How do you ascertain the absence of a contradictory reason?

original: sngar smos pa'i mtshan nyid de med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngar smos pa'i mtshan nyid de med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the absence of the previously mentioned definition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can de yang med na mi 'byung ba can 'di'i yul la mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can de yang med na mi 'byung ba can 'di'i yul la mi 'dod do //
translated: For that very reason, we do not accept that the single number of the thing to be expressed is the domain of that absence of a contradictory reason.

original: 'o na gang la 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la 'dod ce na /
translated: If you ask, Where do we accept it?

original: 'di'i yul yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The domain of that will be explained later.

original: dngos po'i stobs la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid pa de'i phyir 'di ltar slob dpon gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar bshad ba na de la gtan tshigs kyi rten du mi srid pas na de
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid pa de'i phyir 'di ltar slob dpon gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis phyogs la gnod par byed pa'i tshad mar bshad ba na de la gtan tshigs kyi rten du mi srid pas na de
translated: Because it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradiction of the power of things, the master has explained that direct perception and inference are valid cognitions that contradict the position.

original: la rjes su dpag pa mi srid par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: la rjes su dpag pa mi srid par bshad pa yin la /
translated: Since it is impossible for them to be the basis of a reason, he explains that inference is impossible.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa srid na gnod par byed par nges pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa srid na gnod par byed par nges pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If inference were possible, he would have said that it is definitely contradictory.

original: yang na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi brjod pa ste /
translated: Or, because of being uncommon, it is worldly expression.

original: tha snyad kyi dngos por brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni med do zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dngos por brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni med do zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master says that inference is not something that is to be expressed as a conventional thing.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don la rjes su dpag pas brjod par bsgrub kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po la ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don la rjes su dpag pas brjod par bsgrub kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po la ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, inference is said to establish the object that appears to thought, but not an external thing.

original: yul tha dad pa can ni rjes su dpag pa ni phyi'i dngos po la gnod par byed la grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa can ni rjes su dpag pa ni phyi'i dngos po la gnod par byed la grags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The object of the inference is external things, while the object of the popular idea is the conceptual image.

original: dngos po la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: dngos po la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar med ce na /
translated: How is it that inference does not exist in regard to entities?

original: ri bong can gyis zla ba dngos por brjod par mi 'dod na ming du grags pa gang yang dngos por brjod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ri bong can gyis zla ba dngos su brjod de yod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod na dpe de
analyzed: ri bong can gyis zla ba dngos por brjod par mi 'dod na ming du grags pa gang yang dngos por brjod par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ri bong can gyis zla ba dngos su brjod de yod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod na dpe de
translated: If the moon of the hare is not accepted as an entity, then the popular idea of the moon of the hare is not accepted as an entity.

original: yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example is not established.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yang thun mong ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yang thun mong ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether the conceptual image is not also uncommon,

original: 'dir yang ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang ste /
translated: it is so here.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba la'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba la'o //
translated: It is said that it is only possible to express it because it is the object of conceptual thought.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not uncommon.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du ni ga pur la sogs pa zla ba'i sgras brjod par grub pa mthong ba'i phyir dper grub pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du ni ga pur la sogs pa zla ba'i sgras brjod par grub pa mthong ba'i phyir dper grub pas so //
translated: It is established by example, because it is seen that camphor and so on are established as the referents of the word moon.

original: de'i phyir brda'i stobs kyis 'jug pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brda'i stobs kyis 'jug pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWhen it is used by the power of convention.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is not a thing, why?

original: gal te sgra de'i don 'ga' zhig tu nges par grub na de'i @249a * //
analyzed: gal te sgra de'i don 'ga' zhig tu nges par grub na de'i @249a * //
translated: If the referent of that word is established as any thing,

original: don dngos pos grub pa yin gyi dngos po dag la mi ltos na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dngos pos grub pa yin gyi dngos po dag la mi ltos na ni ma yin no //
translated: its referent is established by a thing, not by not relying on things.

original: gal te sgra'i don grags pas grub par khas len na ri bong can la yang sgra'i don du 'gal ba byed pa med de grags pa yin pa'i phyir ga pur la sogs pa zla ba'i sgra'i don yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te sgra'i don grags pas grub par khas len na ri bong can la yang sgra'i don du 'gal ba byed pa med de grags pa yin pa'i phyir ga pur la sogs pa zla ba'i sgra'i don yin pa bzhin no //
translated: If one accepts that the referent of a word is established by usage, then even the rabbit-bearer is not contradicted as the referent of the word, because it is used. Like camphor and so on being the referent of the word moon.

original: gal te ga bur la sogs pa ni yid dga' bar byed pa dang / bsil ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir zla ba'i sgras brjod par byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ga bur la sogs pa ni yid dga' bar byed pa dang / bsil ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir zla ba'i sgras brjod par byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that camphor and so on are expressed by the word moon because they delight the mind and have the quality of coolness,

original: de zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩga pur de lus bsil bar byed pa'i dngos pos zla ba'i sgras brjod par grub na ni ri bong can lus bsil bar byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos pos zla ba'i sgras brjod pa med na ni ri bong can la yang dngos su brjod pa la gags byed
analyzed: de zhes bya ba smos te / ga pur de lus bsil bar byed pa'i dngos pos zla ba'i sgras brjod par grub na ni ri bong can lus bsil bar byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos pos zla ba'i sgras brjod pa med na ni ri bong can la yang dngos su brjod pa la gags byed
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers toüîΩcamphor. If it is established that the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù expresses camphor by means of the property of cooling the body, then there is no expression of the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù by means of the property of cooling the body of the hare.

original: kyang 'dod pa'i phyir skyon cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: kyang 'dod pa'i phyir skyon cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But since it is accepted that the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù directly expresses the hare, there is not the slightest fault.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni grags pa 'di la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni grags pa 'di la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúHere also‚Äù means ‚Äúin this case of popular convention.‚Äù

original: brjod par nus pa de dag 'gog pa la 'gal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par nus pa de dag 'gog pa la 'gal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It would be contradictory to refute that which can be expressed.

original: phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed par bshad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained that it would be a proof of the opposite.

original: snga ma rnams nyi tsher ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma rnams nyi tsher ma zad pa'o //
translated: It is not only the former that are limited.

original: sgra don rgyu mchan can dang ni zhes bya ba ni lus bsil bar byed pa'i phyir zla ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra don rgyu mchan can dang ni zhes bya ba ni lus bsil bar byed pa'i phyir zla ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word and its meaning are related as cause and effect‚Äù means, for example, ‚Äúthe moon is called that because it cools the body.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i sgra dag 'gog par byed ba ste lus bsil bar byed pa med pa'i phyir zla bar mi brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgra dag 'gog par byed ba ste lus bsil bar byed pa med pa'i phyir zla bar mi brjod do zhe na /
translated: It is not called moon because there is no cooling of the body by such sounds.

original: 'gal ba med de mi 'dod pa med do zhes des de slob dpon gyis mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba med de mi 'dod pa med do zhes des de slob dpon gyis mdzad pa'o //
translated: There is no contradiction, because the master does not say there is no undesirable.

original: yang na gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: yang na gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: Or, it is by the reason explained above.

original: don dam don can ni dngos su sgra'i don yin pa can te /
analyzed: don dam don can ni dngos su sgra'i don yin pa can te /
translated: The ultimate meaning is that which is directly the meaning of the word.

original: de yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: And that is also like that.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas bsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas bsal ba bzhin no //
translated: As before means as removed by inference.

original: grags pas bsal pa'i bye brag dag skyon med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: grags pas bsal pa'i bye brag dag skyon med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the distinctions removed by renown are faultless,

original: mngon sum gyis bsal ba yang dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsal ba yang dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in the same way, in order to teach the divisions of what is removed by perception,

original: mngon sum gyis gsal ba yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gsal ba yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says what is removed by perception is also.

original: mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs dang las dang yon tan dag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs dang las dang yon tan dag go //
translated: The various characteristics are the types, actions, and qualities.

original: 'brel pa gzhan med pa ni rigs la sogs pa rnams dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa ste dngos po nyid rigs la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan med pa ni rigs la sogs pa rnams dngos por gyur pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa ste dngos po nyid rigs la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no other relation, there is non-duality, because there is no relation of the real to the universals, etc.

original: chos dang chos can gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: There is non-duality of the property and the object possessing the property,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis so sor snang ba ni chos dang chos can tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis so sor snang ba ni chos dang chos can tha dad pa'o //
translated: because the various appearances are different properties and objects possessing the properties.

original: blos mi mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: blos mi mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: The non-perception by the intellect is by direct perception.

original: de'i @249b phyir mi mthong ba de dag bkag kyang des bsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i @249b phyir mi mthong ba de dag bkag kyang des bsal ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though that non-perception is refuted, it is not thereby eliminated,

original: de la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear in that.

original: de nyid 'gog na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'gog na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la snang ba'o //
translated: If that is refuted, it appears in direct perception.

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don de bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don de bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that purpose, because the meaning grasped by direct perception is specified.

original: lhag ma ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byas pa'i bye brag dag yin gyi dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi yin te rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byas pa'i bye brag dag yin gyi dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spyi yin te rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin gyi dbang po'i blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: The particularities that are understood are universals because they are not the nature of a real entity, they are the object of conceptual cognition, and not the domain of the cognition of the senses.üîΩThat is the definition of the particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni rnam pa kun du sgras brjod min phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni rnam pa kun du sgras brjod min phyir /
translated: Because it is never expressed by words,

original: sgra'i yul dang 'gal bar byas kyang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no ;
analyzed: sgra'i yul dang 'gal bar byas kyang mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no ;
translated: it is the object of direct perception, even though it is made to conflict with the domain of words.

original: / ldog pa de dag kyang dngos po de la brten nas grub pa ste rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / ldog pa de dag kyang dngos po de la brten nas grub pa ste rtogs pa'o //
translated: And those exclusions are established, that is, understood, in dependence on that real entity.

original: de'i stobs de dngos po'i stobs kyis brjod de /
analyzed: de'i stobs de dngos po'i stobs kyis brjod de /
translated: They are expressed by the power of that, the power of the real entity.

original: dngos po'i mnyan par byed pas dbang po'i spyod yul du gnas kyi rigs la sogs pa dbye bas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhan cig 'dug kyang mi 'jig pa ste ;
analyzed: dngos po'i mnyan par byed pas dbang po'i spyod yul du gnas kyi rigs la sogs pa dbye bas ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // lhan cig 'dug kyang mi 'jig pa ste ;
translated: Because they are made by the power of the real entity, they remain within the domain of the senses, but not by the division of class and so on.üîΩIt is not destroyed even when it coexists.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'dug kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'dug kyang ngo //
translated: Even when it coexists with the cause of its destruction.

original: bum pa zhig pa de la yang bsal ba ste de snang ba las so //
analyzed: bum pa zhig pa de la yang bsal ba ste de snang ba las so //
translated: The destruction of the pot is also a non-entity, that is, it is not perceived.

original: mi snang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: It is not perceived because it is not manifest,

original: gtso bo'i rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhig gi snyam du sems par zad pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhig gi snyam du sems par zad pa ste /
translated: because it is in a state of being the nature of the principal.

original: de ni grangs can dag gi lus so //
analyzed: de ni grangs can dag gi lus so //
translated: This is the body of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: mi gnas pa ste gsal bar mi gnas pa de nyid la mi rtag pa nyid du smra ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa ste gsal bar mi gnas pa de nyid la mi rtag pa nyid du smra ste /
translated: It is not permanent, that is, it is not manifest, and it is said to be impermanent.

original: 'gal ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: rtag pa yang de kho na bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o zhes rim pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: rtag pa yang de kho na bzhin du gnas pa la bya'o zhes rim pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Permanence should be understood in the same way as it is stated.

original: rgyus de zhig ba la yod na ni zhig pa'am mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'di la khyod dang kho bo dag gis zhe na ngar mi bya ba ste don de kho na ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyus de zhig ba la yod na ni zhig pa'am mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'di la khyod dang kho bo dag gis zhe na ngar mi bya ba ste don de kho na ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the cause exists in its destruction, then the name ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù or ‚Äúunmanifest‚Äù is not to be accepted by you or me, because that object exists in just that way.

original: tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa la gnod de zhes bya ni grangs can bdag nyid rdul dang mun pa snying stobs dang shes pa can rnams la'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa la gnod de zhes bya ni grangs can bdag nyid rdul dang mun pa snying stobs dang shes pa can rnams la'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya who asserts that the self, which is endowed with consciousness, is made of the three qualities of passion, darkness, and purity is harmed in his presentation of the meaning of the words.

original: sems pa yod pa ni sems can de bdag gis de dag phan tshun tha dad par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: sems pa yod pa ni sems can de bdag gis de dag phan tshun tha dad par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If the existence of consciousness is the sentient being, and if the self is asserted to be different from that,

original: mi dmigs kyang de la de yod na rdul la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid bye brag ste phan tshun stongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs kyang de la de yod na rdul la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid bye brag ste phan tshun stongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even if it is not observed, if it exists, then particles and so on would also exist, and therefore their characteristics would not be mutually exclusive.

original: de dag phan tshun med pa de sgrub na mi dmigs pa ma rtogs pa sgrub pa'i rkyen 'ga' yang med de dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa kho nas yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta @250a * //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun med pa de sgrub na mi dmigs pa ma rtogs pa sgrub pa'i rkyen 'ga' yang med de dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa kho nas yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta @250a * //
translated: If one proves that they are mutually exclusive, there is no reason to prove that nonobservation does not exist, because negation is only nonobservation.

original: bas na rdul la sogs pa gcig la gcig med par sgrub pa na rdul gyi mtshan nyid ni yang ba dang 'gal ba /
analyzed: bas na rdul la sogs pa gcig la gcig med par sgrub pa na rdul gyi mtshan nyid ni yang ba dang 'gal ba /
translated: Therefore, when proving that particles and so on are mutually exclusive, the characteristic of a particle is that it is light and excludes heaviness.

original: mun pa ni lci ba dang snying stobs ni g-yo ba dang srom  pa dag yin la /
analyzed: mun pa ni lci ba dang snying stobs ni g-yo ba dang srom  pa dag yin la /
translated: Darkness is heavy, and purity is mobile and solid.

original: de dag gcig la gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa mi dmigs pas byed de yod na de'i rang bzhin ltar dmigs par 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes so //üîΩde dag dang sems pa yod par yang tha dad pa de dag ni sems ba med par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de dag gcig la gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa mi dmigs pas byed de yod na de'i rang bzhin ltar dmigs par 'gyur ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes so // de dag dang sems pa yod par yang tha dad pa de dag ni sems ba med par 'dod pas so //
translated: They are refuted by the non-apprehension of the nature of one in the other, because if they existed, their nature would be apprehended, as it is in the case of the mind and mental activities.üîΩAnd they are not established as existing separately from the mind, because they are held to be non-existent apart from the mind.

original: de'i bde ba yang mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: de'i bde ba yang mi rigs pas so //
translated: And it is not reasonable that they exist separately from the mind, because it is not reasonable that they exist separately from pleasure.

original: mi dmigs pas dgag pa 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas dgag pa 'grub pa ste /
translated: Refutation is established by non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is why he says, ‚Äúbecause of the characteristic of non-apprehension, etc.

original: de lta bu'i dngos po'i rjes su dpag pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos po'i rjes su dpag pa'i ma yin te /
translated: It is not inferred from such a thing,

original: zho dang myu gu dag ni 'om dang sa bon bzhin du bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zho dang myu gu dag ni 'om dang sa bon bzhin du bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because curd and sprouts are visible, like milk and seeds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te de yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te de yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is why he says, ‚Äúif it exists, etc.

original: bar gyi gnas skabs ni mngon par byung ba'o //
analyzed: bar gyi gnas skabs ni mngon par byung ba'o //
translated: The intermediate state is the emergence.

original: de ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngar yang bar gyi mngon par byung ba'i rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pas mthong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngar yang bar gyi mngon par byung ba'i rang bzhin de nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pas mthong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is by nature unchanging, it is perceived as it was before, since it has the same nature as it did when it was manifest.

original: gal te sngar mi mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngar mi mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not perceived because it has a different characteristic,

original: mi mngon pa'i mtshan nyid nge /
analyzed: mi mngon pa'i mtshan nyid nge /
translated: then it has an invisible characteristic.

original: bar du btang na ni de'i 'jig pa yin no ;
analyzed: bar du btang na ni de'i 'jig pa yin no ;
translated: If it is abandoned in the middle, then it is destroyed.

original: / gal te mtshan nyid zhig kyang bum pa'i rdzas nyid na rtag go zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te mtshan nyid zhig kyang bum pa'i rdzas nyid na rtag go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the substance of the pot is permanent even though its characteristics are destroyed,

original: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid mi mthun pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ci yang med do //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid mi mthun pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ci yang med do //
translated: then its transformation into another substance is a contradiction, and there is nothing else.

original: de ltar snang ba dag 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams gzhan pa nyid du sngar mang du brjod zin to //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba dag 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de rnams gzhan pa nyid du sngar mang du brjod zin to //
translated: Since the appearance of these is contradictory, it has been said many times before that they are different.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i gtan tshigs dang rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu zho de ltar skyes par skyed pa'i rang bzhin 'grub kyi 'bras bu de'i dngos po rgyu la yod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i gtan tshigs dang rgyu 'o ma la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu zho de ltar skyes par skyed pa'i rang bzhin 'grub kyi 'bras bu de'i dngos po rgyu la yod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reason for production and the cause, milk, etc., are established as having the nature of producing that effect, curd. But the entity of the effect is not present in the cause.

original: ri bong gi rva las khyad par gyi bye brag ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva las khyad par gyi bye brag ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the difference between the horn of a rabbit and the cause?

original: 'o ma ni zho de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang ste 'o ma la zho med na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma ni zho de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang ste 'o ma la zho med na yang ngo //
translated: Even though milk is not the self of curd, i.e., even though milk does not exist in curd,

original: gal te 'o ma de'i zho kho na skyed pa'i rang bzhin de las 'ongs she na /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma de'i zho kho na skyed pa'i rang bzhin de las 'ongs she na /
translated: if milk is the nature of producing only that curd, then it comes from that.

original: rang gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúits own cause,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar nus pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i gnas skabs na ni nus pa'i rang bzhin du rgyu la gnas so zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gi yin de dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i gnas skabs na ni nus pa'i rang bzhin du rgyu la gnas so zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gi yin de dpyad pa'o //
translated: What is this potentiality? In the state of non-appearance, the nature of potentiality resides in the cause. This is the view of the Samkhyas.

original: gal @250b te zho de nyid do zhe na /
