analyzed: gal @250b te zho de nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is the same as curd,

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äújust like that,‚Äù etc.

original: khyad par yod na de bzhin du 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'das ma thag tu smras zin to //
analyzed: khyad par yod na de bzhin du 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'das ma thag tu smras zin to //
translated: We have just said that if there is a difference, it will occur in the same way.

original: gal te 'bras bu zho de las nus pa gzhan no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu zho de las nus pa gzhan no zhe na /
translated: If the effect, curd, is different from the cause, milk, then it will be like a bamboo shoot.

original: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: How can it be different?

original: rigs pa de dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag rang bzhin gzhan nyid du rab tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa de dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag rang bzhin gzhan nyid du rab tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: By these reasonings, the states of cause and effect are thoroughly expressed as being different in nature.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang dam bca' ba'i mtshan nyid dag bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid dang dam bca' ba'i mtshan nyid dag bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the definition of inference for others and the definition of a thesis,

original: da ni gtan tshigs bshad par 'dod na phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs bshad par 'dod na phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: now, wishing to explain the reason, he says ‚Äúproperty of the subject.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod med rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod med rnam gnyis te //
translated: There are two types: existent and nonexistent in similar instances.

original: de la yod pa dang med pa dang rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa dang rnam gnyis so //
translated: There are two types: existent and nonexistent.

original: phyogs kyi chos la yang rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la yang rnam gsum ste /
translated: The property of the subject also has three types:

original: de la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'o //
translated: existent, nonexistent, and both.

original: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Likewise, there are three kinds of discordant classes.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang so sor rnam pa gsum zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la yang so sor rnam pa gsum zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The word each is to be supplied with each of the three kinds of classes, concordant, etc.

original: gal te gtan tshigs phyogs kyi chos yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang dam bca' ba dang / phyogs dag ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs phyogs kyi chos yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang dam bca' ba dang / phyogs dag ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the reason is a property of the position, then the probandum, the thesis, and the position are synonyms, and so it would be called the property of the probandum.

original: de ltar na rtags don med de bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rtags don med de bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the sign would be pointless, because the probandum would already be established.

original: ma grub na ni gzhi ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub na ni gzhi ma grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not established, then the basis would not be established.

original: phyogs ni chos can te /
analyzed: phyogs ni chos can te /
translated: The position is the subject.

original: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is designated.

original: sgra'i don dngos la gnod pa yod cing btags pas gnod pa spong pa dang / gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na gdags par byas na /
analyzed: sgra'i don dngos la gnod pa yod cing btags pas gnod pa spong pa dang / gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yod na gdags par byas na /
translated: The meaning of the term is not undermined in reality, and the designation is made to eliminate the fault of designation when there is a reason for designation.

original: 'dir slob dpon dbang phyug sde na re dgos pa med pa'i phyir gdags par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon dbang phyug sde na re dgos pa med pa'i phyir gdags par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Master Ma·πá·∏çana misinterprets this passage, saying that the reason is not stated because it is unnecessary.

original: dgos pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not unnecessary.

original: chos can thams cad kyi chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi dang po'i chos can gyi dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos can gyi chos te /
analyzed: chos can thams cad kyi chos ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi dang po'i chos can gyi dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos can gyi chos te /
translated: The property of all subjects is the property of the subject that is the thesis, the property of the subject that is not the thesis, and the property of the subject that is neither.

original: du ba dang mig gis gzung ba dag dang / kha bzang dkar te khva'i gang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba dang mig gis gzung ba dag dang / kha bzang dkar te khva'i gang pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go rims bzhin no //
translated: These are, respectively, like smoke, the object apprehended by the eye, and the whiteness of the mouth, because the mouth is filled with saliva.

original: de thams cad gtan tshigs yin pa dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yod pas so //
analyzed: de thams cad gtan tshigs yin pa dgag pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yod pas so //
translated: Since all of these are reasons, the purpose is to refute the idea that they are not.

original: dgos pa de yang ji ltar 'grub cen /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs de'i phyogs gcig yin ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa de yang ji ltar 'grub cen / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs de'i phyogs gcig yin ba'i phyir te /
translated: How is that purpose established?üîΩBecause it is one part of the position that is the thesis.

original: chos can yin pa'i phyir phyogs @251a * //
analyzed: chos can yin pa'i phyir phyogs @251a * //
translated: It is a position because it is a subject.

original: zhes spyi nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can de 'dra ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin pas phyogs su gdags su mi rung ba'i chos can dag sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes spyi nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can de 'dra ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin pas phyogs su gdags su mi rung ba'i chos can dag sel bar byed do //
translated: Thus, in order to understand the subject that is suitable to be generally indicated, the subject that is not suitable to be indicated as a position is excluded.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs ma yin pa'i chos can sel ba na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs ma yin pa'i chos can sel ba na'o //
translated: Even so, means when excluding the subject that is not a position.

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de khra'i gnag ba zhes bya ba dag spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de khra'i gnag ba zhes bya ba dag spangs pa yin te /
translated: Because it is apprehended by the eye and so on excludes the sky and so on.

original: de dag phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are not the property of the position.

original: gal te 'dir chos can gyi chos zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dir chos can gyi chos zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: If here one says the property of the subject,

original: de la chos zhes smra bas kyang gzhan la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir chos can don gyis rtogs pas chos chos can la brten pa tsam du grub ste rtogs so //
analyzed: de la chos zhes smra bas kyang gzhan la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir chos can don gyis rtogs pas chos chos can la brten pa tsam du grub ste rtogs so //
translated: then even the proponent of the property, because it depends on another, understands the subject by implication, and thus the property is established as merely dependent on the subject.

original: der chos can zhes smos pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par shugs kyis 'grub po zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: der chos can zhes smos pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par shugs kyis 'grub po zhes sbyar ro //
translated: There, the mention of subject is connected with the meaning the subject to be established is implicitly established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nye ba yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩgtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: nye ba yin pa'i phyir te / gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Because it is close.

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa rgyu yin gyi /
translated: A reason is the cause of the probandum, and it is the cause of the property of the subject that is to be proven.

original: dpe la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir dang / gtan mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dpe la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir dang / gtan mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not the cause of the property of the example, etc., because they are already established and because it is not possible for them to be established.

original: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The property of the example is also close, because

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa de grub pas bsgrub par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa de grub pas bsgrub par nus kyi /
translated: the relation is established by the proof,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin pa de yang dpe la yod pas 'grub pas dpe'i chos can yang 'grub par byed pa'i don gyis nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin pa de yang dpe la yod pas 'grub pas dpe'i chos can yang 'grub par byed pa'i don gyis nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is not established by anything else. Since it is established by the example, the property of the example is also close because it is the meaning of the proof.

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces smras pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can bshad zin pas so //
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces smras pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can bshad zin pas so //
translated: If you say that the property of the example is not close because it is already explained by the statement, ‚ÄúIt exists in the similar class,‚Äù

original: bshad pa byed pa 'di yis te //
analyzed: bshad pa byed pa 'di yis te //
translated: this author

original: chos zhes bya bas chos can rtogs pa la yang chos can smos pas nye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos zhes bya bas chos can rtogs pa la yang chos can smos pas nye ba'i phyir /
translated: says that the property of the subject is also close because the property of the subject is mentioned in the proof of the property of the subject.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos can du grub pa dang / de las yang dpe'i chos nye bar brtsad pa na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'bad pa spang pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos can du grub pa dang / de las yang dpe'i chos nye bar brtsad pa na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ces smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'bad pa spang pa'o //
translated: and the property to be established is established as the subject, and when the property of the example is investigated in that , it is said to exist in the similar class.

original: phyogs zhes smos pas legs par bzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs zhes smos pas legs par bzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúposition,‚Äù it is well established,

original: phyogs kyi yan lag gi chos can no zhes spyi yan lag la btags pas tshigs chung dus rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi yan lag gi chos can no zhes spyi yan lag la btags pas tshigs chung dus rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the property of the position is the subject, and by designating the general property in the part, it is understood with few words.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon nyid kyis /
translated: Thus the master himself says:

original: spyi ni bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: spyi ni bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the general property is the probandum,

original: chos sam yang na chos can ni //üîΩgtso bo ming yang phyogs gcig phyir //
analyzed: chos sam yang na chos can ni // gtso bo ming yang phyogs gcig phyir //
translated: the property or the subject

original: bsgrub bya nyid du nye bar gdags //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du nye bar gdags //
translated: is designated as the chief name, because it is a part of the position,

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te gtan tshigs @251b ni sgrub par byed pa yin la /üîΩde yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // gal te gtan tshigs @251b ni sgrub par byed pa yin la / de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and is designated as the probandum.üîΩIf the reason is the proof,üîΩand that is only the probandum of the subject,

original: sgrub par byed pa yang de'i chos kho nar go'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang de'i chos kho nar go'o //
translated: then the proof is understood only as its property.

original: de'i phyir nye bar gdags par ma bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar gdags par ma bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it should not be designated.

original: don gyis go ba na yang rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba na yang rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: But when the meaning is understood, it is difficult to understand, because it is completely abandoned.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i don gzung na dpe'i chos can la the chom du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i don gzung na dpe'i chos can la the chom du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the meaning of the proof is grasped, there is doubt about the example subject.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa snga mar ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa snga mar ma zad pa'o //
translated: Again means not only the previous purpose.

original: dngos sam brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni med pa las ni mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pa zhes bya ba ni med pa las ni mngon sum du'o //
translated: Directly or indirectly means that from non-existence, it is directly understood.

original: gzhan dag las ni brgyud ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag las ni brgyud ba ste /
translated: From others, it is indirectly understood.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa log pas rtogs med do zhes brgyud pas so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa log pas rtogs med do zhes brgyud pas so //
translated: Because the probandum does not exist, the pervader is reversed, and it is understood indirectly.

original: 'di de kho na nyid ni phyogs la yod pa dang med ba dang gnyi ga yin pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di de kho na nyid ni phyogs la yod pa dang med ba dang gnyi ga yin pa dag go //
translated: This reality is in the position of existence, non-existence, and both,

original: ci rigs par gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par gtan tshigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: as appropriate, in the reason, etc.

original: gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The reason and the apparent reason should be ascertained.

original: cis nges par gzung zhe na ;
analyzed: cis nges par gzung zhe na ;
translated: By what is it ascertained?

original: rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: It establishes one's own realization.

original: phyogs kyis gsum gyi de kho na nyid dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi de kho na nyid gsum gsum dag rang gi de kho na nyid rtogs pa grub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyis gsum gyi de kho na nyid dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi de kho na nyid gsum gsum dag rang gi de kho na nyid rtogs pa grub par byed pa ste /
translated: The three of the subject, the three of the property of the subject, and the three of the forward pervasion and counter pervasion establish the realization of one's own reality.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas nges par gzung bar bya ste ;
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas nges par gzung bar bya ste ;
translated: They should be ascertained by the valid knowledge of direct perception and inference.

original: phyogs kyi chos med dam the tshom za bar tshad mas grub pa ni ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos med dam the tshom za bar tshad mas grub pa ni ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
translated: If the property of the subject is not established or is doubted by valid knowledge, it is an unestablished reason that appears to be a reason.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The opposite of that is a reason.

original: phyogs kyi chos grub pa la tshul lhag ma gnyis ma grub na 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos grub pa la tshul lhag ma gnyis ma grub na 'gal ba'o //
translated: If the property of the subject is established but the remaining two modes are not established, it is contradictory.

original: de gnyis la the tshom za nam nges pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la the tshom za nam nges pa'o //
translated: If there is doubt about those two, it is indefinite.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ma grub pa ni thun mong gi ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ma grub pa ni thun mong gi ma nges pa'o //
translated: If the absence in the discordant side is not established, it is a common indefinite.

original: de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la the tshom za na yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: If there is doubt about that itself, it is indefinite.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag nyes par smra na yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag nyes par smra na yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and the pervasion, and the counter-pervasion, even if they are stated incorrectly, should be understood as ‚Äúapparent reasons.‚Äù

original: ldog pa yin la the tshom dang gcig la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yod pa yang yin pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ldog pa yin la the tshom dang gcig la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yod pa yang yin pa yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: And the counter-pervasion, and the doubt, and the non-establishment of one in the other, even if they are stated incorrectly, should be understood as ‚Äúapparent reasons.‚Äù

original: tshul gsum po dag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba de dag gi de kho na nyid la the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: tshul gsum po dag tshang ba dang ma tshang ba de dag gi de kho na nyid la the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log ste /
translated: The doubt and the error regarding the reality of the three modes when they are complete or incomplete,

original: de kho na ltar ma rtogs pa gang yang gzhan du gnas pa la gzhan du rtogs pa'o //üîΩde lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis ni 'dod pa bsgrub par bya @252a * //
analyzed: de kho na ltar ma rtogs pa gang yang gzhan du gnas pa la gzhan du rtogs pa'o // de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis ni 'dod pa bsgrub par bya @252a * //
translated: and the non-understanding of it just as it is, i.e., the understanding of it in a different way from the way it is,

original: ste grub par ro //
analyzed: ste grub par ro //
translated: are the ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the reason.‚ÄùüîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the thesis‚Äù are the thesis that is not established, the thesis that is contradictory, and the thesis that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the example‚Äù are the example that is not established, the example that is contradictory, and the example that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.

original: mi 'dod ba bsgrub par bya ba ste sun 'byin ba'o mi rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod ba bsgrub par bya ba ste sun 'byin ba'o mi rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.üîΩThe ‚Äúapparent reasons‚Äù that are the ‚Äúfaults of the statement‚Äù are the statement that is not established, the statement that is contradictory, and the statement that is non-evident.

original: ma nges pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par 'grub ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag ni phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par 'grub ste /
translated: The inconclusive is the property of the subject.

original: sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The contradictory and the inconclusive are established as the property of the subject because they are the proof.

original: ma nges pa ni sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconclusive is not able to prove.

original: dgos par mi 'gyur bas ma smos so //
analyzed: dgos par mi 'gyur bas ma smos so //
translated: Since it is not necessary, it is not mentioned.

original: ma grub pa ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: The unestablished is not the property of the subject.

original: ma nges pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ba 'am mad par nges pa ni ltos te /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ba 'am mad par nges pa ni ltos te /
translated: The inconclusive is ascertained as existing or not existing in the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mnyan bya dag dngos po la gcig tu nges pa yin na yang rtogs pa po the tshom za ba'i sgo nas ma nges pa'i skyon du 'gyur la the tshom za ba'i skyon de dngos po la ma nges pa yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mnyan bya dag dngos po la gcig tu nges pa yin na yang rtogs pa po the tshom za ba'i sgo nas ma nges pa'i skyon du 'gyur la the tshom za ba'i skyon de dngos po la ma nges pa yang mtshungs te /
translated: If life and so on and the audible are ascertained as one entity, the fault of inconclusiveness arises from the doubt of the one who understands. The fault of doubt is similar to the inconclusiveness of the entity.

original: skyon de kho nas ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon de kho nas ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that fault alone, it is inconclusive.

original: de de ltar brjod pa yang 'dir sun 'byin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba gang ma nges pa'i bsgrub pa dgod pa la 'di ma des zhes phyir rgol bas brjod na yang sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar brjod pa yang 'dir sun 'byin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba gang ma nges pa'i bsgrub pa dgod pa la 'di ma des zhes phyir rgol bas brjod na yang sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs statement ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù is a refutation.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa phyin ci log tu byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa phyin ci log tu byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: It is not just a mere misrepresentation of the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas nges pa las gzhan du rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gang yang rung ba rtags tshul gnyis sam gcig la the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas nges pa las gzhan du rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gang yang rung ba rtags tshul gnyis sam gcig la the tshom za ba ste /
translated: Any opponent or proponent who doubts either the two modes or one of them with regard to the proof of a thesis that is not ascertained by a valid cognition that establishes one‚Äôs own understanding is called a ‚Äúdoubting opponent.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yin no //
translated: The two modes are with respect to the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: phyogs kyi chos ma grub na ni ma nges pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis smos kyi gsum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ma grub na ni ma nges pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis smos kyi gsum ni ma yin no //
translated: If the property of the position is not established, it is not indeterminate or contradictory, so only two are mentioned, not three.

original: tshul gcig phyin ci log ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par phyin ci log na'o //
analyzed: tshul gcig phyin ci log ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par phyin ci log na'o //
translated: One mode is reversed when it is reversed in the dissimilar class.

original: 'dod ba 'am 'dod pa'i gags de ltar rtogs par byed pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod ba 'am 'dod pa'i gags de ltar rtogs par byed pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to realize the object of desire or the obstacle to desire in that way.üîΩTherefore, this is inconclusive.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ma nges pa'o zhes sun 'byin par smra ba na'ang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ma nges pa'o zhes sun 'byin par smra ba na'ang /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: 'di'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /
translated: This is inconclusive because

original: dper na 'di lta bu'i zhes tshad mas nges pa'i rtags la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di lta bu'i zhes tshad mas nges pa'i rtags la brten pa yin no //
translated: it is based on a reason that is ascertained by valid cognition, such as ‚Äúbecause it is like this.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni sun 'byin pa'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga las ldog par mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni sun 'byin pa'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga las ldog par mi rigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, to prove that listenability is not shared in common, it is said that the reason for the refutation is not tenable in either case.

original: gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur bar mi rigs ba'i @252b phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi dngos pos bsdus pas phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur bar mi rigs ba'i @252b phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi dngos pos bsdus pas phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable to be external to both, because it is included in the categories of permanent and impermanent, there is no other alternative.

original: gal te gcig las tshad mas nges na yang ma nges par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig las tshad mas nges na yang ma nges par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not inconclusive even when ascertained by valid cognition in one way,üîΩthen it is not inconclusive.

original: gcig la yod par rtogs par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gcig la yod par rtogs par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: The proof that it exists in one is the proof that it exists in the similar class.

original: tshad ma yang med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / cig shos lam nges pa yin /
analyzed: tshad ma yang med pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / cig shos lam nges pa yin /
translated: Since there is no valid cognition, there is doubt about the engagement in the dissimilar class and the reversal from the dissimilar class, and so there is no certainty about the probandum and the other.

original: thun mong gi ma nges pa bzhin no zhes bya blta bu'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi ma nges pa bzhin no zhes bya blta bu'o //
translated: It is like the common uncertainty.

original: gzhan las ma yin zhes bya ba skyes bu yon tan mtshungs pa dag las gzhan las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las ma yin zhes bya ba skyes bu yon tan mtshungs pa dag las gzhan las ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not from another means not from another person who is similar in qualities.

original: ji snyed du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: To the extent means as much as the master has said.

original: 'di gnyis gcig tu bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pas bsdus pa dang / gcig tu nges pa log pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gcig tu bsdus pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pas bsdus pa dang / gcig tu nges pa log pa dag go //
translated: These two are combined into one means that the inclusion of permanent and impermanent and the reversal of the definite are combined into one.

original: ldog pa nges na ni phung po gsum pa srid na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa nges na ni phung po gsum pa srid na'o //
translated: If there is certainty of reversal, then a third possibility is possible.

original: khyad par rnam par gcod pa ni rtag ba dang cig shos gnyi ga 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnam par gcod pa ni rtag ba dang cig shos gnyi ga 'gog pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of the distinction is the negation of both permanent and the other.

original: smras pa ni le'u gnyis par ro //
analyzed: smras pa ni le'u gnyis par ro //
translated: The answer is in the second chapter.

original: gal te nges pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gal te nges pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: If it is a definite reason, it is a correct reason.

original: smra ba'i skyon ni rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log la sogs pa smras pas so //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyon ni rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log la sogs pa smras pas so //
translated: The fault of the speaker is stating the pervasion in the opposite way.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtags nye bar smras pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtags nye bar smras pa'o //
translated: And that means stating the correct reason.

original: gcig tu ma nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ni dngos po'i ngo bos ni nges pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu ma nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ni dngos po'i ngo bos ni nges pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not indefinite means that it is not indefinite by the nature of the thing.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it shows the characteristic of the thing.

original: de'i rgyus nges par ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus nges par ma yin te /
translated: It is not definite by that cause,

original: smra ba'i skyon gyis byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smra ba'i skyon gyis byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is made by the fault of the speaker.

original: 'on kyang dngos pos ni ma nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos pos ni ma nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: However, it is not that it becomes indefinite by the thing.

original: 'di'i bsam pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i bsam pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: mnyan par bya ba dang srog la sogs pa rtogs par nges par ma grub kyang dngos po la ni nges pa zhig yod pa'i phyir rtags su 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba dang srog la sogs pa rtogs par nges par ma grub kyang dngos po la ni nges pa zhig yod pa'i phyir rtags su 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: Even though it is not established that hearing and life force are definitely understood, since there is a definite thing, it becomes a reason.

original: gzhan gyis don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i chos nyi tshe la yang dag par brten te'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i chos nyi tshe la yang dag par brten te'o //
translated: The inference for others is based on the mere property of the subject.

original: smra ba'i skyon spangs te pha rol gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin la de yang sgra la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyon spangs te pha rol gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin la de yang sgra la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of causing the other to understand, having abandoned the fault of speech, and that is based on sound.

original: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If it is like that, it is uncertain.

original: 'di'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa yin no //üîΩphyogs kyi chos gcig la ma grub ba 'am zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa yin no // phyogs kyi chos gcig la ma grub ba 'am zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the refutation: ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: gal te ma @253a * //
analyzed: gal te ma @253a * //
translated: As for the property of the subject not being established in one, it is said:üîΩIf it is not established, it is not established in one, so if it is not established, there is doubt.

original: grub ba ni gcig la ma grub pas na ma grub pa yin na the tshom dang / gcig la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yang yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: grub ba ni gcig la ma grub pas na ma grub pa yin na the tshom dang / gcig la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yang yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If it is not established in one, it is also a thing.

original: 'dod pa mi 'thob pas de ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa mi 'thob pas de ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The desire is not obtained, so that is how it is.

original: rgol ba gang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub pa smra pa de la phyir rgol bas 'di'i phyir 'di ma grub po zhes smras nas /
analyzed: rgol ba gang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub pa smra pa de la phyir rgol bas 'di'i phyir 'di ma grub po zhes smras nas /
translated: The opponent who states a reason that is not established for himself is said by the respondent to have a reason that is not established.

original: rgol ba'i 'dod pa dang ste bsgrub par bya ba mi 'tho ba  ste /
analyzed: rgol ba'i 'dod pa dang ste bsgrub par bya ba mi 'tho ba  ste /
translated: The respondent does not accept the proponent‚Äôs thesis,

original: de'i gags su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gags su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obstructed.

original: de ni de lta yin te sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta yin te sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: This is how a respondent is established as a respondent.

original: phyin ci log thob pa med par yang sun 'byin pa yin nam ste sun 'byin pa ni phyir rgol ba mi 'dod par byas pa'am tshul phyin ci log tu byas pa 'ba' zhig yin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log thob pa med par yang sun 'byin pa yin nam ste sun 'byin pa ni phyir rgol ba mi 'dod par byas pa'am tshul phyin ci log tu byas pa 'ba' zhig yin no snyam pa'o //
translated: But is a respondent established as a respondent even without obtaining a misconception? A respondent is one who causes the opponent to not accept or to accept in a distorted way.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i gags byed nus pas sun 'byin par gzhag ste /üîΩ'di ni the tshom za ba'am /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i gags byed nus pas sun 'byin par gzhag ste / 'di ni the tshom za ba'am /
translated: A respondent is posited as a respondent because he is able to obstruct the proof.üîΩIf he says, ‚ÄúI am uncertain,‚Äù

original: gcig la ma grub pa'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: gcig la ma grub pa'o zhes smras na /
translated: or ‚ÄúIt is not established for one of us,‚Äù

original: ngag des gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de'i ngo bor rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i gags byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag des gtan tshigs ltar snang ba de'i ngo bor rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par bya ba'i gags byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that statement is able to obstruct the establishment of the probandum, since it causes one to understand the nature of that fallacious reason.

original: gal te mig gis gzung ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gnyi ga la grub pa las phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis gzung ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gnyi ga la grub pa las phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
translated: If the object of apprehension of the eye is the characteristic of a reason that is established for both, then it is the opposite of that.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba dang gcig la ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba dang gcig la ma grub pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to doubt and non-establishment for one.

original: ma nges pa ni nges pa med pa de'i phyir sgrub pa ni ma yin la de de kho na ltar phyir rgol bas brjod na ni sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni nges pa med pa de'i phyir sgrub pa ni ma yin la de de kho na ltar phyir rgol bas brjod na ni sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúUncertain‚Äù means not ascertained. Therefore, it is not a proof. If the opponent states it in that way, then it is a refutation,

original: phyir rgol ba brjod pa des rgol ba'i 'dod pa la gags nus pas so //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba brjod pa des rgol ba'i 'dod pa la gags nus pas so //
translated: because that statement of the opponent is able to obstruct the proponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: ma grub pa yang de bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag kho na rang gi khyab par byed pa la nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang de bzhin no // de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dag kho na rang gi khyab par byed pa la nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Non-establishment is also like that.

original: gnyi ga sgrub pa yang yin la sun 'byin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga sgrub pa yang yin la sun 'byin pa yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, only reasons and contradictions are proofs and refutations, because they are ascertained with respect to their own pervasions.

original: pha rol gyi 'dod pa la gags nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'dod pa la gags nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is able to obstruct the desire of the opponent.

original: phyogs kyi chos dgur bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang mig gi cha dgur grags pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dgur bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang mig gi cha dgur grags pa'o //
translated: The nine parts of the position are the nine parts of the syllogism, which are well known.

original: de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subject and so forth.

original: 'di dag go rims bzhin du char gong ma dang / bar ma dang tha ma rnams su yi ge'i phreng gi rim pa ltar rim gyis ma 'khrugs par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag go rims bzhin du char gong ma dang / bar ma dang tha ma rnams su yi ge'i phreng gi rim pa ltar rim gyis ma 'khrugs par bri bar bya'o //
translated: These are to be written in order, in the upper, middle, and lower parts, respectively, in the manner of a garland of letters, without confusion.

original: de ltar na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la @253b yod pa dang / med pa dang gnyi ga dag gi dbye ba dang / gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i dbye ba dag cha so sor phye ba rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la @253b yod pa dang / med pa dang gnyi ga dag gi dbye ba dang / gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i dbye ba dag cha so sor phye ba rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one will understand the divisions of the presence and absence of the reason in the similar and dissimilar positions, and both, and the divisions of the contradictory and uncertain reasons, by distinguishing the parts.

original: phreng ba'i lugs dang mthun par brtags pas ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gsum mo //
analyzed: phreng ba'i lugs dang mthun par brtags pas ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gsum mo //
translated: By examining in the manner of a garland, one will understand the three of the similar position, the three of the dissimilar position, and the one of the example.

original: gyen thur du brtags pa gsum gyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gsum mo //
analyzed: gyen thur du brtags pa gsum gyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gsum mo //
translated: The three by way of above and below are the three discordant positions.

original: 'dir phyogs kyi chos kyi tshe dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'dir phyogs kyi chos kyi tshe dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa ni med do //
translated: Here, there is no non-establishment because of the division at the time of the property of the position.

original: steng dang 'og gi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The arguments of above and below.

original: g-yas g-yon dag gis 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon dag gis 'gal ba'o //
translated: The arguments of right and left are contradictory.

original: zur bzhi ni thun mong gi ma nges pa dag go //
analyzed: zur bzhi ni thun mong gi ma nges pa dag go //
translated: The four corners are the common inconclusive.

original: dbus ni thun mong ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: dbus ni thun mong ma yin pa'o ;
translated: The center is the uncommon.

original: / de nyid kyi mtshams dang po dang dbus kyi rtsod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi mtshams dang po dang dbus kyi rtsod pa gnyis so //
translated: The first boundary and the center are the two disputes.

original: mtshams lhag ma gsum gyis ni ldog pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams lhag ma gsum gyis ni ldog pa grub pa'o //
translated: The remaining three boundaries establish the reversal.

original: phyogs bzhi rang bzhin 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi rang bzhin 'bras bu'o //
translated: The four positions are the nature and the effect.

original: gzhal bya byas pa mi rtag pa //
analyzed: gzhal bya byas pa mi rtag pa //
translated: The object of comprehension is the impermanence of the produced.

original: byas pa srog sogs rtsol las skyes //
analyzed: byas pa srog sogs rtsol las skyes //
translated: The produced is born from the effort of life and so forth.

original: mi rtag rtsol dang reg bya min //
analyzed: mi rtag rtsol dang reg bya min //
translated: The impermanent is not effort and not contact.

original: gtan tshigs dgu ru grags pa yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dgu ru grags pa yin //
translated: These are known as the nine reasons.

original: rtag dang mi rtag rtsol 'byung dang // rtag dang bdag bcas rtag nyid dang // rtsol 'byung min dang mi rtag rtag / bsgrub bya'i chos su rab tu grags //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag rtsol 'byung dang // rtag dang bdag bcas rtag nyid dang // rtsol 'byung min dang mi rtag rtag / bsgrub bya'i chos su rab tu grags //
translated: nonarising from effort, eternality, noneternality.

original: zhes bya ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is the verse summary.

original: gtan tshigs med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But isn't it the case that there is no reason? Because even the similar positions become dissimilar positions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gzhan phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gzhan phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa rnams so //
translated: All dharmas refers to the thesis dharma, which has other positions and dissimilar positions.

original: de dag bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because they are different from the thesis,

original: de dang ldan pa'i bye brag de dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i bye brag de dag kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because those distinctions that possess it also become other dissimilar positions.

original: chos gzhan dang ldan pa ni ser skya'am mang du za ba'am /
analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan pa ni ser skya'am mang du za ba'am /
translated: Possessing another dharma means being Kapila, or eating much,

original: ring ba nyid dang ngo //
analyzed: ring ba nyid dang ngo //
translated: or being distant.

original: brjod par 'dod pa bram ze'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa bram ze'i rigs las skyes pa'o //
translated: The one who desires to speak is born in the Brahmin caste.

original: de mi brten te med na 'dod ser skya la sogs pa bram ze las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi brten te med na 'dod ser skya la sogs pa bram ze las gzhan yin pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not the case, then the Brahmin is not a Brahmin, because the Brahmin is different from the Brahmin caste, just as P≈´rana KƒÅ≈õyapa and others are.

original: yul gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In other places means in the similar class, etc.

original: yang na chos gzhan pa dag go //üîΩde ma yin pa'i sgrub pas rnam par phye nas zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i @254a * //
analyzed: yang na chos gzhan pa dag go // de ma yin pa'i sgrub pas rnam par phye nas zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i @254a * //
translated: Or, in other properties.

original: phyogs ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par bstan nas te /
analyzed: phyogs ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par bstan nas te /
translated: Having distinguished by the proof of that means having taught that the dissimilar class is not the similar class.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pas bye brag tu byas nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pas bye brag tu byas nas 'jug ste /
translated: Because the one who desires to speak engages in the proof by distinguishing the property of the probandum as not being possessed.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i phyir de dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid phyogs la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i phyir de dang mi ldan pa'i mtshan nyid phyogs la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that the definition of not possessing that does not exist in the similar class, etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu mi srid ces bya ba ni spyi 'ba' zhig las chos gzhan dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu mi srid ces bya ba ni spyi 'ba' zhig las chos gzhan dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Such a type is impossible means that a universal alone does not possess other properties.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos dang ldan par chos gzhan ma spangs pas mthun pa'i phyogs su byed pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos dang ldan par chos gzhan ma spangs pas mthun pa'i phyogs su byed pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not abandoned by the other property which is possessed by the property to be established, it is made a concordant example.

original: 'on kyang chos des zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des so //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos des zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des so //
translated: However, by that property refers to the property to be established which is the desired conclusion.

original: rtsod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gtan tshigs nyid yin par kha cig 'dod la gzhan ni de 'gogs pas so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gtan tshigs nyid yin par kha cig 'dod la gzhan ni de 'gogs pas so //
translated: As for for the sake of dispute, some assert that this is a reason, while others refute that.

original: de ltar na 'dir kha cig ni rtsod pa med kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir kha cig ni rtsod pa med kyang /
translated: Thus, here, some say, Even though there is no dispute,

original: dgos pa gzhan gyis dper brjod pa yang yod par ston to //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan gyis dper brjod pa yang yod par ston to //
translated: there is also an example which is taught for another purpose.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni sgra mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The cognition which occurs immediately upon effort is the effect of impermanence refers to the effect of the impermanence of sound.

original: 'dir brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pas rgyu mi rtag par grub pas /
analyzed: 'dir brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pas rgyu mi rtag par grub pas /
translated: Here, since the impermanence of the cause is established by the cognition which occurs immediately upon effort,

original: de'i rgyu sgra yang mi rtag par sgrub pas rig byed kyi sgra rtag par smra ba dag gis 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu sgra yang mi rtag par sgrub pas rig byed kyi sgra rtag par smra ba dag gis 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: the cause of that, sound, is also established as impermanent. Thus, those who assert that the sound of the Vedas is permanent ask this question.

original: snga na yod pa la zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i sgra brtsal ma thag pa'i shes pa'i gong nas yod pa'o //
analyzed: snga na yod pa la zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i sgra brtsal ma thag pa'i shes pa'i gong nas yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it existed previously‚Äù means that it existed prior to the cognition that immediately precedes the utterance of the word ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar na sgra rtag tu yod pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu shes pa yang res 'ga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgra rtag tu yod pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu shes pa yang res 'ga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the sound would always exist, its effect, the cognition, would not occur intermittently.

original: gal te rtsol ba las sgra la lhan cig byed pas de'i dbang gis shes pa res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtsol ba las sgra la lhan cig byed pas de'i dbang gis shes pa res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sound is intermittent because of the cooperation of effort, which is the cause of the sound, then the cognition would be intermittent because of the power of that.

original: de la skyes bu'i rkan dang 'dod pa la sogs pas brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la skyes bu'i rkan dang 'dod pa la sogs pas brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that occurs immediately after the effort of the person, the palate, the desire, etc.‚Äù

original: de la nye bar sbyor ba med ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyor ba med ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no application to that‚Äù should be supplied.

original: nye bar sbyor ba 'bras bu nges pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba 'bras bu nges pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the application does not produce a definite effect.

original: gags sam zhes bya ba ni de bsal ba'o //
analyzed: gags sam zhes bya ba ni de bsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúObstruction‚Äù means the removal of that.

original: dbang po la yang nye bar sbyor ba sbyar te /
analyzed: dbang po la yang nye bar sbyor ba sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúApplication to the sense faculty‚Äù should be supplied.

original: des dbang po sbyor bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: des dbang po sbyor bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not apply the sense faculty.

original: gags mi srid pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gags mi srid pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas dmigs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúObstruction is not possible‚Äù means that it is not possible for the cognition to be obstructed.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of its nature of non-apprehension.

original: dum bur mi byed ces bya ba ni thos par rung ba la mi rung bar mi byed na'o //
analyzed: dum bur mi byed ces bya ba ni thos par rung ba la mi rung bar mi byed na'o //
translated: Not making a part means not making what is suitable for hearing unsuitable.

original: cung zad kyang khyad par du byed do zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam pa'i rtsig pas so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang khyad par du byed do zhes bya ba ni dus mnyam pa'i rtsig pas so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that it does not make any difference at all, means that it is the same as the wall.

original: rnam par shes @254b pa'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa phan par byed pas nus pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes @254b pa'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa phan par byed pas nus pa mthar thug par 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: The cause of consciousness means that the object, etc. are helpful, and that they become the ultimate capacity.

original: nye bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni sgra rtag pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni sgra rtag pa'o //
translated: That which is not to be generated is the permanent sound.

original: ltos par mi rigs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltos par mi rigs pa ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
translated: It is not reasonable to rely on the co-operating conditions, means the co-operating conditions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi nus pa'i rang bzhin du rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i rang bzhin du rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its nature of non-capability.

original: lhan cig byed par nus pa can de rnams zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed par nus pa can de rnams zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are capable of co-operating means the impermanent object, sense faculty, etc.

original: gags rtsig pa la sogs pa yod na snang ba zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ram rgyu mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gags rtsig pa la sogs pa yod na snang ba zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir ram rgyu mi nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is an obstruction, such as a wall, then there is no appearance because the cause is not proximate.

original: sngar skyed par nus pa de gags sam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar skyed par nus pa de gags sam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is able to generate previously, then it is able to generate later, because its nature is not impaired.

original: de ma 'gags na gags bya par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma 'gags na gags bya par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not obstructed, then it is able to generate, because it is not able to obstruct if it is not obstructed.

original: de 'gags kyang gags med na yang shes pa skyed nus ba skye ba srid pas gags yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de 'gags kyang gags med na yang shes pa skyed nus ba skye ba srid pas gags yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even if it is obstructed, if there is no obstruction, it is possible that it generates what is able to generate consciousness.

original: rgyu'i 'phen pa zad pas rgyun chad pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i 'phen pa zad pas rgyun chad pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it says ‚Äúif there is an obstruction,‚Äù and one should understand that the continuum is severed by the exhaustion of the impetus of the cause.üîΩBecause its nature is not impaired.üîΩIf it is able to obstruct, then it does not have the nature of potentiality.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nus pa de'i gags bya bar mi nus te nus pa'i rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nus pa de'i gags bya bar mi nus te nus pa'i rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its nature is not impaired.

original: gags bya bar nus na ni nus pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //üîΩde'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa'i tshe yang nus pa'i rang bzhin ma nyams ba ste /
analyzed: gags bya bar nus na ni nus pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no //üîΩde'i rang bzhin ma nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gags byed pa'i tshe yang nus pa'i rang bzhin ma nyams ba ste /
translated: Even when it obstructs, the nature of potentiality is not impaired.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nus pa grub pa ni yang mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nus pa grub pa ni yang mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the nature of an entity, once established, cannot be otherwise.

original: mi rtag pa dag kyang grub pa'i rang bzhin bzlog tu mi rung na rtag pa lta ga la rung /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dag kyang grub pa'i rang bzhin bzlog tu mi rung na rtag pa lta ga la rung /
translated: And if impermanent entities cannot be turned back from their established nature, how much less can permanent ones?

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtag pa gzhan te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtag pa gzhan te /
translated: ‚Äú Again‚Äù refers to another alternative.

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of momentariness is impermanence, such as a pot, etc.

original: phan tshun de rtsig pas kyang bum pa'i nye bar len pa dang lhan cig shes pa mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa nyid du srid pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun de rtsig pas kyang bum pa'i nye bar len pa dang lhan cig shes pa mi skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa nyid du srid pa'o //
translated: Even though they are mutually different, it is possible that a pot-moment, which has a nature that does not produce a cognition simultaneously with the apprehension of the pot, produces another pot-moment.

original: des na sgrib pa las rang bzhin dum bur byed do //
analyzed: des na sgrib pa las rang bzhin dum bur byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the nature of an entity is divided by obstruction.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa las gzhan du khyad par mi byed na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa las gzhan du khyad par mi byed na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means that if it does not make a difference, then it is not different.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed na ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la lhan cig byed pas khyad par du mi byed na'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed na ni zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la lhan cig byed pas khyad par du mi byed na'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it does not do anything at all‚Äù means that if it does not make a difference by being a cooperative condition of a pot, etc.

original: de ltar gags rtag par 'gyur te gags mi byed pas so //
analyzed: de ltar gags rtag par 'gyur te gags mi byed pas so //
translated: Thus, the obstruction would be permanent, because it does not obstruct.

original: rtag pas de bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni gags rtag pas so //
analyzed: rtag pas de bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni gags rtag pas so //
translated: If you say that it is not so because of the permanence of the obstruction,

original: de lta bu med de zhes bya ba ni shes pas res 'ga' dmigs pa'i @255a * //üîΩphyir ro ; / des khyad par du byed pa can du rtogs so zhes bya ba ni gags kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bu med de zhes bya ba ni shes pas res 'ga' dmigs pa'i @255a * // phyir ro ; / des khyad par du byed pa can du rtogs so zhes bya ba ni gags kyis so //
translated: we reply: that is not so, because consciousness sometimes does not perceive.üîΩIt is understood that the obstruction is the cause of the difference,üîΩbecause the difference is obtained from the object.

original: don de las thob pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i don de las thob pa'i khyad par de /
analyzed: don de las thob pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i don de las thob pa'i khyad par de /
translated: The difference is obtained from the object that is the cooperative condition.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu nye bar sbyor te skyed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu nye bar sbyor te skyed do zhes zer ro //
translated: It is the natural result that is connected to, that is produced by, the obstruction.

original: gyis shig ste khyod nyid kyis rtag par 'dod pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gyis shig ste khyod nyid kyis rtag par 'dod pa nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: You should do so, because you yourself would lose your belief in permanence.

original: 'bras bu cung zad byed na sgra de sngar gyi ste phan pa ma byas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu cung zad byed na sgra de sngar gyi ste phan pa ma byas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: If the sound produces a little effect, then the sound is not permanent, because it has a nature that does not always help.

original: nges ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: nges ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainly‚Äù means ‚Äúpermanently.‚Äù

original: mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be‚Äù means it would not exist.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa de'i phan pa sgra las don gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa de'i phan pa sgra las don gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the benefit of the sound is something other than the sound,

original: de'i phan pa don gzhan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phan pa don gzhan pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe benefit of that would be something other than the sound itself.‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes bya ba phan pa don gzhan de las shes ba skye pa la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba phan pa don gzhan de las shes ba skye pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the arising of the cognition from that benefit that is something other than the sound.

original: de shes pa ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sgra de shes pa des shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de shes pa ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sgra de shes pa des shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat cognition would not be of the sound‚Äù means that cognition of the sound would not be of the sound.

original: sgra las gzhan pa'i phan pa dang 'brel gyi sgra dang ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sgra las gzhan pa'i phan pa dang 'brel gyi sgra dang ni ma yin pas so //
translated: This is because the benefit that is something other than the sound is related to the cognition, but the sound is not.

original: dbang po 'am nye ba dag la lhan cig byed par ltos pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang po 'am nye ba dag la lhan cig byed par ltos pa ma yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sound is dependent on the sense faculty or its proximity‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: bdag gam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par te rang las tha dad pa'i khyad par gyis ni rtag pa la khyad par mi skyed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid las tha dad pa yang mi srid pas so ;
analyzed: bdag gam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par te rang las tha dad pa'i khyad par gyis ni rtag pa la khyad par mi skyed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid las tha dad pa yang mi srid pas so ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe self‚Äù is a particular of the self. This is because a particular that is different from itself does not produce a particular in a permanent phenomenon, and it is impossible for it to be different from itself.

original: / gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni snga ma dag las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: / gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni snga ma dag las gzhan pa ste /
translated: Also means other than the former,

original: skyes bu'i rtsol ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsol ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: that is, human effort, etc.

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pas so //
translated: All means the sense faculties, etc.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra nyid la nye bar sbyor ba mi rigs par bshad pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra nyid la nye bar sbyor ba mi rigs par bshad pa dag gis so //
translated: By them means by those that have been explained as not logically possible to be applied to sound itself.

original: sgra 'am dbang po zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig po ma yin gyi dbang po dag la rtsol ba la sogs pas phan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra 'am dbang po zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig po ma yin gyi dbang po dag la rtsol ba la sogs pas phan par byed pa'o //
translated: Sound or the sense faculties means not only sound, but also the sense faculties, etc., which assist by human effort, etc.

original: lhan cig byed par nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni phan pas byas pa'i dbang pos sgra la lhan cig byed par nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed par nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba ni phan pas byas pa'i dbang pos sgra la lhan cig byed par nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are applied as co-operating causes means that the sense faculties, which are assisted, become applied as co-operating causes for sound,

original: ma sbyar na dbang po dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma sbyar na dbang po dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without application, the sense faculties would be purposeless.

original: rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyu nus pa skye ba dang nyams ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyu nus pa skye ba dang nyams ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would always be apprehended means that the arising and decline of the potential cause of cognition would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba dang nyams pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba dang nyams pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no arising or degeneration?

original: 'di ltar gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is thus.

original: sgra ni rtag pa nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa nyid du 'dod la /
translated: Sound is asserted to be permanent.

original: de ni gang las kyang nus pa 'thob pa pa 'am nyams pa med na rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gang las kyang nus pa 'thob pa pa 'am nyams pa med na rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not obtain or lose its potency from anything, it is permanent.

original: gal @255b te nus pa sgra las don gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal @255b te nus pa sgra las don gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that potency is different from sound,

original: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe so-called potency that produces cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: don med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rtag pa gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rtag pa gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMeaningless‚Äù means that because permanent sound does not depend on anything else, it is meaningless.

original: don gzhan pa nyid kyi skyon ni sngar bshad pa ltar don gzhan de dang shes par 'brel gyi sgra sgra dang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de shes pas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan pa nyid kyi skyon ni sngar bshad pa ltar don gzhan de dang shes par 'brel gyi sgra sgra dang ma yin pa'i phyir sgra de shes pas mi shes pa'o //
translated: The error of being different from the object is as explained earlier. That object is related to cognition, but sound is not. Therefore sound is not cognized by that cognition.

original: 'bad pa ma byas sam 'bad pa rdzogs te rgyun chad na'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ma byas sam 'bad pa rdzogs te rgyun chad na'o //
translated: When effort is not made or when effort is completed and ceases.

original: res 'ga' yang sgra dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: res 'ga' yang sgra dmigs pa med do //
translated: Sound is never observed.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis dang ldan pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of having two observations.

original: de'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid las zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang gi ngo bo la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its own nature‚Äù means from the nature of the sound itself.

original: phan pa 'ga' zhig srid de zhes bya ba ni rtsol bas so //
analyzed: phan pa 'ga' zhig srid de zhes bya ba ni rtsol bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSome benefit is possible‚Äù means by effort.

original: rgyu'i chos mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the cause is seen‚Äù means because of the concomitance and reverse concomitance just explained.

original: gal te de ltar na rtsol ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas mi rtag par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rtsol ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas mi rtag par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, then impermanence would follow from effort,

original: shes pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not from consciousness.

original: rtsol ma thag tu shes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: rtsol ma thag tu shes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe consciousness that arises immediately after effort.‚Äù

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir zhes rtags su byed kyi shes pa tsam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir zhes rtags su byed kyi shes pa tsam du ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is because the consciousness that arises immediately after effort exists, but not just consciousness.

original: de yang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba sgra la dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba sgra la dmigs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that means the consciousness that observes the sound that arises immediately after the effort.

original: de yang sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ltar shes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ltar shes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: And that is like the sound that arises immediately after the effort, so is the consciousness.

original: sngar yod nges pa nyid kyis ming //
analyzed: sngar yod nges pa nyid kyis ming //
translated: The name is definitely due to prior existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las sngar yong par nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las sngar yong par nges pa ste /
translated: This is the certainty that sound exists prior to its being sought.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi sgra shes pa skyes pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi sgra shes pa skyes pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúpermanently‚Äù is not a cause for the arising of the cognition.

original: gags dang dbang po dag la lhan cig byas pas phan pa srid kyang sgra rtag pa la ni gang gis kyang bye brag tu mi byed do //
analyzed: gags dang dbang po dag la lhan cig byas pas phan pa srid kyang sgra rtag pa la ni gang gis kyang bye brag tu mi byed do //
translated: Although it is possible that the sense faculty and the absence of an obstruction are cooperating conditions for sound, nothing can make a permanent sound.

original: de'i gags bsal ba dang / dbang po la phan btags pa gang la yang ltos pa med pa'i sgra res 'ga' yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gags bsal ba dang / dbang po la phan btags pa gang la yang ltos pa med pa'i sgra res 'ga' yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa mi byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a sound that does not depend on the removal of an obstruction or the assistance of a sense faculty to sometimes produce the effect of a cognition.

original: shes pa 'di 'dra ba ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba 'am res 'ga' ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di 'dra ba ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba 'am res 'ga' ba'o //
translated: This kind of cognition arises immediately after the seeking of sound or it does not arise.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthese‚Äù refers to impermanent sounds.

original: dpe'i yul la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba'i dper brjod pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: dpe'i yul la zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba'i dper brjod pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the domain of the example‚Äù means in the domain of the example that is derived from seeking.

original: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the nature of‚Äù means in the nature of an inference based on the nature of things.

original: gal te 'o na gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhy are the object of comprehension, etc., taught?‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgtan tshigs dang @256a * //üîΩder snang ba dag go //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te / gtan tshigs dang @256a * // der snang ba dag go //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn order to understand the reason in particular.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.

original: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin la /üîΩde dag ma tshang ba ni ci rigs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //üîΩbye brag rtogs par bya ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par bshad pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin la / de dag ma tshang ba ni ci rigs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o // bye brag rtogs par bya ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ;
translated: The reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.üîΩThe reason is the three characteristics of the reason explained in the inference for oneself.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags kyi dper brjod pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags kyi dper brjod pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa'o //
